one_reviews_text: This Oculus Quest 2 is just AMAZING. So breath taking. I love how everything is set up so nice and integrated inside the VR Headset. the sound on this is super amazing but if you want the true experience i recommend a good Headset. I use the Arctis 7P+ wireless headset and its nice. the sound, the Dolby and the movements just feels so smooth. i recommend it. the rollercoaster is far my all time favorite, i love how everything is just so organized. movies on this like YouTube, Netflix will blow your mind out the water. connecting to my pc and steam is a huge plus and over 1000 plus vr games . <3 the only 1 dislike i don't like at all about this headset, is the battery life but that's okay with me because its already Off the Charts of being the best headset Of 2022. Nico :)

I havent felt this way since I've played on an N64, back in 1996, navigating through a 3D environment. The Quest 2 is what I've been looking for. I've been playing video games since I was 4. Started on Atari 2600. I own a variety of handheld games and consoles. The Quest immerses your mind into a fantasy world of your choice. By far the best VR game I have played is Resident Evil 4. You can also watch movies on it with Amazon Prime, youtube VR, Netflix apps. You can adjust how big you want the screen to be. You can remote connect to your PC/laptop, access a web browser and there are facebook and instagram apps you can install just to name a few. I carry this thing on me like a cell phone. When I'm stuck in traffic I'll pull over and watch a movie, catch up on life, play some games all while chilling in the back of my scion XB (windows are tinted pretty good. DO NOT PLAY OUTSIDE IN THE SUNLIGHT as it can damage your device. I often spend time in random metaverses such as Facebook's Horizon, Alt Chat, VR chat and hang out with random people.

When you watch someone play a game on the oculus you’re like “oh nice” but when you turn it on it feels so real and there are tons of free games that are so fun, there are places where you can be one person and another one in the next.

It’s impressive how much it can offer for such a low price. Have issues like low resolution screens and even lower resolution offered to us when playing games or workout apps to the point that I was thinking if person in front of me didn’t just came out of Minecraft and trying to teach me how to break blocks with gloves. Sometimes guardian was following me instead of being in one place.. very frustrating. More and more things that are bad like small Field of view or not intuitive adjustment for lenses that are also getting foggy extremely quickly for me. Nevertheless that might be like nothing to many people. I could live with all of that because the thing is incredibly powerful and outstanding for the price with hands training, mixed reality, holograms or just flexibility with the chip already inside that can handle a lot. I just couldn’t find time or space so decided to return. Overall I would feel bad to give it less than 5 stars. Well deserved.

Honestly, I bought my Quest 2 off of a limb, I wanted the PS5 but at the time it was hard to acquire so I ended up impulse buying a Quest 2, I do not regret it one bit! I think one thing that I overlooked was that you have to try to fit the glasses in the Quest 2, which is difficult for me because I wear a large frame, or wear contacts. Initially, I used contact lenses to see while using the Quest 2 but after a while it bothered me that I always had to put my contacts on every time I wanted to play because I don't like wearing contacts. One day I was doing some google searches for an alternative and VR WAVE was there to answer my questions! I sent in my prescription for VR WAVE lenses and I have been playing nonstop since! They give you a whole kit to test the blue light through the lenses they send, a card with your prescription on it so you know its your pair, a case for safe traveling, and lens cleaners. They were as much as regular glasses and I don't regret the purchase.

One of a kind experience at a much lower cost than the similar alternatives. I would recommend this product to anyone that enjoys gaming, is looking for a way to get some light exercise at home and in a fun way, or is just interested in experiencing something new.

This is the best VR headset out there. Easy to set up. Lots of fun for all ages. If you are brand new to VR, try to ween your self on to it, playing more and more at a time. If not, you could get motion sickness.

About 7 months back I purchased Oculus Quest 2. The headset's build quality, resolution and technical specs are perfect. However, I did not enjoy the VR experience initially since I wear eyeglasses and it's really annoying to wear glasses while using a VR headset or wearing contact lenses! But during the Christmas holidays, I came across a cool thing! It is a prescription glasses for Oculus Quest - 2 by VR Wave. Out of curiosity I explored it further and finally ordered a pair. It comes with a EVA case, adapter and of course prescription glasses! Its adapter perfectly fits upon Oculus Quest 2 lenses (installation of VR Wave prescription glasses was super easy!). Also, the adapter comes with the tiny magnets to hold the prescription glasses. After that I simply placed prescription glasses upon it. That's it! The prescription lenses made my VR experience super smooth. Now, I don't need to worry about obstruction of eyeglasses and I can truly enjoy the VR experience. The VR Wave prescription glasses come with Anti Blue light coating. It really helps avoid eye strain and fatigue after long usage of Oculus Quest.
Excellent  play is very good.  I like . Is good for the kid and adult

This is unlike any gaming experience I’ve ever had. I am more in awe than i was with my first NES system as a kid. Hands down one of the most awesome electronic purchases I’ve ever made. We bought it the day before thanksgiving for Christmas but couldn’t wait. We opened it that night. NO REGRETS!!! The entire family from my 4 year old daughter to my 80 year old dad had a blast on Thanksgiving. Plus we got a $50 gift card that paid half of another gift we bought the same day. BUY THIS!!! If you are on the fence you won’t regret it.

First off the image is NOT completely clear....images are still tiny bit blurry....A new technology should also protect our precious eyes...NOT damaging it...just after a few minutes of use I noticed a slight headache...Eye strain is THE MOST important issue with VR that needs to be solved.

second of all, oculus gets foggy..i have to clean the inside constantly so I can see clearly.

Thirdly..it weighs a lot on the head...it does not feel comfortable on face. it should not feel so heavy on the head.

And lastly, a few free games would be nice..without creating these annoying accounts and paying for some sample games....I was NOT able to enjoy one single game....

Super easy set up, but you currently have to have a Facebook account in order to use it. The packaging is uncluttered and takes very few steps to get up and running. It's quite comfortable for a computer strapped to your face, but be aware that you can find yourself leaning forward and putting more strain on your neck. I know myself well enough to not play some of the more nausea-inducing games, but it is definitely a very real personal issue to think about before buying. The visual quality is fantastic and you really feel immersed in game! I'm so happy with this purchase and look forward to more "large world" games to play on it. It would be nice if it had foot sensor to use for dancing games etc. and get a better workout. Headset requires charging after a few hours. Controller last much longer, haven't died yet.

Gotta say I'm pretty impressed with my oculus probably the most fun iv had with gaming in years with most AAA titles not living up to the old standards I've decided to look elsewhere for entertainment. Boy did I find it with hour's already sunk into blade and sorcery,Boneworks & of course I had to try beat saber and yes I did enjoy it xD  iv tried all these titles on airlink and link cable so whatever you favor will work.  But all in all if smashing heads or choping blocks don't interest you iv also just downloaded half life Alex you can see my live gameplay and updated review on my twitch stream ALargeCupOfJava

I was a little hesitant to purchasing this since I had never experienced anything related to VR and I've gotta say the Quest 2 is amazing! If you're like me who never experienced VR and want to try it for a good price look no further. Very beginner friendly and tons of fun games and apps on it. Overall amazing product and would strongly recommend!

Pros: Good Value

Cons: Locked to Facebook Account

The oculus quest 2 is the perfect Gaming device, it is portable (mostly) and it being wireless is a definite plus I must add. The realism you experience while using the oculus is literally insane and unimaginable. The quest 2 is a must get for sure.
I love my oculus. Instantly when you put them on you go into a totally different world. Its really hard to expin with words how amazing this product is. I got one for me and my sister. I love it
omg this game is great i brought this as a gift for my 8 year old son an i think i play it more then he do it’s really fun it keeps me on my feet for sure an it’s worth every penny
The Oculus 2 VR is hands down a great gaming experience. We are moving into the Meta Verse without looking back. I would recommend the product or maybe two for the family !!!!!!
If your looking for an immersive experience playing games, movies and even browsing the inteenet this is the device for you. Trust you will be happy with your purchase!

I love this!!!! My only regret is not getting it earlier. I put off getting a VR headset for way too long! I finally decided to go for the Oculus Quest 2 mainly because I liked the idea of needing to be tethered to a computer or a console and some games can even be played without an internet connection! So I can pack this little guy in a backpack and play anywhere anytime! The very first game I purchased and played was Beat Saber, which I had been wanting to ply for a long time. I’ve only played a few other games, but the experience of VR is incredibly cool! It’s completely different from playing console games with a controller in front of a tv!

Great product. Definitely the best stand alone VR in the market today. Have games for all ages, and was a hit in gatherings/parties. 

Casual Use 5/5- fun party games. (Plank Experience, boxing etc.)

Competitive 4/5- good competitive games like Pavlov, Population One, Echo VR. Deducted 1 point due to early game lobbies being full of kids, not a big deal for casual Play. 

Fitness 5/5- surprisingly a great workout equipment. Games like the boxing game, and other workout games gets you sweating and moving. 

Overall, great purchase and definitely the best standalone VR
This oculus has provided me a home theater, a fun workout machine, and an immersive experience I love it so much and use it everyday even at work
Got this for my grandchildren for Christmas and they love it !!!!  It was the life of the party and i can't wait to get one for myself lol !!!
Ohhhhh boy the bes Christmas gift a ole lady could receive. I am 62 and in love this thing keep me moving and up half the night lol .

When I got a gaming pc back in October, there was one thing missing that would've made my experience way more awesome and it was a VR headset. I heard a lot of bad stuff from Oculus and Facebook, especially refurbished products. This came in brand new and working like as if it was never used! Everything from setup to linking on my PC and has fanstatic visual quality. I haven't been so amazed by technology since the Wii came out and this was a lot of fun to use and has plenty of games for the PC via Link cable and the quest itself. I highly recommend this storage space if you plan on playing for Steam or just solely for Resident Evil 4 VR.
This is a great product it is easy to setup and was easy to biy games off the oculus app
Great VR game! I purchased two Quest2  Oculus  gaming systems. I play with my family
This thing is amazing worth every penny just go a head and buy it.
The package was hit but luckily the product is fine and works well
My kids love thier new VR Headset and we love to play it too.

As for all the affordable yet just about powerful virtual reality headsets I’ve been searching for, the Oculus Quest 2 has a fine line of not having cheap quality material for the headset. The revision of the Oculus Quest 2 not only changed the standard storage(used to be 64GB) to 128GB, but also offers a new silicone face interface that provides a little more comfortability and prevents any sweat from entering the fabric of the Oculus. All for the same price of $300. Any extra peripherals or equipment for the Quest 2 is up to you, but the Oculus Quest 2 is a great budget friendly Virtual Reality headset that (possibly) money could buy.

After having a Samsung Gear VR a few years back that would overheat and draun the battery quickly, this was my first real dedicated VR purchase.  So far i have enjoyed the experience.  I wear glasses so i was concernened it would be uncomfortable or blurry/out of focus but the headset is very comfortable once everything is adjusted.  There are different focus settings for those who wear glasses. I also purchased the upgraded head strap and a pair of headphones which i highly recommend.  The setup was easy and interface is pretty good.  Lots of content and games to choose from.  The battery life has been decent and overall i am happy with the purchase.

I would actually rate this about 4 1/2 stars if I could. This is a ton of fun, both for me and my kids (8-14). The first won I bought had a pixel out which showed a line down the screen. Swapped it out at a store with another new working model. It's very easy to setup and there are some great games from oculus. The Vader Immortal ones are awesome! Beat Saber is a great workout. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because it's very easy for the lenses to fog up with glasses on and the videos and graphics are not quite HD just yet. Granted this is a "budget" standalone VR system, but still noticeable for a gamer like me. Highly recommended though.

This is the best blend of price/performance in the VR space right now. Coupled with the fact that it's wireless, doesn't require the use of an expensive computer (with a pricey GPU), and is 1/3 the price of the Valve Index, makes this a no brainer if you love VR! that said, it has it's quirks. The seal on the face shield keeps in a ton of sweat, which fogs up my screen. The battery covers on the handles tend to come loose (Electrical tap is your friend). Also, there is a small persistent blur that I didn't notice till after the headset was past the return window... It's a clear win, but it could have been perfect with a little more product development!

It is a very fun device to play. Totaly makes you feel like you are in the game or the experience. It does take some getting used to. Did a roller coaster simulation and while it was very fun to watch it did make me feel nauseous. You see all the movement but you dont feel anything. Makes your brain confused!! Still after some time you get the hang of it and its not so bad. Its still a fairly new tech and game developers havent quite mastered making it look like an xbox or Playstation game, but give it time and they will, some of you will remember atari...it can only get better, and for what they have I'd say its pretty dang good.

You will know once you try it.

It out performs the PlayStation VR in my opinion, the controls are snappy, and the audio built-in to the headset is nothing less of amazing.

You could connect this onto a PC and play pc be games vía wifi or a cable link. PS you need an expensive wifi six router if you wanna do this. The good routers cost around 250 bucks. Still recommend.

This product is perfect if you don’t want to have issues with wires, don’t have a powerful pc, wanna play in your backyard or at a park, and have a unique  VR  Experience.

The oculus headset is a good item to get.It is really fun. You can use it to work out, play and learn. There are some problems to this item. When im making my gaurdian when i try to make a big gaurdian and make it around the items in my room It keeps making me turn to a stationary gaurdian instead of a roomscale. Also, when I take a break and set my oculus on the ground, then return to pick it up, it says the tracking is off. Then, I need to quit the app but it wont turn my controllers on nor allow me to quit. So, I have to restart my oculus. Other than that, the Oculus Quest 2 is a great gaming system to have and I recommend it.

This is great for so many reasons. You can do so much on this - games, tv, work, and chat.  It's great for all ages but would recommend doing your research because there are so many things you can do with it - however, you have to purchase games online so look for deals. We saw there is a 2 week return option if you play a game for less than 2 hours, which is nice.  This is used by our family between the ages of 5-47. Headset fits all of us and can be adjusted although we may look into additional add-on to get the best fit. Still trying to figure out best way to use if wearing glasses. Only downside, wish this were more cost-effective.....handle with care.

The item arrived on time, no delays. The package was well done and felt very safe for what was inside.

Connecting the headset to Wi-Fi and starting up + playing a game was like breeze. There is no detailed user manual but there is a start-up document inside the package. There is a small booklet which explains about the headset but I am not sure if that will help to deal with any problems connecting to your internet and playing games. But there are a ton of resources online to assist with this

Overall I am giving it a 5-star rating. The experience is amazing, although it could be a little stressful to the eyes and will get used to it after couple of times.

I bought this VR headset with pretty low expectations. My daughter wanted it for her birthday so I got one today and set it up for her. I could immediately feel the quality of this device and when I put it on and went through the set up for her I was blown away at the imersiveness... and that was just the set up. We got in to it and I found the safety features were amazing. I am happy that my girl wont be walking in to a wall or bumping in to objects because the system wont let you. Well worth the money and I immediately went online and purchased another one for me and my son. Major take away here is that this thing is Amazing.

Ever since I purchased and used my Oculus Quest 2 for the first time, I've had no problems and it performs the way it is supposed to. The headset and controllers all feel great and I really like the silicone cover that they provide because it doesn't suck up all the sweat that leaks from my head. Quality is amazing as it was described and every time I play a game like vacation simulator or beat saber, I am very immersed and having fun. There is only one major downside that is related to the head strap which is the eventual pain in the back of my head when the headset is on too long. This is solely due to the plastic strips that tighten the back strap which dig into my head (this is where it is useful to buy a 3rd party head strap to help).

Over all it’s a great experience. Hardware is built great and efficient when it comes to how much tech is crammed in a small piece. Learning curve is low-mild if you consider your hand and eye coordination to be good. To avoid motion sickness start with easier games and build your tolerance. If you wear eye glasses, you’ll have to make due with blurry vision unless you pick up 3rd party head piece. You have about 25-30 mins before Headset become uncomfortable. Head seats last about 1.5-2hrs depending how intense the game is. Be Prepared to dish out Facebook info and a healthy amount of cash for games. Don’t get discouraged, different games are on sale everyday.

I've purchased two of these devices and they are a hit in my home. I have five children that use the devices and they have a blast. 

I have special needs children that are able to use the device. It's very durable against accidental drops and easy to figure out how to use for playing games.

Lot's of free games to choose from and great games that you can also purchase.

I haven't tried everything out but I did see where the device's can invite friend's to join games through Facebook messenger.

I'm sure I'm forgetting something but I would definitely recommemd. It's a solid investment if you have gamer children like mine.

I've been reading about VR since the early Rift days and of course seen it concept within movies so my expectations were quite high. As earlier versions required a PC with just a little more graphics power than I possessed it was always just out of reach for me. This stand alone unit EXCEEDED my expectations! You are literally immersed in the situation presented to you. The fact that it can also be connected to a worthy PC to play VR games on Steam is a major plus. A mandatory Facebook account may be an anti-draw for some and a 2 hour battery life per session could be improved upon (more battery = more weight) all I can say is well done Oculus! Wonderful product.

The Quest 2 for the price is well worth it and a great first VR experience. It has a lot of flexibility going for it given you can use it wirelessly, even when playing PCVR games (get the virtual desktop app for this). I really don't have much complaints. The strap that comes with it isn't great, so make sure to look around for good 3rd party options.

The only major consideration I recommend keeping in mind is how you feel about facebook and privacy. That being said the facebook account requirement *should* be disappearing soon.

I bought this product because I saw an ad on Facebook and it looked like a fun way to get some exercise. I am not technologically savvy and I didn't know much about it. I do very much enjoy the machine and use it with one of the exercise apps that I purchased. 
I just want to point out two cons about it: 1) you by force have to have a Facebook account in order to use it, 2) it is very heavy on your face while using it--I can't imagine that's good for things like avoiding wrinkles and lines. This forces you to do whatever you can to strap that thing up right. I hope Facebook can work on creating a lighter machine that doesn't put all that weight entirely on your face.
Its absolutely terrible. I hate it so much. Im just kidding, I love this device so much and is totally worth every penny. it is a MUST BUY and will definitely recommend to everyone I know!

Required some tinkering to get it working right. Fot first time customers, I recommend experimenting with different areas and headstrap adjustment until it is optimal. Remember to make your playspace bright, I find that sunlight works much better than lighting an area. At certain times, the Oculus seems nearly unusable because of how buggy and slow it can be. But to get the full experience, I highly recommend getting a link cable, and don't be daunted by the high price, plenty are available in different connections and cheaper prices. If you plan playing for long periods of time, I heard the elite strap is worth it.

The graphics on certain games are good enough it really does feel like you're in a virtual reality. Then you have games that are very arcadish and feel like you're in the early 00s. Its a fun experience at first but if it weren't a gift for my kid then I don't think I'd ever spend the money on it.

The games are expensive, you're integrated with Facebook and so like everything with Facebook it almost forces you to be social. You can not turn off friend requests so its a bit harder to keep up with what your kid is doing on the oculus aside from if you set it up on your phone then you can monitor texts and friend requests from the app without needing access to the headset.

I have always been a gamer, but I was skeptic of VR since the technology wasn't great or you needed a wire plugged into the device. I finally decided to get the Oculus Quest 2 and I can say, VR has gone a Loooong way! It was way better than expected! Battery lasts about 2 hours (about 70 if you are casting video to a TV), being a stand alone that needs no cables makes the experience much better. I even had my wife play and enjoy playing even when she usually doesn't like videogames. The downside, original accessories are expensive, the game selection is still limited, and you are forced to use a Facebook account.

The whole family enjoys gaming on this, from the youngest to the oldest.  It goes beyond traditional console-controller gaming and gives more interesting, well-designed experiences.

I hate that it requires a Facebook account to work, but keep in mind that you can create a Facebook account without any personal information besides your email and your billing address.  You only need to the install the Oculus Store app, you can leave the Facebook app off your devices.  The Oculus experience is wonderful in single-player mode.  It's an escape - I don't want anyone else in there with me.  Keep the social garbage away!

I bought the first one two years ago! This device is AWESOME!!! I’ve bought 5 in total for birthday and Christmas gifts for my niece and grand children. We have so much fun together! There are so many things to do together with them even though we don’t live near each other! We fish, kill zombies, go on trips around the world, explore the universe, oh and we play a lot of Beat Saber! The only thing that I recommend is buying another head strap and the Oculus Link Cable for continuous play, it’s well worth the $80, other than that, this is a high quality piece of equipment! You should absolutely get one. Or two!!

I was blown away from the moment I was setting up the oculus. That itself was mind blowing because it was my first time using a legit VR device. This isn’t like those VR in arcades. I’ve had this for months and i have yet to buy a game because I’ve been enjoying the scenes of 360 video on YouTube and any videos with VR compatibility. The only thing i can say is that im always busy, so i don't really have a lot of time to use it, but when i do, it's never a dull moment. Games are not expensive as console games. My favorite part is that it really does seem like your there. It’s mind boggling. A great pass time.

Easily the best VR headset on the market at the moment for the price. 

The visuals are amazing, the build quality is excellent, the controllers feel intuitive, and the overall experience is one of a kind. 

Coming from a Rift S, this is a massive upgrade in every way. For one, the fact that you don't have to deal with wires even if you are playing PCVR titles is excellent. Also, the extra features such as 120hz and hand tracking are the cherry on top.

Lastly, if I had to name my main complaints, then it would be the battery and the strap. The battery life is only about 2 hrs or so if you are only gaming. As for the headstrap, it's not the most comfortable out there and it doesn't stay in place very well. Luckily, there are plenty of aftermarket headstraps with batteries that fix both problems simultaneously (I bought one myself).

Took a little while to get used to, but after a week or so the motion sickness sent away. Now I can use it for hours and still feel fine. Good range of games are available, and the 3D effect is amazing. If you attach it to your PC you will need at least a GTX1070. I tried using it in a machine with a GTX970 and it was not good. My other machine with a GTX1070 managed to get decent frame rates. Is a little heavy at the front and you might want to add a weight at the back to offset. I know you can buy an official Quest one, but I found an old Walkman gathering dust that fit the bill perfectly. Overall I highly recommend this, especially as it is so much cheaper than the alternatives.

I've messed with some VR headsets that you would use for your phone, but this was definitely worth saving up for. I've wanted to get VR headsets in the past, but they required the room to be set up with motion sensors. But now, the Oculus has become advanced enough to not need any extra sensors to install, and it's super portable and easy to use! I've been having so much fun using it and interacting with friends from afar. It's an extraordinary experience that immerses you into a virtual world in which you can connect with those from different parts of the globe as if they were in the same room as you.

Thought the Oculus was going to be a gimmick, but after finally trying one for several hours I was sold.
Besides games there's a lot of other things you can do with the Oculus. There's 3D movies, 360 videos (concerts, rollercoasters, etc.), virtual art and a number of productivity type apps. Virtual art is similar to the old school view masters. Plus, you can also create you're own virtual art with a number of apps.
There really is more to the Oculus then just games and what they advertise for.
The Air Stream does work well over 5G Wifi, if you don't want to run over a dedicated cable for PC/Steam type games. Yes, you can play Steam VR games, if your PC meets the Oculus requirements.
This VR Headset does it ALL! All vr games and naughty videos work on it! You can also connect it to you're computer and use it as an Oculus Rift!

This things incredible. The speaker technology is the most purest,all encompassing style of audio to ever grace my ears. The exercise you get while fighting martians or boxing up close, in the ring with #Creed. It is pretty mind blowing. It impressed me so much that i bought some meta stock. What they plan to use VR FOR JUST IN HEALTH care, 300+ a share will be a distant memory. #meta 
Well worth the money, very well made.I didn't even buy any accessories because it came with everything you need. Games are ever growing.
If you arent into activity games just using the meditation and breathing offerings via you tube VR will make you next level zen. I recommend this if you have the moolah.

Right now, Oculus is the leader in virtual reality. 
The headset is a little heavy (17.7 oz), preventing users from using it for long periods of time. That being said, some nice features are the ability to use Netflix, Google Search, YouTube and a bunch of other free 3-D content. When VR starts to develop more, look out for headsets replacing just about everything visual, including big screen TVs.

What an amazing experience you will get with this oculus headset. Travel the world and never leave your living room. Battle aliens and zombies. There is some thing for young and older like. I have never been a fan of video games. But when we saw this headset we decided to give it a try. My wife and I are hooked. Amazing. We showed our uncle who is 78 and he bought one too. He loves to travel the world from his recliner. With that said I can’t give it five stars because of the customer service. These headsets are fragile and break easy. If you drop it you will be getting it repaired.  The Oculus warranty is basically no warranty at all. If something happens to your headset on the sea you might as well buy a new one. Now with that said getting the Best Buy warranty is a must! It should be required when you buy this. You can basically just walk in  and they will replace it no questions asked.

We love love love these headsets! We bought two to help beat out the winter and covid blues. Between the escapism, exercise games, wellness and mindfulness and the puzzle games we are in love.

It’s a great way to leave your space for a little. You can see the world, hang out with friends and just live unrestricted.

Love this so much.

Very fun! I play it almost all the time now! 
   Even better that it encourages me to exercise more and more. I won't even realize I'm starting to tire till an 1hr in. 

   Only complant that it only has a 2 hour battery life so having an external battery bank is a must buy to play longer or buy the extended battery strap for the Oculus for another Hundred. 
   
   Also not alot of VR games in the store but I'm sure they're working on it. I hear that if you have a PC, you can hook it up to the VR and buy compatible games off the Steam Store or you can buy the Virtual Desktop and link it to your Steam. 

   Either way, not a regretful purchase, I'll be playing till they make VR even better.

For the price, you cant beat it, battery life could be better but the headset needs to stay light so the capacity cant be too high, when supported it can do 120hz very smooth gameplay, dont use it too often becuase kf school and work but when i do i have a great time and i burn calories doing so. If your looking for a great budget VR headset buy thi, 128 gigs is more than enough and display quality is also pretty good too. Controller tracking is on point ans setting boundaries is very nice so i dont break my TV (which i almost did playing boxing). Overall very good and im happy with my purchase

Awesome device to play with friends in VR. I’ve gotten only Beat Saber to play so far and it’s fun as an easy quick cardio workout and also fun with friends in multiplayer. You’re able to watch Netflix in a virtual room so that’s convenient when you don’t have a tv in your room and just want to watch something without holding the device like a tablet. Hopefully they come out with more fun games. Only downside is having to buy all of the games especially when a game has several add on bundles, but don’t forget to get a referral code form a friend so you both have at lease $30 to spend on games.

I recently purchased two of the Occulus game consoles for Christmas for both of my children.  They were so excited to open the Occulus to play it, we let them open their gifts the night before.  The kids played all night on the consoles until the Occulus needed charging.  My husband and I tried them out, and the graphics made you feel as though everything was real and not in the game, so much so that my husband ran right into the wall lol.  My family rated the Occulus’s a 5 out of 5 stars and highly recommend it to any family to enjoy a lifelike experience within the comfort of their own home.

This was purchased as a gift for somebody!  The feedback was it is an awesome product; they love it.  I also used it and I loved it.  But she has experienced some motion sickness with it so she has to put parameters around they length or time she uses it!  I used it for a short period of time and had no motion sickness at all so it probably varies from personal. To person!

Idk if its just me. But I saw blue tint.. and also it was blurry as heck for me. I doubt that I need glasses. Its maybe because the screen is bad quality. I can see my iPhone 12 screen perfectly. Its a bummer bc I wanted to actually stay with it. And watch movies and play around in it. Also I couldnt download horizon worlds idk why. Which is weird. Sadly im returning it

So hardware is amazing enough but the software to protect yourself from punching things in your house is impressive. The ability to make safe zones ( guardians ) and it remember it is awesome. Don't expect life changing graphics for the games in the Oculus store but the fact that it is a stand alone unit that can do all it can is bananas. I suggest to buy the connection cable same time as purchase is you have a vr ready PC. That's where that 5k vr ready graphics come from.

Easily worth 400$ if you want a change from conventional gaming. It's designed to be very social so I hope your friendly

Found it easy to set up once I figured out how to hold the controllers, lol, Old guy here (54). The build seems pretty solid but I'm sure damage would occur if dropped from 5' face height. Fits comfortably with the wide elastic adjustable band. Two options for sealing it to your face, a soft rubber and the foam. Eyeglass extension provided which I found to be useless. The virtual world at your home screen is stunningly beautiful with different options from space, to cabins, to city, to a swamp. My favorite thing is teaming up with my kids to play a round of golf and they live in different states but it literally feels like we are together o. The course. Need to work on my avatar. More though.

This headset is really great for people who want to experience virtual reality. It doesn’t require a PC, you just boot up the Oculus app on your phone and log in, connect it to your headset, and you’re ready! It’s also not too expensive, it’s the price of an Xbox One or PS4 unless you’re getting extra storage. Purchasing games also is pretty easy, you just give your payment option and buy the game through the store either on the oculus or on you’re phone. They give you a great refund service if you didn’t like the game as long as you didn’t abuse the system or played for a long time on it. Finally it gives you a wide range of great games and gives you great deals and discounts on a good basis.

I will start off with the headset. The headset itself is great. It works flawlessly, and is comfortable to wear. I do wish the lenses had more adjustment, but it's not that beg of a deal. Now to the problem i have with this system. The controllers operate how they should, and are comfortable to hold. With that said. The controllers are the biggest let down of this system, because they are made out of the weakest plastic that i have ever seen on a controller. I have broken the lower trigger mount off on both my controllers. Due to new controllers being out of stock everywhere. Which is a joke in itself. I decided to fix them myself. Luckily i was able to glue the mounts back on with some high streangth plastic glue. In the process i notice that not only is the plastic pathetically weak, there is hardly any plastic holding the mount together. There is no excuse for such low quality, on what is supposed to be a premium system. I

Oculus Quest 2 is great overall. I love it. 

Pros:
1. Oculus Link - need cable separately. If you want to use this feature, you need to turn off the Oculus Air on your headset and on your Oculus PC app. 
2. Oculus Air - need Oculus app on your PC and need to be on the same wifi network. For SteamVR, it is better to launch it on your computer rather than the Oculus Library. If the Oculus Quest 2 is crashing on your Oculus Air, just remove some or all shortcuts from your Oculus Library. It should work after.
3. Wireless headset. No more hitting your cables when you do overhead slashing when playing games that use physical weapons like swords. 
4. We can bring our headsets anywhere as long as there is wifi. 

Cons:
1. Tracking is not too great. Sometimes, the headset fails to track the hand controller properly. 
2. Oculus Quest 2 games aren't that many compared to SteamVR compatible games.

Definitely, buying accessories enhances our experience using and playing games on Oculus Quest 2.

We have the Oculus Quest 2 for couple of weeks now. I am not a big fanatic of video games, but decided to get it for my 16 year old son and 13 year old daughter for Christmas. So far, there's no complains. The only thing is we need to buy the games which are a bit expensive, along with the music package. The kids play with the Oculus for about an hour or more at times. The straps are good, but kind of hard to adjust. I will need more time for them to play to hear, how they feel about it. But I researched couple of other VR before, and so far this was winning. I felt great with the purchase.

This is my 3rd vr headset after having owned both the original oculus rift as well as the oculus rift S. What makes quest 2 the best out of all of these is simple: no cables! You can now perfectly play pcvr wirelessly through this headset using oculus link. In my experience, you do need to be relatively close to your pc for the best connection. I bought this set as I am eagerly awaiting the vr release of one of my favorite games of all time: Resident Evil 4. The fact that this headset supports wireless pcvr and has its own multitude of vr games for on the go is amazing. Excellent product.

I’ve been using this for the past 3 days so far no complaints. You might run into lagging issues with pcvr but nothing google can fix. Played Half Life alyx beat saber and some ve chat flawlessly. I did run into issues where I couldn’t move my fingers in VRchat for pcvr but I’m working on fixing that. Thanks for the amazing product!

Honestly, I didn't consider this product for a long time due to the Facebook integration.  But then a coworker won one at our holiday party and I started really thinking about it.  I've never experienced VR before, and it's been a complete game changer.  I've only scratched the surface with Beat Saber and Superhot VR but there's so much potential.  And honestly, features/specs wise this is some outstanding tech, period.  Not just for its price, which is insanely reasonable given its feature set and the price of its competition.

And in these days of shortages, it's actually obtainable.

I love this, but after a month of owning it. Some yellow spots appeared on the left hand side. I guess it’s a commen issue. I’m going through the ropes with oculus to see if they can replace it or if I’m stuck with a paper weight. Also make sure you purchase the insurance so your not dealing with this same issue

The quest 2 is a great headset for anyone to get in VR from my experience. It has completely changed my perspective on gaming and I will continue to love this headset *disclamer* I do recommend getting a micro fiber cloth to wipe the lenses when you need to

This is the first VR headset that I have ever owned, I was a little hesitant about purchasing it.  Overall this is a great device, the VR experience has been amazing. The setup is easy and the games and apps have been enjoyable.  The only thing that I don’t like is that you have to have a Facebook account to use it.  If you don’t mind using Facebook or you can get past it, this is a great purchase.  Also if you are worried about 128GB not being enough, for most people it will be more than enough.  The games and apps are not that large they each usually only take up 5GB or less.

I don't like that I had to make a facebook account to use it. Also there's barely any free games and the free games suck. Also all the games you have to buy to even have fun on this are expensive. It's all about money. You spend over $300 to buy this and you end up spending another $100 in games to play it. The battery life is not very long. So you have to spend even more money to get another pack to even get good play time. Then so far I've found it to be 1 player. I can't play with someone else unless they purchase the same game. So overall I would consider this a money pit!

What can I say, seems like great value to get into VR.

You can buy an overpriced cable and play your steamvr stuff you've always wanted. Product seems sturdy, it is clear, controllers work great.

The power it has for playing games on the headset alone has been impressive though. I have to give them credit on that one, even if it may or may not be spying on me like everything these days.

They say at some point you can unlink it from facebook, that is what I want as I'd like it to be separate and it's own thing. 
So recommended to get into VR unless you have privacy concerns.

I bought one for my wife for christmas and she loves it, both my children love it 9 & 11 This unit is way more then i expected. The graphics are theme park quality (Think Pandora at Disney) and the amount of games is endless. Highly Reccommend.

I’ve had to do a hard factory reset on it twice now. If you set up a pattern it stopped working and even with the pattern i put in. I wish there were more games available. I would say wait to purchase until they fix the kinks in this set and wait for more games. FAQs and support didn’t really help when it comes to forgotten passwords. The only way to fix it is a factory reset.
The  fabric for the head strap is finicky, make sure your hair is down or to the side for use. 
You can’t wear glasses with this device. They sell prescription lenses but that’s an additional cost. 
There is no carrying case with this specific purchase. Again an additional cost. 
Serveral games require subscriptions or additional costs.

This thing is nothing short of awesome! It’s great to see the kids and the adults having so much fun. So much better than just sitting in a chair playing video games in my opinion! Good variety of games too! I’m super impressed!

Love it... Along with PCVR and using sidequest app I'm able to enjoy 100s of free games.  Definitely order a replacement headstrap the original kinda stinks and there are 3rd party after market that are better.  Try Nord Quest

So much fun for the whole family. This was a gift for our 13 year old son, but everyone has enjoyed it so much, even the grandparents. Easy to use and set up. The games are affordable priced, I’m comparison to other systems.

I was a little skeptikal at first,  the original oculus didn’t live up to my expectations but the Meta Quest 2 sure did!  The graphics look really good & overall alot of good games to enjoy with family & friends.  I love it.

Fun piece of technology that can immerse you into things not possible in reality. Can definitely give you an upset stomach and a spinny head for sure so be careful at first. I bought 2 and we have fun using them together.
over amazing i got to try my cousins vr and i almost stole it, this is a must buy

There potentially is a solution into the future where accounts can be made directly with META the new name for the quest company. 

Other than that these are great! They even have a digital fence that if you venture outside of it the headset has cameras to allow you to see your surroundings in your home. Very nice safety feature.

We did have a little trouble with the harness itself as we both wear glasses. My only complaint is it should come standard with the Elite strap. We bought an aftermarket one and now the fit is much better. For the graphics, quality of the Oculus and over all value, I'd give it 4 1/2 Stars but that option is not available.

This is extremely worth the price for the experience that you will experience.. and also basically feel that experience whenever you desire at that! For the parents that are spectacle about buying this for your kiddos, please do your research if you think it's all about games.. because it's not. There's tons and tons of educational activities available, some are even free! It's a very different learning experience then what we had growing up, but it's also very affective in my opinion.. more hands on. Oculus will blow your mind.. you will love it just as much as your kids!

This device is Amazing. Its a fun toy for the while family, every game we’ve played has had amazing graphics! Its like you really are in another world. I definitely would recommend this to all ages over 8yrs.

Highly recommend this one to start. I actually prefer it to more expensive VR headsets I own for quicker pickup and play.
Love this gadget!! We bought it for my nephew and my husband decided he wants one for himself so we got a second one and it’s been a family game night every Friday night! It’s awesome!
My little sister brought this over one weekend and  I played it for hours.  After a little research on whats available for the device I decided to get one for myself. So far so good!
I bought this for Christmas gift for my grandaughter, and she loves it very much. She said the headset and controller are very comfortable and she feel like she's in other world.

I’m a 79 year old great grandma and love all things tech. My first computer was a Commodore 64 about 1982. VR has always intrigued me.  I did a lot of research on the Oculus Quest 2 and the Supernatural game and decided to buy it.  I set it up by myself with no problems.  I love the whole thing. Supernatural is good exercise for me even though I can’t make very large physical movements.  The scenery is beautiful and the music and coaches are great. This is the most enjoyable exercise I’ve done in a long time.  I would highly recommend this VR headset.  One thing though, as many others have said, I did have to buy the Oculus elite strap to get it to stay in place on my head.  The original kept slipping over my eyes.
This is soooo realistic and a lot of fun for the whole family!  We bought the stand as well. That makes it somewhat bulky to store, but at least its organized.
My nephew couldn’t wait to get his hands on it. This is the future, it’s like nothing I’ve ever played before. Definitely would recommend it, unreal.
It's amazing. I love it!! I can visit all the National Landmarks and tourist locations that I have always wanted yo travel to via Oculas Quest II.

Bro it opens a whole different type of gaming an social connection and the experience is amazing i dont think i will ever become bored of it
Love it! There isn’t much to say. Just know this is not only for gamers. It can also be used to work out! Don’t knock it till you try it.
I have never had any type of Vr experience,  not a gaming family at all but this is wonderful!  easy to load games on, great graphics!
Hi didn’t have a chance to use it yet my kids were not really pleased with it so I returned it to back to the store thank you
Excellent product by Oculus. Our family enjoys playing this VR. Lots of games to play with. Would purchase again!
Provides tons of fun for the entire family. Easy to operate and customize experiences. A big hit in my house.

I brought this as a gift for my son. He is 10 and he really wanted this. So we surprised him with it and he was very happy. Like with any online gaming system you have to monitor who they are talking to and who they are playing with. He really enjoys it and so does his siblings. I would recommend playing in a area where you have lots of space because you  will be doing a lot walking around and  moving around. I also would recommend limiting the amount of time played on the game. It is very close to your eyes, so I only let them play for about 20 minutes at a time.
Absolutely love these. So much fun on your own and in gatherings. Everyone has a great time using them.
this is perfect vr. my son is loved. 5 stars for the stors. next time im come back and buy new phone.
The games can be pricy but its worth it! Very powerful device thats a all in one with amazing games

Overall great system! I was pleasantly surprised to see how far we have come with VR. I was the guy waiting till the tech evolves and get better. I bought this because my father in law got one and my wife and I decided to as well. We have fun playing mini golf and horror games. Wish there were more titles but for what you get it is a load of fun. Just be weary of motion sickness and take your time getting used to it. Take breaks and if you feel sick stop playing immediately. Drinking ginger ale helps with the motion sickness some games give you. Not all games do.
Love it. Glad I purchased it. Many fun games. Wife and I get lost playing for hours at a timeZ
No complaints from the 13 yr old or the 10yr old! Gonna get one for the adults in the family
My son loves it! I myself tried it and enjoyed playing the game, very real life experience.
Extremely fun and passes the time. The workout apps are great too. Works all the muscles.
Great game so In love all the kids enjoy playing the game just as well a as the adults!!!
Remarkable graphics and great family fun! Very pleased with the Christmas gifts!

VR gaming is a new experience for me so this is not an experts opinion but just a few things that I noticed that needed upgrading right out of the box. The first thing is the head-strap that comes with the VR headset is uncomfortable and does not support the weight of this thing hanging off of the end of your face very well. The next thing is the controllers. The handles are hard plastic and have a slippery feel to them. They come with strings that wrap around your wrists but are pretty much worthless when it comes to keeping the controllers in the palms of your hands. Rubber grips with velcro hand straps work WAY better.  The last upgrade you will want is a pair of earbuds that connect right onto your headset. The headphones will do two things, It will give you a better sound experience in VR and it will keep the noise down so if other people are around they wont be bothered by gameplay. Those are the three upgrades that I would suggest to a new user that will make your VR experience more enjoyable. #1- aftermarket headstrap #2-controller grips with hand straps #3- earbuds for the headset.  These 3 upgrades cost about another 80 dollars but are worth it for a better comfort, safety and overall VR experience.
We have been playing this most of the day and have enjoyed it so much.

I give the device 5 stars.  It is literally the best purchase I've made recently.  There are plenty of games, but there are also workout apps that make exercising FUN such as FitXR and Beat Saber!  The bowling and racket ball games are fun.  I like that you can play against friends. 

This was the first time I've ever purchased an online order from Best Buy for delivery and it wasn't horrible but it wasn't great either.  They shipped the device via Fedex and was supposed to arrive within 2 days but the shipment was delayed (lost) for a few days.  I didn't get my device when expected but I DID finally get it.  Not Best Buy's fault.  But if you are able to pick up in store, that would be the best option!

Still, great device!
This is the best thing I could of ever bought for my kids

I am very happy with my Quest2. I absolutely love it.
My family really enjoy playing, very entertaining.

Was definitely one of the best decisions we have ever made buying a present for our kids. It only has a 2 hour battery life so you know they will not be using it for hours on end. It does charge fairly quickly so if other kids are over after the 2 hours you can charge it quickly for use again. 

The only downside is there is not many free games. It’s nice for some of the games they allow you to try the demo version. A plus side on having to buy games is a lot of them are under $15. We have definitely gotten our use out of the oculus it was worth every penny.

I have only ever used a VR headset twice, once with a rift in a lab and another time with Google cardboard if that even counts. The quest 2 really took things to the next level by not only offering 3D with the 360 experience but also making it portable and independent. I use this headset for productivity, gaming, web browsing, watching movies, and pretty much anything Id use my regular computer for and the quest 2 just seems to be better and more fun for all of these things. And to think they're selling these for almost half the price of a series x or ps5...

I bought this for my 8 yr old son for Christmas, only after not being able to find the PS5, and he absolutely loves it! Both of my sons have found this product to be fantastic. and they can play with others, like as playing on PlayStation and XBOX. They haven't told me that they like this better, but I do!! I feels it gives you a different look into games and the games look different. With VR, you are immersed into the game itself and YOU are the player, as opposed to the other gaming systems. It's a wonderful choice and I would recommend this to anyone!

I bought this VR headset as I’ve been wanting to get into VR for quite some time now, and it has been working well. However, I’ve noticed that sometimes there is an occasional issue I run into with the system. Sometimes when I’m playing a game (both in-system & link cable) and I take the headset off, it will do its normal thing of turning off the screen, but sometimes when I put it back on, it doesn’t turn the screen back on. It’s not very common, and really, it’s not a hard fix. All I have to do to fix it is just click the power button once on the side.

The Oculus Quest 2 is a lot of fun and the 128gb model is enough storage for the average gamer. It's convenient to be able to play games and explore the world of VR without the need of a gaming PC. However, if you do plan to play on PC or extend the standard 2-3 hrs of battery life, I would highly recommend buying the 16ft Charging/Link cable. The only downside I can think of is the fact that you'll need a Facebook account to link your Oculus to. I know some people are not fond of social media and would mostly pass up on the Oculus due to this factor.

Got this specifically for linking to my PC for sim racing. I’ve tried 2 different cables with no success. Constantly loses tracking and ruins races making my experience terrible with this product. Don’t get me wrong, when this works, it works really well and it’s incredibly immersive. Because it can lose tracking and interrupt your game at any moment, I have no confidence in this product for me to use it in competitions.

Not only does it lose tracking randomly, it also fails to charge while connected to the pc and in use, even when using the “official” Oculus quest 2 link cable. It will die on you in the middle of a race, you will be disappointed in your purchase.

DO NOT BUY THIS FOR PC USE, if I could refund this I absolutely would.

I purchased this as a gift for my 2 oldest sons. We had a previous Occulus that had to be connected to a lap top and used external sensors. This is such an improvement now that it's totally wireless. They are having so much fun with it. The games are free or very afforable, especially if you catch the "game of the day" or specials. They are addicted to a golf game and enjoy checking out venues together like concerts or live NBA games. So much fun! I would recommend this to any new users or as a much needed upgrade for owners of the previous Occulus.

The device works great; would recommend the rechargeable base; some software applications still need alot of work; and some OS updates do show that an update was needed, or needed again. If however, you want to feel those whirlly butterflies in your stomach, without leaving your home, be sure you have someone near you when you first experience the roller coaster ride.  As the saying goes in a different manner of discussion, but suitable for the 'weak in the knees' person, "You may want to sit down to hear/see this".  The Premium Bowling Rocks!

My son was THRILLED this is all he wanted for Christmas this past year. He is young so must be supervised when playing multi player games because not everyone is nice and friendly but he loves interacting with other kids and playing games. He asked me though if we could sell this one and get the Sony PlayStation one, apparently he prefers the games on that one. Had I know I may have opted to pay the extra $50 to have a better selection. If you’re a gamer you may prefer the Sony, if you like interacting with others than Quest is the way to go.

Great fun! If you are even as much as considering  VR and you made it this far like I did. BUY IT! you honestly wont regret it, just look into the games you like and get a few. If you have a gaming laptop or pc get half lyfe Alex, if not dont worry, you can play many games on the occulus store app and will play directly from headset no pc required just internet for when downloading game etc. And some games can be played offline once downloaded like saints and sinners, boxing games and tons more. Just bought mine last week and having a blast.

This VR headset is hard to beat for the price. It is fairly comfortable to wear, and battery life is decent. Good selection of apps and games. It is great to have access to these in a stand-alone package. This headset can also connect to Steam VR on my PC for access to an even wider selection of games, and using it this way gives even better battery life since it is not running the game on the device itself.

Main downsides are 1) the link to Steam VR can be fickle, and if it stops working you need to reboot the Quest, 2) resolution is not the best and reduces the immersion a little, and 3) it's linked to Facebook and requires and account with them. I with there was some actual competition but Facebook/Meta has the low cost VR market cornered.
Had some initial problems. Had to do factory reset.now appears to be working.

Unbelievable experience. Really entertaining. This is a look into what the future will be, in my opinion. The technology involved in this is fascinating and remarkable. Our 7 year old really enjoys it. And some of the games could actually constitute exercise! Lol. It is an expensive endeavor though. In addition to the cost of the unit itself, nearly all of the games cost money to buy or to play beyond a limited demo. It does take some tech know-how to set up too…and adjustment time to use. Overall, I would say dive in if you have the means.

Oculus Quest 2 has the hardware and accessibility to be a VR headset for anyone interested in getting into VR. At such a low price point and having the ability to make it your own with accessories, it's a great headset. It has a good library and if you have a computer that can handle VR games, there is an option for that compatibility too.

Note: There are a few cons. 
- Adding more accessories does cause the price point to go up. Things like: case, new head strap, games, etc.
- The headset is front heavy. I'd recommend a new head strap to counter balance the front heaviness.
- My personal glasses don't fit within the headset and I've heard it isn't comfortable to wear them either way. I'm going the prescription lens route, which is more money.

I have a used HTC Vive and a PSVR, decided to give the Oculus a try and I am greatly impressed.  I found very little distinction between my HTC and PSVR in terms of resolution, but the advertised specs for the Oculus are true and I found a huge improvement, especially for theater mode, where movies pop out like you're in a theater.  It can work with your PC's STEAM games via Virtual Desktop and you can cast to TV via 3rd party apps, it does favor Chromecast, but I did get mine to work with my Firestick.  With complete cordless freedom (for a couple hours of battery life) I feel this console is taking VR in the direction it needs to go.  The downside is the Oculus is owned by Facebook, but it gives you the option of just having an Oculus account.

I would really recommend this headset for those getting into VR. Everything you need to get started is included. The headset is pretty comfortable and the Quest store has a good collection of games.
The main downside is that the headset is technically wireless, so it will need to be charged after a few hours, which prevents long periods of use. However, you are able to purchase a longer cable that will allow you to use it while charging.
Depending on your budget, you may also need to consider the price of games in addition to the headset.

This thing becomes useless if you get banned by Facebook censors. I bought an Oculus last year, then my FB account got suspended for three days, so basically it became a brick. Fortunately, this happened during the return period, so I returned it for a refund. I also permanently deleted my FB account and haven’t looked back. 

The arrogance of the people at FB is amazing. They think they can sell you something, require you to sign up for a FB account and then use their arbitrarily enforced community guidelines to make your Oculus useless.

I have bought two so far and both of them got messed up after regular usage don’t get me wrong anyone who has played on a VR system knows you’re gonna pop the headset with a controller from time to time it happens but after a couple minor bumps the thing won’t charge for 300 bucks I’d expect it to hold up for as long as a console the first one I bought was past warranty which is why I bought the new one and the new one broke before the 30 day warranty save your money and wait a couple years for a better one maybe then will I try VR gaming

It is a very good expirence, and being able to use without a computer and cables, makes it great if you dont have a powerful pc or you want to bring to a trip or a friends house. But, the price comes with some problems, it says it is 300 dollars, but you will spend around 50 to 100 dollars more in accessories such as the oculus link cable and a carrying case, the one you must buy is a new headstrap, the one included is bad, not horrible, but compared to any other strap it is garbage, so you will have to buy the pro one or a 3rd party one.

My kiddos love it!  It's pretty cool, but I have to limit their time on it.   While the feel is fairly realistic and good graphics, it can be dizzying.  If the user is not grounded, it's easy to fall over or bang into something with the joy sticks.  I tried it and had (and still do) a difficult time adjusting the headset.  My head is not bigger than average but every time I use it, I have to hold the headset on my head.  The back should be weighted down with something.  Something more like a helmet would be a better design.  As it is, it keeps falling down on my face.  It's not cheap so I feel the headset should fit better.  Also, watch for the recall on the foam inside the headset.  We took it out.  Apparently it was causing rashes to some users.

I bought this with the intention of having a healthy way to blow off steam after working running a buisness and going to school and boy was I not let down!!!! This thing is awesome. You can watch a movie as if you in a movie theater in hd, you can join a vr think tank and vr video games are a great way to improve hand eye coordination while having fun and to put the icing on the cake the price of the games are either free ninty nine or very reasonably priced. If your on the fence go ahead and get it!!!! It’ll be a great gift for others and yourself ! Only piece of advice is if you decide to do the dot password do not forget it or you will be forced to perform a hard reset. Other than that I have nothing but great things to say about this I love it.

My son let me try his and I thought it was so cool that I scooped up the 128gb version when they arrived.
Make no mistake you really are immersed in a different world with these on.
In fact I would say that if you suffered from extreme vertigo to take a pass on these it is that impressive.
The real drawback is in how you approach this item, it is not a game system in the way we are used to and most games are only several hours long. No massive rpgs or open world games such as Final Fantasy or Far Cry for example. The game library is also a bit small compared to consoles.
This is also something you don’t play for an hour nonstop, the sweat factor and potential eye strain are definite issues.
It s however a technical marvel and it really does deliver at this price point.
You may want to read up on Ipd, interpupalary distance, because it has an impact on how well you see the images but it should be no big deal.
No if it just had more games

This product as sold is very uncomfortable. The head strap that it comes with is the problem. Anyways, the graphics quality is also not up to par, all games are clearly pixelated, videos on YouTube do not look great either. With that being said it’s somewhat entertaining, if you could get past it, that lightsaber game with the boxes is decent. Anyways for me it did not work out at all and I had to return it. Also, I almost forgot, if you do not have a Facebook account, you will not be able to use this item, which is a severe handicap.

I love this thing using virtual desktop you can't go wrong especially for the price to performance here Think about it the old Rift S used to be like $600 and you had to set up all kinds of sensors on the walls and stuff Get this you will not be disappointed other than getting upgraded like the G2 which cost double and not to mention you need a high budget PC with a beefy GPU as well as a CPU to run.  But this as well can be linked up with the link cable which does cost a hefty $79.99. But well worth it to link up and get that extra less latency and highly recommend a Wi-Fi 6 if you're using any kind of air link or virtual desktop.  and from what I hear on the news you don't need a Facebook account anymore to run this unit Thank God...Happy gaming XD

Absolutely awesome mind blowing experience!  The Quest 2 is definitely brings VR to the mainstream in terms of hardware and software.  It is easy to setup and a pleasure to use.  The guardian safety software feature is genius.  You can optionally use the headset for pcvr and have a game library separate from the Oculus store if that is what you prefer.

Hardware wise, the headset and controllers feel high quality.  It does not have that cheap plastic feel.  The controllers are ergonomic but are good for small to medium sized hands.  The thumbsticks are a tad small for me and can be a bit larger.  The headset is front heavy and can be tricky to adjust the strap to be comfortable.  The display looks great and has no screen door effect.  The included glasses spacer works as stated if you meet the requirements and you are careful when putting the headset on/off.  The Quest 2 now comes with a silicone cover which is good for hygiene and easy to clean.

While the Quest 2 is good headset overall but there are some caveats to keep in mind.  The head strap is not the best and it is almost necessary to get a 3rd party strap.  The field of view is narrow but not a deal breaker.  Only having 3 IPD settings is not great, a slider would have been ideal.  People with small noses will have a "nose gap" that allows light to leak inside the headset which can break immersion, a 3rd party face cover with a nose flap can help with that.  Perhaps the biggest gripe is the Facebook account requirement.  While I understand that there are those who want to use their headset as they see fit, you won't get that when Facebook is involved.

My final thoughts is that I'm thoroughly impressed with what Oculus brought to the table.  The relaunch of the Quest 2 feels like a great deal when they increased the storage to 128gb.  I can already see myself putting a ton of use into the Quest 2.

I bought the 128 GB unit, and it came wrapped beautifully, with batteries in. I charged it with its charger while downloading the oculus app on a smart phone. (you also need your WI-FI password to begin.) Turning on the unit was awesome! BUT when it came to 'pairing' my unit with the smart phone Facebook page, the Oculus App did not allow me to enter my FB page!! I googled the probllem, and there are many disappointed customers out there! I got the unit at BB fair price, and it was delivered the very next day by Best Buy, BUT I can not see any of the videos, play a game, or do my exercise! Very very disappointed along with many other Oculus Quest 2 customers. Twelve hours of waiting for the little blue circle on my smart phone to 'confirm' my FB page!

The hardware is great. Facebook is not. 

I think this is the best bang for your buck. Coming in a 300, it’s exceptional for what you get. Tracking is pretty good, it’s not wired, and though the display is a little thin compared to list others, you can’t get a deal like this at this price tag except here. Sure, it loses out compared to most other consoles, but who cares when you save 700 dollars and don’t really need the same setups those provide.

The only think I dislike about this console, and the reason I ended up returning, was its system being ran by Facebook. Games I played offered no modding support, and took a lot of work arounds to do very simple tasks that can typically be accomplished quickly by a computer based rig. Otherwise, great system.

The product itself is amazing. Great graphics for an all in one system that doesn’t need to be tethered to a pc. But if you do want to connect to a gaming pc to play higher end VR games than you can with a usb-c cable. My only complaint is the fact you have to be connected to a Facebook account. That’s going away in a few months they say. But for now you need one. Which I didn’t have so I created one. And after a week of using it and buying multiple games, they blocked me until I could verify myself. Which was not made easy to do. So I spent a week not being able to use the system until the Finally unblocked me. Read afterwards allot of people had that issue when setting up a new Facebook account. But if you already have one than it might not be an issue.

I’ve spent the last couple of weeks with Oculus’ new Quest 2 headset, though, and that’s very close to changing. The Quest 2 is a self-contained headset that’s shipping on October 13th, and it’s an update to Oculus’ 2019 Quest. Oculus has kept that standalone Quest design with the same feature set, while improving its screen, reducing its weight, and — with one noteworthy caveat — making it more comfortable. It’s also dropped the starting price from $399 to $299, making the Quest 2 one of the lowest-priced headsets on the market.

The Oculus Quest 2 is quite nice.   Great price point, impressive graphics for the hardware provided.  The fact that you don't need to be tethered to a PC is great.

Streaming the Oculus is easy, unless you're on a corporate network, which will likely have firewall permissions preventing the stream. YMMV

I look forward to using the hardware with my PC and using it with my Steam games.

Only negative I've had so far is in a game of GORN in which the battery panels in the hand grips slid off mid-game.  That should never happen.

This is a hard rating to give with stars so I chose to go in the middle as an average.
As far as quality and overall experience as what the actual product is, 5 stars all the way! The options are ever changing for what you can do with this device!
As far as personal experience from my wife and I, 1 star at best due to the fact that we couldn't play for more than 10-15 minutes with out feeling sick from the motion. When we returned them and gave our reason the associate said that this is a common reason for returns due to this.

I am middle of 40 lady who was fan of DDR generation. I have loved so much fan of exercise game like PS3 Eyetoy, PS4 just dance series, and Nintendo Switch Ring fit things. Then, One of best reason also kind of beat and moving game’ Beat Saber’. With BTS songs. But, it is much more than that. 
With this, I could have my own movie theater, and there are tons of work out game with great quality.
So, I could have my own health trainers with this VR. So great. After Pandemic, I do very rarely had sweat with home training . But, this game with beat, and great quality VR may upgrade my activity style with much more healthy habits.
I had to buy this one earlier,  but 2021 advanced version bring double storage with silicone cover, so the deal is fair for me. No blame.

My son has the Valve Index. I chose to try this instead. The Index is technically more advanced, but 3.5x the price as well. This Quest 2 is a very good introduction to VR and I am not out that much money if I find I am prone to motion sickness (so far I am not) or get bored of it after a while. I like that I can use it anywhere without wires tethering me to a computer, nor does it need to be limited to a single room due to external sensor placement. This unit is great used stand-alone, and even more impressive when "tethered" to my computer with the Oculus Link cable for more advanced processing power. Lot's of options is a good thing...but a little steeper learning curve as well. I would be surprised if anyone was not impressed when they tried this thing out.

Great VR experience without needing cables, lighthouse boxes or any PC attached. Does heat up after prolonged use in heavier apps like VRChat, but BeatSaber lasted easily through my session without becoming hot itself. Straps are the best they've made yet, and tracking is awesome where it can even draw people / dogs/ items that come into your play zone for both small setups and dynamic rooms with people going in and out. Facebook login and that side of the experience isnt the best but the product itself performs amazingly.

The Oculus was a last min purchase for my son. He truly didn't ask for anything this last Christmas, but I was certain he wanted it. As the last gift under the tree, it was the best. Talk about tears of joy!
After thanking me several times and after plugging it in, he began to enjoy. The game play  and graphics are amazing. It's so easy to navigate and he quickly became very skilled. I would advise playing in a well lit area to avoid crashes haha. That said, it is one of the coolest new products one the market! We love it!

It is insane what this headset can do for $299. Sure Facebook/Meta is probably making a mint off my data, but between Amazon, Google, Apple, etc... my data is already out there. I may as well draw some value from it.

I am only playing Vader Immortal (which I got on special) and Moonrider for free and it's great. I plan to pick up RE4 if it goes on special as online reviews for that look promising.

Not much more to say - just make sure you have a space to play. Running into the room guardian is annoying during game play.

Don’t be fooled by HD VR videos.  That is NOT what you will be seeing in these VR headsets. I purchased the Oculus on 3/4/22 and ended up returning it on 3/6/22. Initially I purchase the headset to attempt sim racing in VR as I had heard the experience was something I had to try. Unfortunately I was unable to achieve the clarity of picture I desired even when wearing g glasses which also made the headset more uncomfortable than it is. I read about prescription inserts that could be purchased but ultimately I decided the hassle of getting it to work pretty openly with games that touted VR support and the extra money outlay ($80 for a long USB-C cable?!!!!) was simply not worth it to me. I used the return to purchase a new keyboard and Xbox controller and am happier.

I come from using a Rift S, in all honesty, it was a horrible experience to have the Rift S. At first it was awesome to experience VR but I started to dislike it a lot since there were issues and no bug fixes due FB putting all their attention to Quest. 

Leaving that behind, I think the Quest/Meta 2 is a no brainer if you want to get in VR. It's way too cheap and it works with PCVR and that is very enticing being that for 300$ and 30$ for a cable, you got yourself a pretty darn HMD.

There are downsides and the biggest one for me to get used to is a bit of the strap but mainly the controllers. The previous ones felt more premium for me and were like thinner and made it easier to use for beat saber or other things. I wish we could have the old ones for that matter.

Awesome little device to pair with my 3070ti and a 10850k, I’ve only tried it over airlink as I haven’t gotten the type c cord to work but it’s still a solid upgrade from the old gen

It made me want to upgrade my router specifically for this. I also don’t think airlink affects your download speeds, more so the local network btw

Using Netflix on it in a room with sleeping people is pretty handy, the speakers are pretty loud to the user and not others as much, and there’s no light like a TV would have from their perspective 

Battery life’s alright, only complaint is I’m not a big fan of what it does to my hair I guess
