I would highly appreciate a toggle mode of what they have already for bumping into furniture, where you can see using the front cameras in the dark

OK when my son first asked for this I didn’t see the big hype about it but after putting it on and experiencing it is absolute insanity. The graphics and some of the games are just crazy. My only complaint is that the head strap keeps moving all the time you always have to keep tightening it and it needs more focusing options.

Pretty surprised at how good the visuals are. It's a bit buggy with definite room for improvement, but out of the box it's the best value in terms of devices to play beat saber on. Super lame it's connected to FB, but in this day and age it seems you have to make concessions in one way or another to one of the metadata-starving behemoths. It also seems like there's quite a bit of additional content already released and continuing to be released, which is nice that the platform appears to be supported for years to come.

I saw some advertisements for this product beforehand and even though it came easy to use and play. I would recommend using the beginner game installed to learn how to use the handles. If you are not used to virtual games, take baby steps and gradually work your way up to avoid getting motion sickness. The other issue might be the weight of the headset tires me and my spouse out after 30mins to 1hour of use. Also, I was aware the the headset did come with the silicone forehead since there was a recall not too long ago.

This was my son's Christmas present to himself (he saved up his money during the past year).  He absolutely loves it!  While watching him play, it seems to be a safe gaming experience (he doesn't crash into furniture).  One really nice thing that I like as a parent about the Oculus is the battery.  From what I can tell, it has a max life of 2 hours before it needs to be recharged.  That means he isn't using the Oculus for hours on end.  (To be fair, he uses a stopwatch/alarm on his phone, so he only plays for an hour).

Can two oldies enjoy virtual reality headsets? You betcha! We're not interested in shoot 'em up, fast-paced games, but thought-provoking ones like "The Room" are more our speed. There are, however, some cautions that more mature users need to consider:
1) The headset is heavy on the neck. We play standing up and generally forget about the discomfort when engrossed in the game, but later, we feel it in our neck and finger joints. There are accessories for a different head strap that can make the fit better. The Quest 1 "head fit" options were better.
2) Those with balance, and motion sickness issues will want to use the seated mode of play.
3) We can generally only get two hours of play per battery charge so we'll be purchasing a battery pack to prolongue our new mania.

Pros
========================
• Excellent price no matter where you are buying
• Wide selection of different types of games and experiences
• Easy to get started
• Sturdy controllers
• Excellent way to get into VR
• No wires!!!

Cons
========================
• The base strap gets uncomfortable after a short time
• The battery life is abysmal 
• Accessories are expensive
• Connecting to and playing PC VR games can be complicated/confusing

Despite the fact that I have included 4 of each pros and cons I have to say the purchase was definitely worth it - even if I had listed a few more of the other cons. I didn't list the others as you would experience the same cons across all VR headsets (motion sickness, finding the right mask position etc.). I have only had the headset for a short time but I can say it is absolutely amazing - especially if you are a little bit of a geek. 

I have tried more experiences than games so far which is strange because I am a gamer but being able to swim around and learn about sea creatures, float around in the ISS, or walk around the bridge of the Enterprise-D. Not to mention the workout games that keep you singing or where you can travel real life roads.

If you have wondered about VR and are looking for a way to experience it without having to buy a new beefy PC this is it. The freedom of not having any wires or not having to connect to a PC is absolutely amazing. I cannot wait until more of my family and friends get the Quest 2 so we can share the social experiences as well such as watching movies, playing tabletop style games or even multiplayer games together!

The oculus quest 2 is a good cheap virtual reality headset, connection to a PC, works standalone, and is great for beginners. But beware of 2 things:

1: the head strap isnt the most comfortable thing on the planet, it's flimsy and built for cheap so you buy the more expensive elite strap

2: you will be locked into a Facebook (now Meta) owned ecosystem, whatever they say goes for VR, not what the consumer says, if you are a vr enthusiast who cares about the future of vr, the quest 2 may not be the headset for you.

After my Rift S saw it’s last day, I decided it was time to upgrade to what most believe is a huge upgrade. I come home, frantically open the box, go to put it on only for my glasses to get in the way. Now I don’t have large glasses, I like them as low profile as possible. I have to squeeze my glasses to uncomfortable positions just to get the headset to fit. Even then, once it’s on my glasses are either touching the lenses themselves or butted up against my eyeballs. The glasses spacer was useless in helping this.

What graphics I could see seemed like a vast improvement over the Rift S, but they seemed to have completely tossed out any consideration for glasses wearers out the window. Now I’m having to look into getting prescription lenses, and spend money I didn’t want to.

This was my first plunge into VR.  The quality of the picture is awesome!  Although, if you haven’t tried VR, it might take a little getting use to.  After purchasing the unit, I immediately upgraded the head gear, which made the unit more comfortable to wear.  

I would also recommend getting the silicon type grips for the hand controllers as they do get slippery when you start to sweat.  

Games are reasonable priced compared to xBox or PS5 games.  

Battery life is ok, running about 2 hours of game play.

The wireless nature of the Oculus Quest 2 makes this a prime candidate for all VR purchases. The AirLink capability makes it a huge winner. The price is perfect for children and adults alike and, if you have the hardware, running VR games through AirLink is a game-changer.

Do yourself a favor and buy some accessories for it like a portable battery, head cradle, and potentially a better strap. The weight of this device can make it uncomfortable.

Three stars purely because of Facebook and privacy concerns.

Got this because I wanted to try out PC VR gaming using the Oculus Link, and I was not disappointed. As a standalone system, Quest 2 is great for quick VR gaming sessions and content, but I truly think PC VR gaming is where this system shines. It's not perfect, and I wouldn't recommend it if you're using Windows 11 because, at the moment, there are a ton of problems. Also, Oculus Link is VERY particular, and oftentimes requires a bit of fiddling to get it to work. But when it *does* work, it's so, so good.

I thought the device is still a little heavy, bulky-keep having to readjust headstrap... sound is good, not the greatest; lens still fog up after high activity use (maybe a personal thing) and menu a little hard to navigate; maybe we still have to figure it out and play with more to get a hang of the menus and app download & controls. Freezes a little more than usual but might be my crappy internet. the hand controls are easy to use.  doesnt have or let you add a external memory card. there are alot of cool games and apps you want to try but have to be very selective on what you buy to download or else you will run out of storage fast. not worth the price; but my daughter begged to get one for xmas, im sure we will return it if she doesnt get to download all the stuff she wants..

This is my first VR device. It's a great addition to my exercise routine -- playing FitXr and Supernatural to name a few games.  The device was easy to set up although I'm not a fan of linking anything to my Facebook account. The only problems that I've encountered in the last 3 weeks is login problems -- twice. The solution (a factory reset) was not ideal since you lose all of your data and have to download everything again, which is time consuming.  Customer service for Oculus was very responsive and actually sent follow up emails to confirm that my issue had been resolved.  

I would definitely recommend (and have) this device to girls who don't game.  I bought it as another way to exercise but quickly purchased other cool games too -- who wouldn't love pretending to be a Jedi?

I love the Oculus Quest 2 but mine had defective battery so I had to get another one thank God I had a warranty that would have cost me an arm and a leg to get another one they should really do on-site screenings for your Oculus Quest to see what is wrong. Granted they only get it from the distributor and there trying to do there job they should at least give you a better understanding of whats wrong with the Oculus Quest 2. But it is a wonderful investment if you want to disconnect from world for a bit

Technically it's impressive. Also, for the purchase price, the build quality / is exceptional - though I greatly wonder just how much of the actual price is paid through the value they harvest from your privacy.  But the biggest immediate concern was the battery life.  Like many, I had challenges getting it to pair to my Samsung Note 20 5G Ultra - which has been in the market approaching a year I believe and thus should have been smooth sailing.  But regarding the battery, specifically: that bug caused the headset to have to scan for devices to pair with for a much longer period of time.  The result: by the end of the roughly 45 minutes it took to complete setup, I got as far as just browsing game titles before it shut off with a dead battery!  Definitely not a great first impression.

We bought this for our teen-aged son. He enjoys it, but said that it does make him a bit dizzy/nauseous after using it for a while. I tried it on as well. It is really an unbelievable experience. I would like to let people know that, if you have sensitive skin, you may get a rash on your face (Which happened to me. Tried this at night and then woke with a rash the next morning.) I think this product may have a latex seal (and I'm allergic) so I'm guessing that's what did it. Just a warning to all...

Such a good VR headset for the price and with its updated storage to 128GB for the $299 model. Whether in wireless by itself or connected to PC (which can do streaming to aswell) it gets the job done and is fun to play with as a family or solo. Plenty of third party accessories make this an even better experience as some of Oculus's own accessories for this are expensive. Had one of these earlier in the year of 2021 but sold to a family member, glad to have this sort of tech back in my household!

I'm a older guy, not a 'gamer' at all but I was curious about VR. Strap the Oculus Quest on and enter a different world that can be awe inspiring and dizzying. Seriously, don't spend much time with this at first - ease into it because when you take it off you'll feel like you just got off a boat in heavy seas, lol. Playing games like Mini Golf or a puzzle game is a great way to acclimate yourself to the 'after effects'. But it really is very cool and a lot of fun. You and your kids will love it.

Love it!! I liked VR before but this is awesome. I have family that live in different states from each other and this allows us to all interact and play together. The only thing I dislike is the strap and how tight it has to be. Also, the face clip keeps popping off by the nose. The games are also pretty expensive especially when I have to buy the same game for the 3 Oculus devices myself and my kids have. The free content is amazing though! The educational videos are great, I watch them daily.

When i first saw this ...i was wondering can this be better then playstation version...hell yes ...Simple and easy to get started...worth every penny games are very fun and interactive...all my friends and family love playing with it... But yes ..you can get hurt if you dont have a clear enough space while playing certain gamss.... overall experience...id have to say qorth fhd money and woth metaverse coming up with better things ....its sky's the limit with the possibilities the Oculus can do

I absolutely love the Oculus! The games are gorgeous and really immerse you into the world of whatever you’re playing! Beat Saber is phenomenal as everyone says and lots of games for whatever you’re a fan of.
Literally the only con to the device is the piece in contact with your face. Even with the new silicone face guard you still sweat like crazy and are prone to possible rashes/breakouts. I would still highly recommend this product but also highly recommend washing your face after using it!

I purchase the oculus quest2 specifically for the Supernatural app and i just love it. The apps are pricey in general, and i suppose more variety would be nice, but the experiences are amazing overall. I use it every day!

As a person over 65 and trying to stay safe and active, the Oculus Quest 2 changed my life. I can travel to far off lands, take a boat ride, scuba dive, and even climb a mountain in the privacy of my own home. I bought an exercise app and it encourages me to keep moving daily. This purchase was the best gift I could have received. I get excited everyday to explore different adventures. I also play mini golf, table tennis, and go bowling with my spouse. He also bought the Oculus. So much fun!

This is a fun and exciting new way to play games. The graphics are pretty good but could definitely be better. With this technology though, its only going to get better so don’t expect top notch realism at this moment. The movements are smooth, the game play is intuitive and its fairly easy to set up. Having it to help get you off the couch and “exercising” is a huge benefit. I bought more of these for the kids (31, 29 and 22 in age :D:D) for Christmas and am excited to see what they think!

I purchased the Quest 2 for my son for his birthday. (7) First it does have a warning for ages 13 or 15 and up for developmental reasons but I feel if I regulate the use it should not be a huge deal. He loves it. I tried it and I agree the technology of the whole thing is pretty amazing. The picture is very clear and the ability to adjust the focus is a plus. I wear glasses and it does come with a spacer that is needed to fit correctly while using. I have a bigger head and I can adjust it to fit snug and comfy. I would definitely recommend this as an entry into the VR systems. Also this doesn't require a powerful computer like the more expensive units. Only con is it dirtys kind of quickly due to only being available in white. Black would be a better choice for something like this in my opinion.

Very fun device.  Be aware, however, that if you plan to use this with a computer and that computer is a laptop unless it has a MUX switch so you can switch between the onboard video card and the dedicated video card there are a bunch of hoops you have to jump through to get it to use your dedicated video card.

  I believe this is a problem with the Oculus software because when you start a regular 3D video game your laptop naturally starts using the dedicated video card but oculus does not.  you have to trick it by disabling the onboard video card, restarting the laptop, starting oculus then re enabling the onboard video card.  EVERY TIME you want to use the oculus.  The stand alone experience is flawless but if you want to play steam games or something on a laptop be ready for some extra steps.

Bought this for my son for Christmas. He absolutely LOVE this!!! We brought it to the family party and everyone was having a good time wearing them and getting lost in the visions it provided. Everyone loved it but most of all, my son was able to play certain games on it that he really wanted and he got lots of exercise just playing the game without even trying. His face was red and he was sweaty just playing inside! It is a great system. It's early, but so far no complaints what so ever!

This experiment into VR was a huge waste of time and money. The free games are awful, the community within games seems like a bunch of 13 year olds calling each other homophobic slurs. I found myself fighting with the unit to work more often than it would. I have 20/20 vision but even with adjusting the eye lens it was always blurry somewhere. The tracking of the controllers or hands for some games was sub par at best. Some games I couldn't even get past the intro before it stopped tracking the controllers or my hands. So many games are marked as free but 99% have a subscription fee. Overall I can't recommend this to anyone based on my experiences, maybe I had a defective unit but with the lack of stock, I probably will just opt for a refund. With so many positive reviews, I expected so much more.

I don't use facecrook.  I created an account with a new email (legit, but not my normal email).  Somehow, they found it and shut my account down, essentially bricking this device.

I would not buy something with this sham company's name on it EVER.   These people are (allegedly)  crooks!

I will give BestBuy a 5, though, as I was passed my return window, but the person I talked to brought a manager over and they were able to offer me an  in-store credit, which they didn't have to do.

I am absollutely blown away by how far this technology has come along in recent years. This device is everything I dreamed, and more. My only complaint I could possibly think of is that the bottom of the mask does not form fit to my nose, so light will enter from underneath, but that isn't really a big problem, especially since it makes the mask slightly more breathable. The device is fast, connects well to Bluetooth devices and to Wi-Fi, and is extremely comfortable. There's good game selection, the games are relatively cheap (most are less than $30, and the titles by smaller companies are usually around $10), and if you want to connect to a computer, you can always just buy the Link cable along with it (about $80). A great purchase for anyone who wants to experience VR, but either doesn't have a PC or

My 12 year old son purchased this with his own money and has been so happy with his purchase. I have played it as well and it’s is a good product. The only thing is the battery life but that is expected with a completely wire VR system and shouldn’t deter the purchase. He also purchased pretty much the same games he has for PS VR Beat Saber, vacation/job simulator, MLB home run derby all the games have a clear upgrade in graphics and the controls are more responsive and realistic.

I finally decided to try an actual VR headset after only using the kind that use your phone as the screen. I used it for a few weeks but I wasn't a huge fan of it. The fit for me wasn't great and there are only three spots to slide the lenses so if none of them line up with your eyes like for me, you have to prop up the headset while wearing it to get a clear image. It's a really cool product and I like the idea but I think I'll wait until the third or fourth gen to try it again.

I really like Beat Saber & a couple other fitness games I’ve tried. YouTube VR & Oculus TV are fun to watch. It’s like having your own home theatre. The meditation apps are so realistic too. The bad part is the headset. It is terribly uncomfortable. I rigged up a way to wear it until new VR padding & a new head strap I’ve ordered arrive but honestly did Oculus not test that out? I probably would’ve returned it if I wasn’t able to buy those extras because it takes me about 15 min to get the headset comfortable on my face. Even then I still have to adjust it frequently because it’s either too tight & starts to squeeze my forehead or it starts slipping down my face. And that is with the counterweight I’m using. It’s annoying!  Yes I do recommend it but know that you might have to spend more $$ to get it comfy.

Love it.  Kids love it.  Girlfriend loves it.  I also have the Rift S.  I wish more games from my Rift S carried over, but it's still awesome.  Being cordless is a great feature.  I travel for work and I bring this with me to keep me entertained for a while in the hotel before I sleep.  Battery life could be better, but even that is overcome by putting a powerbank in your pocket and running a charging cable up to the headset.  You can get 7-8 hours instead of 2 hours that way.

Review of this is outstanding. I never had the first oculus so I can’t say this is better but my expectations of this system is great. There is great content and the growth of new content is great. The only negatives is that it seems the battery life is around 2-4 hours of using it( I guess they expect you to take a break for your eyes), charging cable length is short( bought a longer cable), and a new hair concept called oculus hair after you use it( comb your hair after use)

Great really fun device. Much better quality then the first oculus you had to put your phone into. Graphics could be a bit better but I know the technology for this is still in development and the graphics I'm sure will get better and more developers will work on how to make more games and better games and things to do. The Quest 2 can be a great way to exercise also as watch tv shows and movies. Through the firfox browser im able to watch HBO Max and Netflix is awesome also.

The technology is actually really cool but I was forced to return it because my glasses don’t fit even when using their adapter.  The glasses would get pressed against my face and on the sides and distorted my vision, resulting in a headache after 10 minutes of use.  Be sure your glasses are smaller than the limits outlined online or buy insertable prescription VR lenses separately.  My glasses aren’t big so I was surprised.  Maybe future versions will be more accommodating.

Oculus is an amazing VR headset for the price. It truly is and does so much. If you’re like me, you’ll have to limit your play time otherwise you’ll get nauseous so remember to take breaks. My favorite past time with this is to kick back and watch Netflix on the gigantic simulates theater room. Very very cool. Since purchasing one, I have upgraded to the elite headset which is far better than the included one in the box. The stock one will cause you a headache over time.
It meets expectations and is gives quite the excitement when putting it on, i recommend buying warranty tho

The fact that this can be used anywhere is the selling point, unfortunately it’s treated as a separate console/computing hardware, and nearly all things that are half worth playing… they don’t just cost money, they cost a lot of money, and this is why I just can’t recommend it to someone like me. If you’re a one income family with a couple kids that occasionally have some spending money, I’d recommend getting something else like a Nintendo switch or a bunch of Legos.

This was our "family gift" Christmas 2020 and everyone loves it.  A couple notes that drop it a star: we share it between adult-sized heads, to teen heads, to tween heads and re-adjusting the headstrap was a serious pain in the rear.  That required an investment in a new headstrap (non-Oculus branded as that has many reports of breaking).  They could've also thrown in a free game or too, so get ready to spend some $ (surprisingly pricey for most of them) to use it.

This is probably one of the best things I’ve ever purchased I am so in love with Oculus Quest 2 VR.  It’s the coolest thing I’ve see in a very long time.  If it had not been for Best Buy and their credit card letting me lay it in 12 payments with no interest, I would of been missing out on this great game of the future.  The Super Hot  game alone is worth getting the Oculus.  Thank you Best Buy for letting me discover this great experience with the Oculus Quest 2.

No matter what I did I could not get a clear picture. I wanted to try it with my glasses but they won't fit. For the setup I had to restart the unit several times to get it to proceed past a given point. I don't like that it's linked to Facebook, but I could live with that if it worked better. I bought it primarily to use with X-Plane, but it performed so poorly I never bothered to try it with that.  I had high hopes but I am disappointed and will be returning it.

Upgraded from the Oculus Rift (2015 model), and wow have they improved. 
Only downside is I feel like there should be a better way to link accounts from games purchased on PC VR. Example Population one was purchased on Steam, but to play it natively on the O
Oculus Quest 2 I needed to buy the same game in the Oculus store.

Even though it's annoying to have to buy the same game twice, You'd think there would be a way to merge the accounts to get game data linked.

1. Use Air Link or buy the Oculus Virtual Desktop app for $20
2. Download the oculus virtual desktop streamer app to your PC and set it up
3. Open up the virtual desktop app on your oculus
4. Play any of your vr steam games!

It's recommended that you have a good router as this will be running through Wifi. I have my PC connected via Ethernet and its seamless. I was able to play Half Life Alyx and beat saber on the highest difficulties with no noticeable latency!

I've been using a Samsung Odyssey+ for a few years, and have also owned an Index. I play a variety of games, including Beat Saber, Fallout 4 VR, Elite Dangerous, Moss, etc, so my VR hardware requirements vary quite a bit. Having an untethered headset that can be quickly taken on/off is a nice option, so I purchased my Quest 2 when the 128gb model was available. I already have a FB account which I've been using for FB groups, so I didn't really care about "that" issue.

I've been really happy with it so far. I've played both native Oculus games directly from the headset, and PCVR games through Sidequest. Performance meets my expectations, and I was surprised how decent the built-in audio is. Another bonus is that it fits really well with my glasses on, and I likely won't have to buy 3rd party lense add-ons (unlike my Oddyssey+ and Index).

Out-of-the-box, the headset felt very unbalanced on my head, so I bought a BoboVR strap and BeswinVR halo padding kit. The difference is phenomenal - there are times when I don't even feel like I'm wearing a headset at all. YMMV, as each person' head is a difference size/shape, but this combo is perfect for me and it's easy to install. It also gives me a convenient place to mount an external battery.

I had the original quest and I like the second in just about every way more; however, it is narrower.  I have glasses, so they get stuck in the headset every-time I lower the head set to take a sip of a drink or pause my game for any other reason.  The load times are great, much faster, graphic quality is higher, and the wifi is faster.  The wifi being faster is a boon, because using it with virtual desktop to play PCVR wirelessly is a much better experience.

I bought one of these a year ago yet I sadly broke it (completely my mistake) and I just had to get another one. I didn’t think much of VR gaming but once I used this I cannot go back. The value for this device is amazing. There is no other headset like this one, one that can offer great imaging, precise accuracy in movement, and not to mention the speakers that are equipped on it. It’s an all in one package and a perfect first step into the wild world of VR.

Very cool and realistic, but has limited games and accessibility to other devices. I returned it after multiple attempts of playing games, due to the headaches and motion sickness it delivers! I fly every month for work, I’m very active, in great shape, and never experience sickness like this! It’s hit or miss though! Some people won’t be bothered, but as a heads up it can make you pretty sick and deliver a nice headache. Still a great product nonetheless!

This was better than I thought it would be. I thought the price was a bit high but after using it I think it is actually priced very well for what it does. I rated it 4 stars because the two controllers use regular batteries instead of being able to just plug them in and charge them like the headset. Other than the need to buy new batteries for them I have no complaints. I have had to buy new batteries only once since purchasing the product so not too bad.

I was a little hesitant at first to purchase because I'm not much of a "gamer" but my nephew got one for Christmas and so I made an impulse purchase.  I love it!  The game I probably play the most is Beat Saber and love the extra bonus packs.  Wasn't exactly thrilled with the price, but I think it's fun.  Also diving into one of the golf games, which will hopefully help my on the course score, but that is to be determined.  Great for kids of every age!

Hi my name is kevin and I just want to talk to you costumers  a little  about the oculus quest 2 that I bought a couple moths ago , this product is amazing hehe to be specific I love , specially with the variety of  virtual reality games that actually make you feel just like you are performing in the game it’s spectacular . I really appreciate and recommend this Vistula really device and if you like suspense games I highly recommend “Resident Evil 4”

I was excited to try out the Oculus, but that quickly changed. Although its a cool concept, its just not developed enough yet. Graphics are blurry, you have to hit a sweet spot on the lense to be able to see anything, and not many selections for games unless you use Steam VR. I want to like the Oculus, but its not worth the 300 price tag. Also, fair warning to people who are prone to motion sickness, it can make you feel like you're going to vomit.

Bought as a gift for my nephew since he plays mine every time he comes to visit and he loves it. The downside is you HAVE to link it to Facebook which sucks but other than that the games are great and are easy enough that younger kids can play it as well. A lot better than sitting down all day playing video games and some games you can buy are great workouts. The upgraded head set piece isn’t made to well and does crack from excessive wearing

I have some experience with VR, having used the PS VR for a few years. The screen resolution is much better and the overall graphics on many of the games is truly impressive. The tracking is very good as well, much better than PSVR RE4 VR is incredible if you are a fan. It plays well and looks great.

You can also connect to a VR Ready PC and play PCVR games, using the link cable or even wirelessly using either Oculus Link or Virtual Desktop.

You don't like your reality? You hate your life? You want to escape from that person in your life that's driving you crazy? This is your tool.

Transport yourself to another world, be whoever you want to be and go wherever you want to go. Want to be another race and see how people treat you? Yep you can do that too...

Understand that I warn you that this will become an addiction like any other drug. You crave that connection with others and do anything to get it, Want to make a best friend on another continent? You can. But know it will make your current life seems pretty boring.

Don't like to be tracked and found out to be doing something nefarious? Well, then this may not be for you then. It is possible to block FaceSpyBook but its not as easy as you would like. I just accept that life is always being tracked, I will get caught someday,,,

Everything about the quest is great, except there is one major glaring issue. The thing is so darn uncomfortable. A friend of mine and I watched a TV show together from across the country via our headsets. It’s pretty awesome, except, we both remarked at the end how our heads and necks were hurting from wearing the headset for about an hour and 20 minutes. It’s front heavy, it pushes into your cheeks uncomfortably, and it makes my eyes hurt.

Bought one for each grandson, 14 and 10.  They both love it. I see them jumping and swinging at imaginary stuff.  Laughing having a great time. 

No issues yet except the 6’4  14 year old has scrapped his knuckles on the ceiling a few time. 

I love this because although it’s a video game at least the kids are moving.

This device encourages me to move and do some exercise through VR games. I only play ELEVEN VR AND RacketFury because of my Background in table tennis. I lost approximate 20 pounds and I’m loving it. I ditched my PlayStation because of wasting my time sitting down and building fats. Minus 1 star because some oculus devices like my previous  Q1 & 2 may tend to freeze and unresolvable. I bought a Geek Squad for this because they are awesome.

All the reviews I read says that this is a must have, and I agree. I visit other countries with this and you feel like your there in person,
This is not for just playing games its very educational. Try visiting a coral reef with this and it will blow you away. A downside is you have to use a credit card to buy content. Maybe this will change to gift cards . All in all a nice device, This is the future, and its easy to use with a good price

Got this as a gift for my son and i must say it was awesome. The price is not bad either for the 128gb at $300.00 You do need a Facebook account to connect to it. I added my account for him to play it. I would say as long as you dont post anything that would get you band from Facebook you should be fine. If you do get band it could affect the oculus game play (just a heads up). Besides that its an awesome addition to our gaming collection.

This piece of hardware is extremely incredible and advanced, but it doesn’t sacrifice ease of use for advancement. It’s great to have a stand alone VR system that can still connect to a PC for Steam VR. The price tag is absolutely justified, I would even call it a steal. The only downside to the system is that it requires a Facebook account to use, which is concerning. But for the value that this system brings, that drawback is very minor.

I was very worried about getting this headset as its considered "lower end" as far as VR headsets go. but to my surprise i love this headset, and its a VERY good introduction headset for 1st time VR(ers)... theres a few things that are annoying but not terrible 1 you need to by an aftermarket strap as the straps are super uncomfortable, and sometimes the screen can get fogged up eaisly... again not the worst just something to prepare for.

This is the only VR ive ever used. I've had a lot of fun playing the games and experiencing the worlds. The stock strap is a sad attempt to keep headset secure on your head. The wrist straps work well enough for a couple pieces of string. The PC airlink has been fantastic. Being able to wirelessly play the games on the PC has been very nice.
All in all im giving an average rating as it isn't great or terrible so far it just is what it is.

I purchased the Oculus Quest so I could participate in the Supernatural Near...Go Far workout program.    What I really appreciate about the Oculus is the stand alone feature.   No wires to deal with while doing my workouts.   I don't know much about how it works, but it has brought a much needed quality into my life.  I am still learning about all the other features available and will say that it has also brought adventure into my life.

Well while you have the PS5, XBOX SERIES X, and a NINTENDO SWITCH OLED running the game here you have an oculus quest 2 which I would say is highly underrated right now in the gaming community. You not only get to move around and make use of VR without needing a PC you get to have fun and enjoy gaming in a new way. I will say the need for a Facebook account is a downside of the oculus that that I wish would change but probably won’t

What a cool experience!! Free games are fun and get you into the VR world!! They run great package specials all the time.  If the game you want isn’t on sale wait a week!  Great new deals weekly!!

I will say it takes a little time to get used to the interface and it took some coaching to get my 10year old comfortable, but now I have to fight to play on it!! Be patient in the beginning, it just takes sim time to get used to it all.

It's cheap for what it is while yes you have to be stuck with only a certain amount of games without a pc. it has beautiful tracking and more than enough storage space. I don't have a PC and it works great with the games I play I've had flawless tracking and it has comfortable controllers if you want to try VR for the first time purchase this VR headset. A simple setup, no PC required, flawless tracking, and a great sound system.

Is such a cool thing love the virtual reality oculus would  Be on it all day if I could . My son loves it It's so funny to watch him play on it and enjoy it This is something that I feel like are whole family Has hours of fun doing And if we could we would get multiple of them The oculus rift 2 It's really great compared to where it started off when it was just a cardboard Box lol I hope it just keeps on getting better and better

This machine is out of this world.  The graphics and concept are amazing.  Beat Saber is about all we’ve played, but it’s tons of fun.  I just wish it came with some games ready to play. Be aware you’ll be buying games when you get it home. Lots of digital purchases available.  Hopefully more developers will jump on board to get some big-name games in the near future.  You’ll also want a 15’ usb-c cable to play while charging.

An amazing value proposition for the price. Absolutely worth the price. The Meta marketplace is somewhat limited but there is plenty of content if you sideload content via SideQuest and if you connect it to a PC to enjoy full PC VR capabilities. Essential. (My only grip is the Facebook account requirement. Not cool! They have announced that they are moving away from that eventually but I don't trust them to be user-friendly.)

overall honestly a really great vr headset obviously I’m not the most knowledgeable in the department of VR headsets concerning like specs or things along the lines of that. but it plays most the games I like and if I ever need to plug in my computer to do it I just use virtual desktop and it works.  I would probably wait until the next headset comes out but overall if you wanna buy this headset you should definitely do it!

Awesome! Easy to setup, easy to use, very portable, good resolution, no cables needed, works with my PC/GPU for great graphics. The only real negative is the blacks can never be as deep as my original Vive, but no headset will be able to do that in the foreseeable future. Try Half-Life Alyx on both the Quest 2 and Vive so see why that brightness range is so important for some games, even with the Vive's lower resolution!

I’ve had the PSVR, but this is on a whole other level. 

I love that you can use it anywhere anytime, no cables, no cameras, no power supply. Works great and has a crazy cool boundary setting

The only thing it’s lacking are some of the games, and an easy streaming option for some of the lower budget tvs on the market.

I would also look into the additional head support. In can be a bit heavy on the bridge of your nose.

I purchased this item for my 7 year old and he loves it but of course it broke within months of him having it being 7 years old. Obviously knowing how he is we definitely got the protection plan with it and they replaced it and got us a new one within days! Learning from this we’ve recently acquired a case for him to put it in after use and when taking it places and so far we haven’t had an issue yet! (Fingers crossed)

The technology on this device is impressive, but it’s not intended for family fun. Games can’t be shared or played  between two devices, in the same household under the same network. It requires a Facebook account or nothing works. It's impossible to get help or contact anyone for support if you run into any trouble. It's good to have of you alone, and all friends network is exclusively in Facebook or physically apart

At first I was hesitant letting my daughter buy this thinking it would be a dust collector after a couple days, but to my surprise it’s been a lot of fun. Like any other gaming console it is what you make of it. I do suggest checking out what games are available prior to buying it. Again like any other console, if you don’t see at least a dozen titles that interest you then don’t buy it. Otherwise have fun and enjoy.

I am new to the VR environment, and found the Oculus Quest 2 easy to operate and get started with.  The video and audio are clear and the motion sensors work perfectly.  The only issue I had with it is that the lens keep fogging up when it is used in a warm environment.  Taking the headset off and wiping them with a cloth helps.
I've enjoyed this so much, I purchased additional units for my children for the holidays.

First time with VR, love it! More immersive than I expected, even with cartoon-like graphics in some of the games. Haven't tried all the various features, mostly just games and 360° view experiences. Fun for the whole family, For groups you will want to cast to a smart TV for optimal enjoyment. Headset is pretty comfortable and lightweight but can be irritating for people (like me) with sensitivity to skin pressure.

Such an amazing experience.  Santa got one for the neighbor kid, then our neighbor had to get one for himself.  Once we heard about it, had to have it.  SO life like!  The only con is that you cannot adjust the viewing glasses like binoculars so picture/experience is not as 'clear' as it could be.  Other than that, great sound. One more con (...ish but not really) can be really addictive!  SOOO much to do in this VR

I love the wireless ability! I had a Oculus Rift, the OG VR. Quality between the two feels about the same to me, but the amount of wires and USB ports required for the Rift was insane. The single port required for this headset is a lifesaver. Additionally, you can go wireless and it works well for most games. The only game that occasionally stutters is beatsaber. (and I've got great routers, I've got Linksys Velops)

I bought two headsets for my daughters while they were in town for Christmas.  They knew how much fun I had with mine, but were skeptical.  After they tried mine, I went to Best Buy and picked up headsets for them.  We have the best time spending time with each other on the weekends playing, chatting and laughing.  They also love the Supernatural workouts and have thanked me so many times for getting these for them.

I was skeptical, but I've been wanting VR for a while. If you have a compatible PC, get Virtual Desktop from the Quest Store. Wait like 2-3 days too. You'll get a discount code in your email after registering your headset, so you can knock some money off the app price. Look up YouTube videos for setting it up after. It's impressive that I can remote to my PC wirelessly and play Half Life Alyx with barely any issues

It's a VR headset! There's not much more to say - this, coming from a 90's gaming kid like myself, is like a dream come true. I very much enjoy using it, but if you have a tendency to feel motion-sick, be sure to play it in small bursts! My only complaint is the short battery life before it needs to be charged again. Still, I do not regret my decision in buying Quest 2. I've been anxious to get one for a while now!

This is the real deal. I forget I’m playing a game. The quality is great. Help me over come by fear if heights. Love this machine. My whole family love this. It’s great for parties, vacations, holidays etc…..
I’m thinking if buying another one so we can play each other. Oh and dud I mention that you can connect it to your tv so you can see what that person is doing. It’s not the best quality but you gave an idea.

Bought this for my 12 year old for his birthday, to share with his 9 year old brother. They have had a blast with it; we have BeatSaber, Job simulator, and Super Hot. All of them keep them on their feet and moving, which is great. Quality is excellent. The setup could not be easier. 

The battery only lasts about two hours of play, but to be honest I see that as a good thing, otherwise they'd never take it off.

Overall I love the Oculus Quest 2 but the headset strap could be better and along with a battery that lasts longer. It’s fairly plugged and play but does have a mild learning curve for us newbies. However if you can find most answers to your questions on google. Overall this is some amazing technology. I love the variety of workout apps that it offers. And the mini 360° videos that you can immerse yourself in.

This is my first VR products and experience and over all, I'm pretty satisfied with the purchase. Especially to use with family. My personal complaints however would be:
1. The headset is not optimal for people with larger heads :c
2. The battery life is not that long
However the value of the products is, imo, really fair. I do hate how you need a Facebook account to use it though. Games are expensive as well.

Went to my friends house, His son asked me to change some settings on his Oculus. 5 Min later I ordered one on Best Buy. The picture sometimes gets blurry it just takes time to find your sweet spot with adjusting to your head, once you do the blurriness goes away. Once I put it one I’m traveling to different worlds. Love it and would recommend it. I’m not going to give it 5 star as everything can be better :)

The gadget seems ordinary until you place it over your face and set up your playing area, then the fun begins. The graphics are primitive, but for  new technology, totally dissent. It’s additive. But be warned, it can make you nauseous from motion sickness. Otherwise, still finding games and activities that right for me. The exercise games are awesome, muscle toning, and fun. Get ready for a whole new world.

Would be 5 stars but for 2 things:
- no parental controls
- controllers too big for many women & kids
Other than those things it really is amazing that this is an all in one portable device. Graphics are great, sound is good & surprisingly there are many games to chose from. That fact that the Oculus can be connected to a PC that supports VR is a huge plus as well. $300 or less for this device is a steal.

I dismissed VR for the longest. However, after getting a Quest 2 and experiencing Pistol Whip, Beat Saber, Thrill of the Fight, Until You Fall, etc. I’m hooked! To me this doesn’t replace traditional (ie “flat”) gaming, but is instead a different experience that provides physicality, immersion, and fun that I don’t get from my Xbox. Truly worth it so far! Plus, I love the activity/fitness component to it.

Pretty good gadget, maybe just a new experience but a lot of fun, definitely worth the $400, cons battery life only last for 2 hours, will need to buy battery pack, head strap can be uncomfortable, with a few upgrades you can make the headset more comfortable and enjoyable, it is great as a stand alone system and can be hooked up to pc to play other games but the pc will have to be buffed up for gameplay

This headset is amazing. The display is nice, it’s comfortable and overall is great for people new to VR. The only thing that really gets me is that you absolutely need to have a Facebook account to use it. (unless you plan on jailbreaking the system) It’s honestly kind of scary to me, knowing that so many social platforms are trying to get as much data on people as possible. Anyways, great headset. lol.

This headset is amazing. The display is nice, it’s comfortable and overall is great for people new to VR. The only thing that really gets me is that you absolutely need to have a Facebook account to use it. (unless you plan on jailbreaking the system) It’s honestly kind of scary to me, knowing that so many social platforms are trying to get as much data on people as possible. Anyways, great headset. lol.

I was on the fence about getting one. Did some research and decided that this would be a good entry into VR. It was ready to pick up in under an hour. Everything was fine when it came in. Theres a small open area underneath the nose so sometimes it breaks the immersion, not really a huge deal. I got the 128GB version because I'd be playing mostly from my PC. Didn't see any reason to get the 256 version.

I was on the fence about getting one, I am so glad my wife pushed me off. We were looking for a way to be a little more active and this thing makes it fun to get up and move. 

Works awesome, graphics in the apps I have used are  good and the sound is great. It's a little heavy but after I got the straps adjusted correctly it's pretty comfortable even with my reading glasses on,

Would highly recommend!

The Oculus (Meta) Quest 2 is a great introductory headset to the world of VR gaming, and supports wireless gameplay by itself, or connected to a PC via SteamVR. A Facebook account is required though, and is generally not recommended for kids below 13 years of age. Battery life is about 2 hours of gameplay, so either a long, external USB cable is needed for charging OR an external battery is recommended.

I can't use it. Facebook won't help me get back into my Facebook account and doesn't respond after promising to help. This is a paperweight without access to my Facebook account. Literally, I cannot use it, which is disappointing since the value and quality of the device itself seems really great. I had hoped to use it for Gaming and connect to my current Facebook but, nope. Good luck if you buy one....

It's a good headset. Pretty capable. I enjoy using it. But it's ties and ownership by Facebook/Meta are significant black mark on this pleasant device. I don't recommend getting this headset unless you font have any other options. The Meta/Facebook ties are just too big a risk and too big a detriment. Just be prepared to lose your game library at any moment if Mera decides they don't like you that day.

Me and my kids loved it, I love that there is no console or computer required too. Also it is more than just games they have allot of therapy type experiences for it as well which I found awesome. I do wish there was more available for free because allot of the games have to be purchased but they do have a small selection of games for free on the oculus store, overall very satisfied with this purchase.

Oculus Quest 2 is my first experience with VR. I've had my headset for about two weeks now and I'm loving. When most people think of VR, they think of video games only. This device can do so much more. SlingTV, Netflix, browsing the internet, socializing with friends, and of course video games. These are just some of the things the Oculus Quest 2 can do. I like that this headset is a fully stand alone product. You do not need to high-powered PC to be able to enjoy the realm of VR. However, if you do have a VR-ready PC this device can connect to it as well. The device fits comfortably on my face and the controls are very ergonomic. The Quest 2 also supports hand tracking. This allows some apps and games to be controlled with just your hands. This is one of my favorite features. If you are considering jumping into VR for the first time, this product is your best bet at a perfect price.

Pretty comfortable, I do sort of regret buying the elite strap for this as an off brand works just as good or better depending on where you get one. The games are populated, I don't think I've joined a single dead game. I'd buy this if you don't have a good PC or any PC at all, but if you do I'd reccomend the Valve Index or something similar. But overall you're getting a good bang for your buck here.

I was never into VR, but was able to acquire one for free and I was quite impressed.

Good:
- extremely immersive, more-so than I could have imagined
- quality of the device is good
- UI is intuitive

Bad:
- some initial hiccups, wifi was bad at first and had to reset the device...in general, there are some bugs
- resolution and performance of the device can be off-putting sometimes
- game library isn't very exhaustive right now

I would say the biggest con for the device is the games library. If you have tons of friends who also have the device, I'm sure you could have fun with any of the games. If you are mostly solo, you might get bored. Personally, the only game I really play is Ping Pong, which is so frighteningly close to reality. If you are a ping pong fan, then you'll have fun with this device.

Overall: if you got $300 bucks to spend and some friends to play with, absolutely.

This product is awesome. I bought it for my son for Christmas and we are not disappointed. It was so easy to set up and start playing right out of the box. The whole family is having so much fun. It is not just a video game system. You can do so many fun and interesting things. The price is not extremely expensive either like other new systems tend to be. I highly recommend this product for EVERYONE.

amazing just get it, trust its worth every penny. its so fun but it might need a few upgrades, but its honestly a good bang for you buck for what it is you getting the best deal ever especially if you got a pc its even more worth it honestly, its also good fun for the whole family would recommend 10/10 only down side is the battery not lasting long enough but a simple battery bank can help with that.

Pretty fun little toy. Lots of neat experiences can be found within. Getting a clear image is my biggest complaint. I even have the elite head strap and still some games are fuzzy while others are amazing. Only had it for about a month and my head is still getting used to the motion sickness I get after extended use. Short periodic breaks have been my key to success and I try to play some every day.

Overall the best experience you can have for an all in one VR, some great games that can really move you, allow you to experience things you wouldn't normally ever be able to achieve. Although I do have to say that its a little difficult to use with glasses, but thankfully Oculus sells third party lenses that just snap on and solves that problem as long as you have your presription for you glasses.

I was skeptical of VR from the start but have professional and personal interest in seeing what the medium is capable of. Happy to report that the Oculus, so far, is a terrific introduction to the world of VR. There are some slight issues- it's not always the friendliest platform for folks who wear glasses - but the VR works well, it's engaging, and there's a lot of cool uses. Happy I picked I tup.

I wanted to purchase the Oculus Quest 2 last year and was unable to. This year turned out to be a great Christmas with the Oculus! It is such a fun experience and it works very well. I am blown away by the virtual cage VR area that you define and when you poke your head through the virtual wall you can actually see into the physical room thanks to the cameras on the front of the Oculus. Very cool.

This is a really good value for the money and  it is amazing how they have gotten some of these game to run smoothly on this platform. I bought the link with it too and that runs well but there is a audio sync issue. I just can't play beat saber on this over the link cable from my computer but fortunately it is very fun when running natively on the device. I did have significant issues with my first unit. It kept turning itself off mid-use with full battery. I think it has something to do with how tight the headset is though. This one does it too if I really crank down the pro strap but the first one was REALLY sensitive. In my opinion this really is best as a personal device and sharing it with the rest of your family isn't very smooth. It should have an SD card slot but it doesn't. Pricing for storage and excluding this option is exploitative and I have to call it out. Sorry not sorry.

Great headset, I've had a Vive and Rift before but felt screen door effect really kept me from having a good experience. But the Quest 2 has pretty much solved that problem, I actually feel like I'm in the game and not looking through something at it. Being untethered from wires is great, even when using it with my pc. I have probably used this headset double the amount of time I used the others.

If you’re not in VR, you’re missing out. Best Buy had the headset and the accessories I needed for a reasonable price. I would recommend buying the elite strap as the stock one is not comfortable for more than 10 minutes. I would also encourage you to get grips for the controllers and a PU foam insert. Spending another $100 for these accessories will turn make your experience enjoyable for hours,

For a long time these types of devices were kind of novelty or too expensive...but the Oculus really did that leap that was needed for VR to become what it had the potential to become.  The games are fun, immersive, affordable and it brought party games back.  You would think that an oculus would seclude people but it's actually a great way to have fun and share experiences with the whole family

My brother and my son have been singing Oculus' praises to me for a while now.
Having owned the PSVR previously, i was skeptical.
Finally bit the bullet and got one for myself, and have to say it's a lot more fun than anticipated!
The games are, so far, shorter than i would care to pay for, but the immersion is worth the price tags.
All in all, I am satisfied with taking the plunge into VR again

Love the VR. Your in another world and you feel like your there. The games are fun. Got the win baseball for my grandson, it is unbelievable. Your right in the stadium and having pro pitchers throwing the ball. It is a great training tool.   I love getting the space station , you are right with the astronauts, and you get to see the beauty of the earth. I recommend this for anyone, easy to use.

For 300 is is good buy, and during this semiconductor inflation times definitely fund device. The set up is easy and the user expertise is not bad. I get the best results with overhead light. With natural sunlight sometimes the room barriers are way of. Probably due to the uneven light distribution. The screen can be more sharper but i cannot complaint too much given the 300 dollars price tag.

I bought this for my daughter and myself for Christmas. I already have the PSVR so I thought this would be better for her since its wireless. She loves it! I do like the capabilities it has over the PSVR but it suffers in the game department. Titles are more expensive and their are less of them on the oculus store itself. But if you connect it to your PC through steam it solves that problem.

The worst purchases ever, your better off buying a PS5 and waiting for their New VR. No real developments or companies investing into it. Their are no real titles an most of the games a good 90% are indi games/ independent games the other 10 are just demos. Their isnt a single game that will pull you in an having you playing everyday. 

I feel like this Product is just a conversation piece.

I see a lot of bad reviews in the comments, what the costumers said, the company is not respecting them at all and not replying at all. If we need to open a new company like Best Buy, we need to serve all the people, doesn't matter what their financial status is. Best Buy looks like a company who only wants to serve people with more money. Thats not a good intension and not a good business.

My son bought this with his birthday money... as parents we thought it would be a waste of money. But I gotta say it's super fun and cool. Games range in price just like any other gaming device but the nice thing is that the games do not take up too much "space" so no need to spend an extra $100 for the extra GB. We have a blast playing with it and it's quite the experience. I recommend it.

I ordered an Oculus Quest 2 128GB VR Headset.  I received a Nintendo Switch Adventure Controller.  This product does not work great for VR.  Now i can't find a return shipping label and my alternative is to call Bestbuy....I don't work for them and thats too much money.  Chargeback and buy somewhere else as this is the only way it can work with bestbuy.  DO NOT BUY HERE< GO SOMEWHERE ELSE

I returned this item after reading they are not recommended for kids under age 13 and that extended play on this device and other VR devices can cause last neurological damage on under age kids.
I did not see this on the box and it should be.  And, there are no parental controls based on what it says on line about this item.  considering the graphic violence parent controls are necessity.

Can’t say enough about Oculus. The Oculus 2 is not made as well as Oculus 1 when it comes to plastics and just the feel of it. However, the audio and visuals are better. This is a feeling. I have not read the specs on this. The weight of the headset is lessened from the Oculus 1. I believe Oculus will be the industry leader for VR.
Oculus has lowered the price and increased the gigabytes.

We are really enjoying our Quest 2!  It wasn't hard to get setup and we were playing in no time.  We have found plenty of free stuff for now and see that the games are not near as expensive as the ones for gaming consoles.  It is more expensive than I had hoped, but I believe it is worth it.  Too expense to buy a 2nd one though it would be nice to be able to watch a movie together on it.

this is definitely fun but also alot of getting used to.  If you get seasick or get car sick easily then you wont last long.  The headgear is also kinda heavy so I had to make it tight on my face and after a few mins your eye sockets sore.  Once you take it off you have rings around your face.  I'd be careful with young people as after a while you may be left with damage under your eyes.

The Oculus quest 2 is unbelievably the best! It is so powerful that you feel like you are right there in whatever you are viewing I've had several different types of viewer's but nothing tops the clarity and realistic viewing of the Oculus quest 2! You do have to be careful if you get motion sickness easily but the more you gradually play the better it gets. You can't go wrong with this!

OMG! I am so impressed with this thing. If you are on the fence about getting one I'm telling you....worth every penny! There are alot of good games available and even the bad ones are still pretty fun. The only thing I feel needs work is the battery life. But I got the power station thing and solved that issue. Plus it made it feel more comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.

My pre-teen is at the age where I have zero clue what to get them for ANYTHING. And when you ask, its always ,"I don't know".  This is that gift. And it gets them moving again. My child used to be super active, but now days, going outside.... is RARE. Get it. You have to have a facebook account, but worth it. I ordered it online and picked it up 2 hours later. So easy. Thanks Best Buy!

I cannot believe this costs 299.00. I can only use shared experiences that may resonate depending on age.  The interface is well designed, rhe controllers track accurately, and the solution meta implements to avoid walking into or striking an object is an elegant piece of coding.   Creed boxing (multiplayer and beat saber are too much fun to be serious workouts (but they are)) get one

Excellent piece of equipment for the money. Returned it due to air flight program and some apps making me nauseous, would have kept it for the Wandering app and some sightseeing apps - BUT just had hard time with the fuzziness/lack of sharpness of the image - like watching tv before HD. Would rather watch it on my HD tv instead.  If image sharpness improves I would buy the next gen.

Purchased this for my wife on her birthday. She loves it, her favorite is Beat Saber and she has gotten really good at it. She did have an HP WMR headset before and it could not keep up with her on the extreme levels in Beat Saber, but because this one has more cameras and the handsets are connected differently to the headset, she is able to play the hardest levels without issue.

Came with no instructions what-so-ever. Don't buy if you need to wear glasses as the images are blurry and the insert to accommodate glasses does not work. Actually, I don't know if it works or not - maybe I set it up wrong? You know...... because of the  "no instruction" deal? Who knows? The head strap gives you a headache. The charge barely lasts (maybe) an hour. Save your money.
Bought this for Christmas a month and 2 weeks ago and the right controller isn't working anymore and has severe drift and is unuseable. I've contacted Oculus and I'm waiting for their reply.

They say the "Metaverse" is coming.  After using this for the first time I was left amazed and full of wonder.  I think it's already here and can't wait for this stuff to become even better as technology improves.

I tired a cell phone adaptation of this a few years ago and wasn't impressed.  This thing is the first step in changing how we interact with the universe.  Astonishing!

Incompatible with MSFS 2020 on a 3 year old $3500 gaming computer.  It needs the latest $1000 GPU to work at good resolution and no jitter.  With glasses I can only wear them for about 30 min before I have to get them off.

Resolution is good but the FOV makes it like looking through binoculars.

I doubt you will like them if you wear glasses or don't have the latest $$ gaming PC.

The Quest 2 is an amazing wireless all in one VR headset. Enter into the amazing world of VR without being tied down to a PC or game console. Move freely, get into the game. Once you go VR, you will never go back. 
Use my referral code and get $35 store credit when you turn on your Quest 2. Must be clicked before turning on Quest 2. https://www.oculus.com/referrals/link/Ironbug78/

It’s been 5 months and I’m already encountering problems. I can’t connect to any WiFi networks in the house no matter how many times I reset the router or disconnect the Oculus (which means no games or internet). I had to google it, and low and behold, there is a virus that is effecting thousands of headsets. How is this allowed to happen? There should be higher security than this

The Oculus Quest was a unique headset when it first launched, with integrated VR experiences, no wires needed.  Consumers were then surprised with the Quest 2 and its second 128GB launch.  This current release while disorienting customers with its constant releases is a worthy and capable VR unit for your money.  With its low cost of entry and higher-end specifications, this unit can do everything from play integrated games (sold separately) like Beat Saber, to stream or connect to a home PC for playing games such as Half-Life Alyx.  Being able to have a quality VR experience without wires is a revelatory experience of which can only get better.  Though for the foreseeable future, I can't see recommending any other VR headset than the Oculus Quest 2.  And that is with owning a PSVR headset as well.  The fluidity, resolution, and customization options of the headset make for a great experience all around.

Not happy with the oculus 
it disconects often very disapointed  
wish i could return and get my money back
poor quality 
IT ALWAYS DISCONECT

I'm not saying it is the best, but honestly, in this price range, this is literally the best out there. Mobility is a huge thing, I had PS VR, but so many wires were a huge turnoff. And the resolution of PS VR is not even comparable to Quest 2. You won't be disappointed. You can also very easily play your Steam library in VR (specially if those games support Oculus Rift controls)

Ordered two of these one for each of my grandsons. They absolute love these things. Just wish it came with a few more free games with it. 
The only thing that i wish i had never bought which came highly reccomended by the sales person. That was the straps that was suppose to have tightened the head set on.They were like $49.99 each. could have purchased a few games for tat price.

I am in love with my new Oculus.  It has given me a reason to move.  I have a not found 1 game that does not require me to get up and get moving.  I enjoy the quality of the games and the prices are not that bad.  I am not a kid and want to loose some pounds and this is my new go to workout with out having to hit the gym after work.  I would recommend this for anyone of any age.

For the money this ia great set up. I'm not stoked about the fact that you MUST have a Facebook account in order to use this headset but it's a small price to pay for what it's capable of. Not the biggest selection of games yet but it is growing at a steady rate. It's pretty uncomfortable unless you invest in 3rd party accessories like a more evenly weight distributed head strap

The Oculus is a very cool tool for socialization, work, and fun! I’m very impressed. My only negative is that I feel like there aren’t a whole lot of storyline games made for VR. Most of the ones that I have come across are horror, sandbox or social games (that are overrun by children making weird noises). Overall, I do love it and I can’t wait to see what else they do with it!

This is a beta product at best. Literally every review says "if you want to make your Quest 2 work with ______, then you need to buy a _______ from a 3rd party." Over and over, nothing but half-baked ideas and terrible fitment. Save your money and buy something usable. Add to that the fact that you need a Facebook account to use it and this thing becomes an instant paperweight.

I purchase electronics year round, while enjoying things along the way. But nothing has trjly blown me away over the last couple of years...until now. I possess a PSVR and felt that was an awesome bit of tech until I bought the Oculus Quest 2! This thing is a game changer and I've enjoyed every bit of it anytime its powered up. The best tech ive purchased in a very long time.

Crazy fun. The required Facebook account is creepy and annoying but the device and games are incredible.  Library of games is growing and is adequate currently. Most decent games are $15-$30/ea, so build that cost in. Purchased a universal head mount replacement for the kids smaller head.  Note that a silicone replacement (for the installed foam seal) face seal is in the box.

It’s been a while since I’ve had this much fun gaming. The experience is incredible. Even some of the mistakes people have (falling over, walking into a wall, sudden feeling of fear from heights when on a building edge) make everything gut wrenching Lu funny. This is whole family entertainment and a good amount of games. Recommend someone and get points for both you and them!

I bought this as a gift for my brother for his birthday! He immediately started setting it up and said the graphics and sound quality was amazing. It also came in a very nice box and was well packed.  I bought a second one for me and my family at home to enjoy as well. We have the Oculus Rift S and the quality of that was is awesome so I’m sure we’ll be happy with this one!!!

Yes, yes and yes. If you're still debating on getting it, don't look further. It competes with some of the higher end headsets out there and it's wireless so there's no competition. There are updates on it all the time so it's just getting better. Great product for any age group. Not only for gamers but for creatives as well. A lot of great apps and games for a decent price.

Overall, this is a great entry in the VR space, and 'no cords' really is awfully nice.  The field of view and resolution are not the best there is, but they are pretty nice - better than I expected.  Battery life on the headset goes pretty quickly, but again - it's to be expected.  Overall, for $299, it's a great value with a pretty extensive game catalog at your fingertips.

My wife and I both love playing this. She isn't really into gaming, but she still enjoys it! Also fun to bring out when you have guests, and everyone wants to try it.

I have a big head, the straps can be a little uncomfortable at times, but I don't play for more than 30 minutes at a time, so no big deal. The battery could be better, but for the price I'm still impressed.

This thing is amazing! If you've never tried VR before then this is the perfect package to get you started. It has lots of free games that can get you started. The 128gb is more than enough for the average user. I love the guardian setup, its very useful, Although I wish you cold turn it off completely sometimes. I have to say that a couples times I have been playing BeatSaber and while in the menus it will go black, like it went to sleep. After trying to turn it on it will show the logo but go black again, like its in a boot loop. I've had to hold the power button for like 15 seconds for it to completely restart. Not sure if its a software issue or the game, but it hasn't happened since. The battery life lasts me about 2.5 hours playing BeatSaber and the controllers will last about a month. The tracking is also pretty good, the lighting has to be right though. Overall, very cool headset to have I'm very pleased!

I had this for over a month and returned it. I purchased it during a sale where I was given a $50 gift card. The idea of the meta verse is interesting but wearing the device is uncomfortable on my eyes. I tried adjusting it using advice I've found online and it helped a bit but I still couldn't stand eye strain after 30 min. And I would get bored quickly. It's not for me.

Bought this as a christmas gift for my adult son who has everything and he loved it so much, he said he felt like a kid again.  He loved it so much, told my daughter about the Oculus and she requested one for her birthday which was 2 week after christmas.  She says its as addictive as social media.  My kids usually hates the gifts I give them, I think I found a winner!!

Pay all this money for a game where you want mobility and the system provides a 3 foot cord.  Really?   For $200 more you can buy the extra battery head strap.  Come on man. Just make the cord longer for continuous play if needed.

This is by far my favorite vr headset, for the price it more than worth it. It includes stunning vr visuals a pretty sizable selection of games and the best part is no 1500$ gaming pc required. If your someone looking to just get into vr this is the place to start and you may find yourself using it as your daily driver even if your someone like me with a valve index.

I had the old oculus Go and bought this as an upgrade.  I’d say it’s way more than an upgrade!  This is the real deal VR experience!  I am surprised that such a small device can do what this does!  I definitely recommend Beat Saber.  It’s a really fun game that makes good use off all the fun things this can do and is easy enough for an old guy like me to figure out!

So much fun!!! This was a gift for my wife and she actually enjoyed traveling in and around cities with the use of one of the gaming softwares. I played Darth Vader and it is actually pretty good. The only thing is that I wear glasses and when I need to put it on and take the Oculus off I have to be delicate to avoid scratching it. Other than that it is pretty good.

This is fantastic! Much more than I expected. 3 co-workers have already purchased one after seeing the one I purchased. Games, movies, apps all in one device that transports you to another reality (virtually). I’ve purchased several games for it, but there are many free things to do as well. Highly recommended, it’s not “Ready Player One” yet but it’s a great start.
if you are at all prone to motion sickness do not buy this as it cannot be returned once opened! having said that it is well made and great technology but the feeling can be very uncomfortable

The build quality is not as good as the original Quest. It feels a bit cheaper, because it is a bit cheaper.

It is still a great intro into VR and it has higher resolution and framerates than the original.

Not going to find something better at this price point and since they no longer make the controllers for the original it is hard to recommend that one instead.

I know it is just the begginig of VR so the headset is big and gheavy but... It is to the point I cannot spend much time doing anything... I ended up reselling it.
I got headache wearing it because I have to tightly adjust the headset to my head...
Also, I had allergic reaction to the foam.
I won't be buying any VR headset until it gets much lighter and wearable.

The reason I give this a low review is because in the very small print in the instruction manual it warns you not to let children younger than 13 use the game. This should be printed in large print in the ads and on Best Buys site. I returned it because we wanted it for children not adults. It says it can damage their vision since their eyesight is not developed.

As any other product it has its pros and cons. Its biggest pro is that you can use it wirelessly or you can connect to your computer. Be aware, it does not include the cable to link it to your computer which is a separate buy. also, the connection is type-c usb so be mindful of that when buying. My only concern is that the system gets really hot in prolonged use.

I would have given a 5 star but there are no instructions and a start up guide would be handy since you can't operate a phone/tablet and wear the VR device at the same time. I liked it enough that I bought one for my daughter. I'll close saying it would have been a whole lot better experience if there was some kind of guide instead of fumbling your way through.

Its fun and works with both a pc and standalone. I recommend setting it up with limited privacy and sharing settings. Facebook requires a login.. It's fun tech at the expense of your data going back to "Facebook" and in recent events show - money making is their only concern  however they want with data collection on your digital identity. It's creapy and wrong.

Have tried and used VR in the past but the Oculus is amazing. The immersiveness of the headset is incredible making you feel like you're actually in the bowling alley or on the golf course. I would recommend an Oculus to anyone looking for something new, not just for gaming but for much more journey to the ends of the world fly through the endless vast of space.

I’ve had the oculus quest and recently upgraded to the quest 2. Picture quality is slightly better, things seem to run really smooth. My favorite redesign is the controllers and being actually see how much battery life each one has left.The new UI more user friendly then before and the headset is smaller and lighter which is a definite plus. I’m glad I upgraded.

The VR headset was bought for my son. He absolutely loves it! But… I’m upset because one of the only reasons I spent over $300 was to receive a $50 e gift card for Best Buy and I HAVE NOT RECEIVED ANYTHING =( it’s been a week! And today’s Black Friday and I would of loved to use it today. Very disappointed. Hopefully it still sent to me eventually to redeem!!!!!

Is this the future? I don't know, but I have been having a blast with it. The 360 experiences and Big Screen app have been 90% of what I've used it for. I feel I've barely scratched the surface.
