I do get nauseous when playing it, and it hasn't gone away despite many people telling me it will. Still, I enjoy it in small bursts of 30 minute sessions and I'm fine.

I told the wife I bought this as exercise equipment for myself. She didn’t believe me and lectured me on how I didn’t need another video game system, until she tried the exercise game supernatural.   Now she wants to go get herself one. This thing is amazing.  You get totally immersed in another world.   Highly recommend this if you have the space to let loose.

The Oculus Quest 2 is an awesome device for the money. There’s a lot of experiences and fun things to try. For example there’s videos on YouTube that make you feel like you are there. Playing games in VR is super fun you feel immersed into the game. The only bad thing is you might get motion sick but if you have enough experience with VR you will get over it.

this was a Christmas gift for our grandson and he loves it.  It was something on his Christmas list.  As soon as he opend it he started setting it up and began enjoying it.  Perfect gift.
We purchased this via Best Buy website.  Product was available and ready for us to pick up pretty quick.  The has everything set up so well - we were in and out very quick.

After years of using the original rift and having motion sickness due to the screen door affect I have decided to upgrade and it was well worth it.
I went from only playing 30 or so minutes at a time to hours in one sitting. 
I love that i can hook it up to my computer for access to my steam library and the games in the quest 2 store are pretty good as well.

I was hesitant about buying this because we already have a PS VR but so glad I did! This VR blows the old one out of the water. So easy to transport and the quality is so much better. My kids couldn’t be happier and us adults even gave it a go. It’s awesome and so happy with my last minute purchase. Their friends tried it out and decided they needed one too!

I bought this on a whim to see what all this VR stuff was about.  I was so amazed at the virtual world that unfolded around me once I fired it  up and put the headset on.  The optics are fabulous, but I  would suggest getting a headset adapter because the elastic strap is not that comfortable to use.  Otherwise, this is a well constructed and amazing device.

Y'all are a joke.. my item was sent to a different address in a totally different state and i was told that i wouldn't receive refund or anything...not to mention my name wasn't correct...you just let anyone call in and make fraudulent request..whoever is working for you guys and did this needs to be fired!! Yall record the calls go back and listen to it!!!

So much Fun for the whole Family! Easy to set up and love how the game itself creates a safe boundary where the game turns off if you pass it (keeping you from walking into things lolz) Love how it also gets the kids moving. Only downside, or plus depending on how you see it, long periods of playing does give us a headache (making screen time a little less)

Overall it’s really great! There’s a few things like comfortability that take a while to find. Personally I wear a hat backwards to help the most, otherwise it’s uncomfortable on my head. But gameplay is fantastic! Also love the Oculus store and how you can return a game within a few days if you have less than (I think) 2 hours played and you don’t like it!

It has been an adventure I am blown away by what I have found in experiences like being underwater exploring the ocean reefs, touring cities or being in outer space are amazing,  The included tutorials are also exceptional.  You will need a good amount of clear space to enjoy some experience but the area guardian dose a good job if you have a high ceiling.

had been curious about AI/VR and knowing this is the best out there, I bit the bullet and bought this.  I wasnt disappointed. It works as advertised and in line with other reviewer's observations. I am not really a video gamer. So I use it mainly to watch 360 deg youtube videos and some basic games that come with it. Looking forward to a good Golf game :-)

had been curious about AI/VR and knowing this is the best out there, I bit the bullet and bought this.  I wasnt disappointed. It works as advertised and in line with other reviewer's observations. I am not really a video gamer. So I use it mainly to watch 360 deg youtube videos and some basic games that come with it. Looking forward to a good Golf game :-)

My son bought this for himself and won't stop playing.  He loves it.  I played the Beat Saber demo once and found it to be fun.  The technology is pretty cool, how it draws a virtual boundary in the room you are playing in, so that you don't hit walls.  
Make sure you put the silicone covering over the foam on the goggles, or else you end up with chaffing.

This is an interesting product.  An avid gamer my entire life, it was my first dip into the "Meta" Pool.  The water is warm here and I am enjoying my time with it.  I got most of the essential accessories and the family can enjoy it too.  It's the perfect segway into VR and I will now become a part of the eco system.  Its not perfect, just a great product

I am legitimately blown away by this device and what it is capable of at the price it is at. It places the games in the store flawlessly. I love how I can connect it to my PC to unlock its full potential by playing more demanding games off of it as well!! The only downside is how you have to connect to FaceBook and you can’t cast to an Apple TV natively.

My daughter is 14, and when she started working, her goal was to buy this for herself. Not only did she save more than she needed, but she was so proud of herself for purchasing with her own money and her bank card. She spent a few days in her room, even fell asleep with it on one night, and woke with an imprint of the glasses that lasted all day. Lol

After seeing all the crazy videos online I decided to get an Oculus. I’ve been having a blast with it. I primarily play a fishing game to relax and a boxing game to get my heart rate up and get a little exercise in. First person shooters make me motion sick though. Guess that takes some getting used to. Be sure to get the extended battery head strap.

I was worried that the headset would fail me on the first try but it broke expectations. It feels lighter than I thought and it feels good to move your head in and doesn’t feel like a weight on your head. The only thing that I wished was better is if there was an easier way to connect to your pc to get steam games. Other than that I highly recommend.

This is our second Quest 2 for the household. I got one and I wanted to be able to play with my husband so we got him one too. These are SOOOO much fun and way better than any flat-screen game. I previously had a Nintendo Wii (which obviously I haven't used for several years) and this brought me right back to all the fun I used to have with that. :)

This device is fantastic! We have been having a blast playing on it! Games are sold separately, but many of them are free to play if you don’t want to purchase anything. The headset dies in 2-3 hours so I would recommend a long charging cord to go with it. If you’re sitting down you can get motion sick, so standing up helps or take frequent breaks.

Although it does have some cool games and features, the Oculus Quest is no short of a nightmare to use. The use of the system caused me to get extreme nausea and sickness after less than minutes of use. Controls also arent best even while in VR and make games rather confusing to play. Overall, dont let Facebook tell you this is the future, its not.

Easy to set up, easy to use, easy to lose track of time! Even had a blast picking my "home" in settings. Watched some immersive videos on Oculus tv. The 3D is awesome! Had a blast with the tutorial, First Steps, and learned how to use the controllers and manipulate objects. Then I purchased and played Vader Immortal... whole new level! Lots of fun!

At this price point, the Oculus Quest 2 is a no brainer when it comes to overall quality and VR experience.  I bought this primarily to use with RealFlight 8 software on a PC and it works great with no setup issues at all.  To connect to the computer, I’m using the Insignia™ - 16.4' USB-C Virtual Reality Headset Cable which is BestBuy’s less expensive version of the Oculus branded cable.  Download and run the Oculus app and you are good to go.  I had no issues whatsoever.  Using the Quest 2 as a stand alone VR headset (not connected to a computer) is absolutely amazing.  Being immersed in a game is an experience way beyond playing a game on a flat screen.  You can even watch movies on popular apps like Netflix and Prime while “sitting” in beautiful virtual theater rooms.  Pretty cool.  I’m also impressed with the built in sound and I should mention, the microphone quality is amazing when communicating in virtual rooms.  I love this thing!

Overall it’s got potential.  Not a fan of Facebook integration but what can you do.  Some cool apps but games are pricey just to see if you like them.  Build quality is not as good as I thought would be.  Battery also dies quickly in my experience so I got the extra elite battery and strap.  I like the idea but not quite as good as I was hoping.

Excellent Product, so much you can do with this device, via virtual desktop, side quest, Steam VR and VorpX. Also using Developer options, No need for exspensive cables, cheaper ones work good once configured properly. But love the freedom to not have wires, a must Buy, but there right not the best for kids, unless your supervising them closely.

The oculus is absolutely mind blowing. I’ve never experienced anything like it in my life. The immersion is spectacular. I bought this for my son for Christmas but I’ve spent quite a few hours while he was at school using it. I wanted to verify it worked before he opened it and possibly had a DOA unit. It is absolutely worth the purchase price!!

This was an Xmas gift for my youngest who has been asking for one for several months.  Not only was she in disbelief and excited when she opened the gift, she has had a great time so far exploring its features.  She has not done too much on it yet but loves it so far, as has everyone who has tried it for a few minutes.  Very highly recommended.

Haven’t put this game down since it’s been delivered to my home. This is an very excellent gaming system, it’s so much that you can do on it. I really love playing this VR system along with my children. My oldest son play it non stop, everything just seem so realistic. Most definitely something to get, especially if you do family fun/game night

Wireless freedom is nice. Has one major flaw that hopefully will get resolved soon but no ETA given. The flaw is it just not support win 11. Airlink is choppy. There are some solutions by putting debug mode. While they help it is not perfect. I will not reinstall and go back to win 10. Hope they can work with Microsoft and get this fixed soon.

The one star is not for the product itself but for the difficulties I am having to even begin using it. Have been unable to use due to issues when trying to create a Facebook account. Oculus support has been unable to help and Facebook makes it impossible to contact them. $300 brick. I will change my review if I am ever able to get it working.

This product is very awesome.  If you haven't experience virtual reality, this is really fun.  You have to make separate purchases if you want games or whatever, but it all depends on your budget.  If you can afford to paid the money for this, you can expect to spend some more dollars for the games too.  Was it worth it? Sure.  Is it fun. Yes.

So disappointed I returned it. I don’t play video games so I got it for sightseeing. YouTube videos and reviews said it was great for that. It’s not. Pictures and videos are grainy and not precise. I couldn’t even find the free apps in the store the reviewers talked it. Plus the headset was letting light in because it wouldn’t fit correctly.

System is great! This is our 3rd Oculus Quest 2. Only issue is the “drifting” controllers. With all the movement playing games and exercising with the Oculus, the controllers get messed up. Facebook /Oculus needs to fix this issue otherwise this system will not be our last!

Make sure to buy the 2 year Geek Squad protection! It is worth it!

It's pretty cool for a standalone VR. I use it for steamvr and with my pc setup it runs and looks great. One thing that I dislike about it is that even when plugged up using a branded cable, it still dies while playing. I used to have the htc vive, which was a downgrade in a lot of ways compared to the quest 2 - but I never got motion sickness when using it. With the Quest 2 I get headaches after playing it for short periods. The fitment over the nose is really strange too and if you don't get the headset tight enough you will fog up your lenses. But it seems like when i get it tight enough it is TOO tight and ends up cutting off blood flow in my head. Overall I would recommend it but you will probably need to spend extra money to be able to find your comfort zone with it.
My headaches aside, it's a great device. This is just my personal experience with it, I will definitely continue to use it and experiment with fitment to find my comfort zone.

The Oculus Quest 2 is a lot of fun did have to buy an upgraded head strap because the one that comes with the set is somewhat uncomfortable on my head.  I have lost weight playing Beat Saber.  It is a lot of fun.  My wife likes to do virtual travel/sightseeing with it.  I'm going to bring it to the in-laws for the Holidays. It will be fun!

This worked perfectly right out of the box (as it should). Picking it up at Bestbuy worked perfectly also.  I was expecting a wait picking it up Saturday during Christmas shopping season.  When I arrived I asked the blue shirt by the door where to pickup and he pointed to an empty spot at the pickup counter.  I was in and out in 3 minutes.

This thing is awesome! I was skeptical but really enjoy it. My wife and I use it with the Supernatural workout app and love it. I wasn't sure since I get motion sick so was concerned about that but haven't had any issues with that either. 100% would recommend to anyone, especially someone who needs something to help with at home workouts!

Bought it as birthday gift for my daughter. It was so easy to just get it out of the box and start using it. We had to create a FB account , but that’s fine. The only thing that I don’t like is how it doesn’t have many access to free games. I’m almost on my thirty’s so I guess dizzy quick, wouldn’t recommend for adults only teenagers lol.

Bought this for my son and found myself using it more than he does. He enjoys the wide array of VR interactive games. 
My favorite is “visiting “  places like the Amazon rainforest in VR.  
 
Skydiving ,roller coasters, ocean diving…. You name it . So many possibilities.

Never expected affordable consumer VR 
Technology to be this good.

The Oculus is a lot of fun. I have purchased 3 of these as I enjoyed mine so much that my children wanted their own. Great for exercise as well. My only complaint is to be careful when wanting to get your credit for referring someone. Ensure that they click your link PRIOR to setting anything up or neither of you will receive the credit.

This is amazing this was my 10yr Christmas gift but everyone in the house is obsessed with this. Glad I have total tech I feel confident in purchasing expensive electronics from Best Buy. I will definitely be buying more of these for my other kids and husband. Walk the plank is a good game.. definitely check it out and use a real board..

My child loves this system. Please don’t go into it thinking all the games are free, they aren’t. I’m glad I was aware before we purchased. I find that the games are good quality and worth their cost. Charging and battery life is great, it’s comfortable for my child. I also love that I can view on my phone what she is seeing at any time.

Best purchase of 2022. Entering the meta verse with the right foot. I’ve have had so much fun with my Quest 2. I wonder what took me so long to buy it now. Unfortunately the battery only lasts between 2-3 hours and there are not many games available, but it is totally worth it. We’ll see more games coming thru in the next following years

Oculus Quest 2 is great! Only negative is the fact you need a Facebook to use the online store (there are ways around it with a little research). It was super easy to setup and pretty seamless with setting up with my PC though that is not needed. Highly recommend this as a VR headset, 299$ is a great price point for this product as well.

If you have ever thought about VR, get this. Don't need a PC to run it, plenty of wonderful experiences, and a great experience to share with family and friends. If you have a good PC, it can also act as a headset for PC based VR games (with the right link cable or wirelessly). Been having a ton of fun in the few weeks I have owned this.

The graphics are amazing! Only downfall is accessing games. Wish we didn't have to have a Facebook account to purchase games. Hope to see more games come out, and a new platform to purchase games. And although it is possible for others to "gift" a game, it is a lengthy process to do so. Overall we are definitely happy with our purchase!

Picked this up as last minute Christmas gift for my 21 yo son. Hard to know what to get for him these days, but he loved it. My sister also got one for my young nephew and they were able to use their oculus VRs together. I looked in it and was impressed. Pretty good technology for the money. Easy setup and lots of features like Netflix.

My son loves it and has a blast playing a LOT of vr since we got this. The battery life is not good 2.5 hrs on a good day. unless you get an external battery sole aftermarker straps can hold a 10mwh battery which adds about 6-7 hrs or you can get the elite strap with battery which adds about 3 hrs. overall it was well worth  the money.

This is my second Quest 2, I gave the first one to my brother.

This is the best Oculus/Meta version by far. tracking is surreal, incredibly easy to use, and fits for either light or hardcore gaming if you have Oculus Link and a PC.

I wish the battery lasted longer but it's understandable looking at how small and light the device is.

This is the best deal in vr; it has a better quality screen than the Rift VR and can play PC VR games wirelessly in addition to the untethered games.  

The additional 64gb of storage over the previous model is useful because Oculus games don't back up your saves and because there are newer games coming out that take up a lot of space

Great website experience in purchasing an Oculus Quest 2 for my brother. The product was easy to find on the Best Buy website and was promptly available for pickup. I was able to change the pickup contact with no issues. Overall great customer experience on the website. As for the Oculus, it was for my brother, but I know he's geeked!

Might have given five stars if not for having to use a Facebook account to get started. Maybe I'm one of the few people who don't have a Facebook account, but it was frustrating to start my 3D adventures with this impediment. Device itself is nice. Fits well for me. Games look great, but still getting used to them, so taking it slow.

I love this VR headset. I play mostly Echo VR in it, but dabble in other games frequently enough to appreciate it's standalone features. If you are a gamer and want to play extended sessions, pick up a battery pack that fits in your back pocket since that's the biggest shortcoming, closely followed by the limited eyepiece adjustment.

I tried the hp reverb g2 and didnt like it so i returned it and got this and was much happier. The oculus was way easier to setup and has easy to navigate interface/software. I did need to buy a headset strap for comfort though, and the link cable since i didnt have stable wifi which is something you should consider when purchasing.

Pretty cool for playing games. Some games are difficult to maneuver around without losing your balance or feeling nauseated. Mostly 1st person shooters for me.
Other games like the Star Wars ones have different movements so i can play without feeling sick.
Overall a pretty neat system and fun for many of the games I've tried so far.

I'd give it five stars if it weren't for the Facebook login requirement.  The headset is a great value, especially for PC gaming with something like Steam VR.  The 128 gb of RAM on this model vs. 256 gb on the more expensive version doesn't come in to play there.  Even with that, you can still get a lot of stuff on the 128gb model.

Ok so most people think "At this price range its going to be a mediocre experience into VR" ... You will be AMAZED at this devices capabilities . I've had more fun on this VR then I've had fun on my gaming console . The things you will experience with VR are like no other in comparison . PLEASE TRY THIS YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT !!!!

It's a lot of fun, and I can't wait to unlock all the features and apps available. 

My only complaint is the eye area isn't large enough for my glasses, even with the eyeglass extender on (but my frames are larger than usual though.  I also notice that sometimes my left controller isn't always calibrated, but it's not a problem.

Great virtual gaming for adults!  Impressive technology in a great package.  Includes a free introductory video to explore virtual worlds and option to purchase additional games ($30-$50).

Battery is sufficient, a Facebook account is required to login.  Recommend purchasing Oculus stand for storage to keep your Oculus organized.

This vr is awesome. If you are new to be there is an adjustment period and some games can make you feel sick such as the roller coaster games. But I really enjoy the play options as well as being able to be submerged in what ever you watch!! Only thing is will say like all vr headsets it is not recommended for children under 13.

Great device, though, I wish it didn't have a required link to a facebook account. Also, regardless of tightness or adjustments, visualizations still seem blurry at times. Would be nice if some of the weight of the device was transferred to the back of the head, it can feel like your face is weighed down significantly sometimes.

This is a product with a lot of potential and my company started using for some interaction in virtual space for tests. It's light to use and the controls are very responsive. I cannot hold more than one hour using though as my eyes get tired. Try to get the version with more memory space in case you will install multiple games.

Yup! All the good reviews are correct… awesome games, awesome experience and tons of fun. Needing to have a Facebook wasn’t a huge deal and signing in was easy. Buying games is getting a bit expensive but overall, not surprising. Has some demos so that you can try games out and absolutely love the wireless aspect of this thing!

Incredibly fun, it get expensive buying all the games, but wait for them to go on sale, every game that I have bought at full price has gone on sale at least twice within the last 6 months. And the battery life is poor so get a 10 foot cable to charge while you play. Also, invest in a different headband, you'll be glad you did.

I got this after a friend told me about the fun she had working out and I was skeptical. However, after getting through the initial setup, I can confirm there are titles that can get you moving without needing a ton of space and make you sweat. Fun titles and videos to sit down and watch while utilizing the full 360 experience.

I was hesitant at first because I tend to stick to the mainstream gaming system but I am overall pleased. I don't use it too often but still good to have when I do feel like having an immersive experience. In addition to games there you can access Netflix, Explore other parts of the world, and you can even watch VR dirty vids

I bought this for my grandkids but ended up buying myself one to! It’s a perfect to play games, exercise, watch movies to! I spend a lot of time playing on this thing and the cool part is that I can play simultaneously with my grandkids when we all play the same game! This is a great buy and will give the family hours of fun!

A must have gaming system.  Great workout.  Fun for the whole family.  So far, the free games to download have been awesome.
The head strap is the weak point of the device.  Difficult to adjust.  I've ordered a different style strap to replace.  Also, get the Anker charging station.  It keeps the Oculus organized and charged.

Package was lost but received a replacement after I reached out to Best Buy via expedited shipping. It can get a little hot when playing the oculus which I hope they improve upon in future generations and it isn’t the most comfortable thing to put on. Favorite games would be thrill of the fight, beatsaber, and population one

I work as a Software Tester. Once I got Oculus to test, and was surprised. I never knew that technologies made a big step ahead. After testing I ordered Oculus Quest-2. I am very satisfied by the product but I am sure that I should wait for the device more to buy 256Gb. In any case, it is the best purchase of the whole year!

Ok privacy aside I am really digging the VR universe. Beat Saber is a blast and there are a ton of apps that can be downloaded through the headset. And if you plan on using a type c cable to computer then you have access to all of those games as well. Steam VR is also available and adds more options to your gaming inventory.

Rhats what i did... Upgraded from a Rift CV1 to this headset. Air link is amazing, letting me play in a larger room away from my PC. The higher resolution, clearer lenses, and 120hz refresh are incredible. You will not be disappointed! Dont forget to get a referral code BEFORE you set it up so you can get some store credit!

I love this thing other than the fact that when playing the quality is blurry.. I bought the elite strap and it changed the experience i was able to adjust the head strap where it wasn’t blurry anymore. The things you can do with this thing are pretty awesome! It’s actually enjoyable once you figure out all the adjustments.

Purchased for our youngest son (8yo) for his birthday.  He loves it and so does his mom.  There are some free games, but most of the games cost money and they can get expensive quick.  Also, be aware that you need a little space to play so if your kid's bedroom isn't big enough they will end up taking over your living room.

I’m really glad I bought this for my son! He loves it. It shows you how to use the vr and has a lot of things to see and do on it. It does let you create a safe space while playing so you won’t get out of the safe box and run into things. Make sure you buy a stand , charging station or case because it doesn’t come with it.

I love love ❤️  my occulus. I love working out with it...its so much fun! Its really fun if your able yo catch a concert or a sporting event in VR...I watched a concert in VR.Front row seating! I cant even descibe it.My advice to you is if you see eiher bring aired in virtual reality by all means DO IT..You wont regret it!

I bought this as a gift and I can say that it works very well. It does takes some time to get used to and getting the hang of it can be frustrating but it is all worth it once you do. The only other thing that I felt was ehh was the fact that you have to buy almost all the games that are good. Overall it is a good product.

This thing is amazing!  If you are looking for something that will give you lots of entertainment (as well as family entertainment), this is it!  Also, be ready to at least invest in a third-party strap.  There are a few online that are way better than the one that comes with it.  Otherwise, this is a great purchase/gift!

Bought this as a Christmas gift for my son. He shares it with his siblings. My kids love this. They really have fun with the device. Seeing them stream their gaming with this with their friends or casting it to the TV is really awesome. Motion Sickness is the a drawback for these things. Also, it doesn't feel that sturdy.

My son loves it and that’s all it matters... Before you buy make sure your pc is vr ready by running ‘steam vr test’. You’ll need pc to run some games that are not available on the headset ie Roblox. After you buy head to YT and watch some videos especially how to air link - it’ll save you time and headache trying to dyi.

I am new to using vr equipment and found this easy to use.  I am working to get good focus using my eye glasses but I suspect that if you don't need glasses, there would be little problem.  The battery life seems to be a little short, maybe about 2 hours, but one probably shouldn't use it for longer than that at one time.

This headset is overall really good just to play vr  in a while for fun. My only problem is the comfort and you have to keep readjusting when graphics get a little blurry. Overall good for the money and would not disappoint no pc required I’m sure you will be fine I have not took time adjusting and setting everything up.

I got this for my boyfriend as a Christmas gift and gave it to him early. He loves it! He plays it whenever he gets the chance and it really feels like you’re there! The experience is perfect for anyone that isn’t able to travel much, because it has so many exploration games. The games truly give an immersive experience.

Having had several of the prior generation VR headsets I had almost given up on the idea.  The cable always in the way, accidentally crashing into things, etc...

These change the game completely.  Performance is great, convenience is AMAZING.  No more cable, no more crashing into things.  Very fun for all ages - try it.

The Oculus was such a big hit with my children that I had to purchase two (2)!!!! It’s an amazing way to keep in touch and play games with their friends in other states! However my husband may like this Christmas gift better than the kids do! It keeps them busy, moving, and interacting with family and friends everywhere!

Great product, much more comfortable to wear than I anticipated. It's my first VR product, so can't really compare it to other systems, but would definitely recommend the Oculus if your interested in getting started in VR. Would definitely recommend getting a longer data cable and the Elite Head Strap for added comfort.

My hubby got me an oculus for my birthday and i started playing it and i was hooked! Then I let the family get on and they all wanted one of their own so for christmas we bought all 6 of our kids their own oculus quest! Best gift ever! I can rarely get them to come out of the virtual world..lol! we dont regret it at all

Wow.  What a blast.  Worth every penny, already.  My whole family has had a blast, and I think we've barely scratched the surface.  Hard to say what's more fun - playing, or watching others play... it's a total riot.  The future of gaming, and everything else, is here - it's VR, and it is already an amazing experience.

It was a Christmas gift for the hubby and he loves it. He was able to watch a documentary with it and he said that it was like he was there. 
However, if you get motion sickness easy, this is probably not for you. I do and I can’t use it for more than 5 minutes. Dramamine might be the answer but I haven’t tried it yet.

I used to have the HTC Vive. While yes running VR on PC tends to perform better. I have no complaints about performance or quality of experience. Immersive experience that gives the flexibility to play anywhere without requirement of PC. Cons: Battery life, basic head strap is uncomfortable after long periods of time.

Unless you plan on buying 50+ games, I find the 128GB to be plenty and am happy I didn't go for the 256GB.

This thing is awesome. Only thing I can say I wish was better is the battery life, but I understand there are separate battery packs you can buy that give it a longer life without having to be charged as often.

I bought this for my nephew for Christmas, he couldn't contain his excitement when he opened this up, he was so impatient that he didn't even want to charge the headset, let alone, let it charge for less than 10 minutes. (He lets it charge now)

I haven't tried it out but he absolute loves it and that makes me happy.

I am enjoying my VR set very much. very easy to navigate. initial sign on was fairly easy to do to get started. I don't have FB so I needed to make a profile and just set all on private. 
it is easy to get hooked on playing. I sit down or I'm sure I'd have a YouTube video to post otherwise! 
A lot of fun for sure!!!

This Oculus Quest 2 is a new level of entertainment and interaction and can only be judged by experience. Try it, buy it, and you will find a game or experience worth the cost of the device. Not sure I’m right? Watch ANY video on YT about the quest 2 and see the various ways this can bring joy to your everyday life.

Such an awesome experience either with family, friends, or on your own. I bought this as a motivation to move more and gey more exercise. Not only am I getting a work out but even the athletes in my family are getting a work out playing some of the games. I'm looking to buy another one so we can play in team events.

Best affordable VR headset, definitely worth buying. I was a little worried that I wouldn’t find enough games to make the purchase worth it, but when I bought the headset and browsed the store, there are a bunch of amazing titles on this console. If you’re someone who enjoys VR then I highly recommend this headset.

I always wanted to experience VR, but had trouble with fitting various ones from other brands due to my glasses finding them uncomfortable, if they fit at all. Well the Oculus Quest 2 has been the answer! I haven't even needed to use the adapter insert for glasses and it's so comfortable and not as heavy as I expected. I have worn it several hours at a time and never got any headaches or experienced any dizziness like I often have with others. And the graphics are amazing! I would suggest not waiting and just buying a case or stand for storing or travel right away. It seems the charge depletes rapidly when it's carried around loose in a bag which I do regularly as I take it to work with me to help my 12 hour solo night shift pass by. If the controllers tap together or if the power button on the headset gets touched it turns on and a proper case would eliminate that completely! Set up was mostly easy and straight forward, but it did take a little longer than anticipated.

Purchased the first one for the kids but realized I was having WAAAY too much fun so I had to get them another one. It is really great in getting me to actually workout with realizing it. Speaking work out, the exercise games and apps are really cool. One of the best purchases I have made that I am VERY HAPPY with.

The device is fun, but unless you have a good gaming PC to run it on, the games on the headset aren’t that immersive. If you have a gaming PC, you will need to connect your PC to a Wifi 6 router via Ethernet in order to play wirelessly with low latency. If you can set all this up, the 120hz frame rate is worth it.

Got it as a Christmas gift and it didn't fit my glasses. Added the glasses spacer but that didn't add any width so it still didn't fit. Tried to order prescription lenses and it said my prescription was not within their range. Very frustrating that the product is not glasses friendly. Will be looking to return it.

This is a great VR headset and has several free games to play to really get a feel for what VR has to offer, the games are fairly priced and offer a refund for games that amdo not meet the expectations, the only con is the time frame for the refund process and the battery life but overall a great buy and much fun

I couldn't believe how freaking awesome this would be! I only have the one game so far but this is by far the coolest thing I own, and I have some really neat stuff! So inexpensive too, less than what I spent on my phone. Oh and had I tried this before I got my 70' TV, I never would have bought the TV! Seriously.

My kids saved up their Christmas and birthday money and bought this for themselves. They absolutely love  it and have played Witt it almost everyday since. If I had any constructive criticism I wish the battery lasted longer but at least it gives the kids a limit of how long they can play. It lasts about 2 hours.

I absolutely love this product. Both my wife and I use it for playing the provided and paid games and it's quite the experience. I also use it with the Oculus VR Link cable to play Microsoft Flight Simulator to do some General Aviation training.

I will most likely purchase a second so my wife can have her own...

My son loves this. It truly is a wonder. I have to pry him away from it! The only thing I don’t like is I had to open a Facebook account to do anything with it. There is t really a way around that. I tried. I don’t use Facebook when possible. To many hacks. If I had known ahead of time, I wouldn’t have bought it.

I have always been a nintendo fan, and underestimated VR, but after trying it Holy cow! I'm blown away at how fun it is and that you can return digital games* if you don't like them.  I've wasted too much money on the eshop also before you set it up,  have some one referr you,  as you both get credit to buy games

Good product, games are fun. It takes some time to get use to as far as learning where you are in the room. I have a large bedroom but I tend to find myself in a counter every time, so if you don’t have enough space my suggestion is to find a bigger room.The only negative is battery life, it’s a constant charge.

My son has not put it down since Christmas.  The entire family gets enjoyment out of the interactive play that is so real and as if the objects are right in your face.  Mommy even tried it out and broke out in a sweat due to the amazing virtual reality!  Love It! Don’t wait buy it you will not be disappointed!!!

Don't be left out. Jump into the future, which is now! We ended up trying a family members Oculus over Christmas break and were totally wowed by the improvements made to VR. Superhot and Resident Evil 4 are absolute necessities. It's definitely worth the extra money for a better head band and grip covers/slings.

if you enjoy gaming welcome to the future, have now purchase 3 of these units. 1 for me and 2 for my sons. also note that you can buy and play vr games from steam so dont feel like your only limited to the oculus store ( need to be on same network as the pc your linking to ) so in doing so , the 128 gb is plenty

very fun product, I like the graphics and that it hardly has any type of failure.  it charges quickly and efficiently.  It also has good connectivity to Wi-Fi networks and downloads the games in a good time.  The only bad thing is that after a while of playing it, the eyes are irritated and / or the head hurts.

I own other VR headsets. The ability to play wireless with locally installed games on this unit as a standalone OR choose to use airplay to play games that reside on my computer nearby through WIFI make it an all around amazing solution. I expected lag on the airplay from another device but it works flawlessly.

Very fun.  Whole family loves playing on the oculus.  Just wish there was a way for more than one person to play without purchasing multiple units, but I don’t see how that could be possible.  So pretty pricey if you want to play together because you need to buy a device for each player.  Very fun nonetheless.

Debated buying this for a while, finally decided to pick one up glad I did been really enjoying it, use it atleast once a day, beat saber is a blast, got it really for fitness apps but seems like most require a monthly subscription, so havent really committed to any fitness apps, but still enjoying other apps.

Purchased as a second VR set for the house. Was hoping for a drastic video quality increase from my oculus 1 but I honestly didn't notice much. Controllers feel much more solid and the tracking is far superior. This has become my sole headset and the kids get my oculus 1.  Definitely recommend the pro headset.

I really hate that washing the headband is virtually impossible. I was told that it is, so if I try it out and I’m able to detach from device and wash it, I’ll update with 5 stars. The kids love it, it’s a really cool device. I wish more of our friends and family could afford and get for a more fun experience.

I bought this for my son. He put it on me and it was AMAZING!!! The graphics are so cool. It's Like you were really inside of it. He uses this EVERY DAY. I was skeptical because of the price, but it is worth the money. He plays with people from all over the  world, and has so much fun. Hours of entertainment!

I bought this for my two sons and then bought another for my grandson (and me too)! It is so much fun! I can’t wait to see other parts of the world! When my grandson played a game where you are riding a roller coaster, we laughed so hard when he lost his balance and fell back in his uncle! It’s so much fun!!!

Son loves it, but i think its to expensive.  Leaves marks on his face under his eyebrows and that is concerning. The PS4 VR did the same thing.  Had to open him a FB account to use, other options were cumbersome.  Paired to laptop for Mindcraft and it was not worth the hassle of all the downloads and pairing.

amazing device, we tried on while out of town at a video store and fell in love. we love having family over to try it out, it is such a neat experience. however, be advised that it can cause motion sickness and vertigo/nausea in some people, especially if you play the plank game where your fears come to life.

The image quality is better than I had expected. There are a lot of games to play and they can differ greatly. I would recommend getting the strap to adjust the size because it can run big and slip down. The immersive feeling is unlike any other vr I have tried. I recommend this for gamers and families alike.

I try VR like 3 years ago  when the boom started and then I got this device, definitely things are getting smother and better compared to 3 years ago and what makes this an awesome device is that is autonomus, no PC needed.
Con: Windows 11 is not fully supported on the Oculus software to use the link with PC

For the price it is absolutely a must buy for anyone looking to get into VR. I do have a very minor complaint but I have already solved that problem with $40 bucks. My complaint is the head strap it is not comfortable at all, so to fix the problem I purchased a kiwi elite strap and now the head set is a 5/5.

The Oculus Quest 2 is a great standalone headset. It can also be tethered to a gaming PC wirelessly or with a USB-C link cable. Virtual reality headsets have come a long way the last few years, and the Quest 2 is absolutely worth owning!

The biggest drawback is being forced to tie it to a Facebook account.

It's definitely the best stand-alone experience, mostly because there are no cords, and it doesn't need a fast machine.  There are limitations, however, such as the field of view not being as much, and the power being less, as well as a few artifacts and glitches in software, but overall, it's pretty cool.

I kove my Oculus 2 . The set up was easy and I'm technology challenged typically. It easy to find games. My only challenge is my glasses, and i already knew this could happen before buying. I wear progressive bifocals and its hard to get a comfortable fit, vision wise. I plan to order the replacement lens.

Totally worth. It has made me workout and also has some amazing titles. Oculus has an awesome refund policy too which has contributed to me wanting to support them even more. Definitely good for those new to VR with an affordable price. I even bought a gaming pc to play more games and graphic are awesome.

I have always wanted VR, I didn't want anything with cords cause i know how clumsy i am. This is amazing. for 300$ you can not beat this technology. Haven't had an issue with it at all. Pretty simple once you get the hang of it you don't wanna take it off. So many different games for all kinds of people.

Omg. Kids are finally moving while having screen time. The kids get sweaty and I had to buy the expert headband kit and cleaning wipes and plastic covers, but I love this thing. Haven’t even tried it, but anything that gives the kids that much of a workout!!! Their little muscles were sore the next day!!
I have a problem with Best buy delaying their shipment on Quest 2 of about 5 days and more upcoming delays in the future for the Quest 2.

The quest 2 is MUCH better than the Rift S.. because it is wireless and easy to use. The screen is pretty good no real issues, the only thing that bugs me is the headset feels a little heavy on my head.. after 45 mins of playtime i can feel it bringing my neck down, other than that must HAVE VR headset.

Is it as powerful as other, more expensive VR headsets? No. But it is the biggest bang for your buck! User friendly for VR newbies but with plenty of features for people who want more out of it. Plus, having the ability to connect to your PC to play Steam VR games makes this one of the best you can get.

This is a lot of fun. I was not sure what to expect with this item. But it is fun and entertaining. The games/apps can be pricey but it is nice most will let you try them for a period of time. I have not had it long enough to know if it holds up but my wife and kids have enjoyed playing with it as well.

This is the best money I’ve ever spent on entertainment!  I’m 54 woman and I’ve been having the most fun killing zombies and working out (having too much fun to realize what a work out it is). I play with this headset every single day. My grandkids were hoping I would bore of it. Nope GMA is keeping it.

This is a lot of fun for the whole family.  Its easy to navigate and easy to figure out. 
Draw back, you need an active Facebook account to use. It you are a Facebook jail habitual offender it will become a paper weight.  Also be prepared to spend more money on games, as the free ones arent that great.

This thing is so awesome and crazy how real it feels being in a virtual reality. Love being able to connect with family and friends that live far away and play games and interact with each other. Only thing I didn’t know prior to purchasing is you have to have a Facebook account to be able to use this.

The reason Im only giving this four stars is because when I wear it too long it causes my head to hurt and it dies too fast while playing. It feels like the battery life lasts an hour max sometimes of pure playing. Thats the only reason I'm giving it four stars, other than that: Tip top! Great product.

It was fun, however it's not really a shareable game due to the hygiene issue of the device going from one forehead to another. This is also not good for people who need bifocals or suffer from migraines. The concept is fun and cute, however we returned this because it wasn't fun for the entire family.

Love this product!  I bought my grandaughter one for Christmas and had so much fun with it we purchased a second one for the house. Definitely worth every penny.   The only thing I don't like is that the headset gets a little heavy on you head but only after prolonged use.  Overall I give it a solid A

this headset is a must have if you’re getting into vr. the quality and performance is perfect for a starter. The standalone feature is amazing and makes things so much easier. The headset overall is really comfortable and there’s so many aftermarket accessories you can buy to make it more comfortable.

I love this. I do t have any other vr set to compare it to, but this thing is great. It definitely got me sick at first. I havent downloaded a lot on it but theres lots of things besides games you can do. There are a lot of educational tools on here also. I work out with it. Supernatural is my go to.

Storage is my first gripe it doesn’t come with much but I also didn’t have to buy and expensive computer for it either plus PlayStation updated version isn’t out yet also u need a Facebook account which I don’t have but other than that it’s cool make sure too grab accessories because you’ll need them

Bought 3 of these for the kids. They love it and use them constantly. Looking forward to try watching some sports on it when baseball starts! Only downside is that it doesn't fit very well with my glasses. Might need to get a special pair or see if there is a way to focus it in for my prescription...

Had wanted one of these for over a year. Finally purchased this holiday season. So fun. Careful though as many can experience motion sickness. I jumped straight into intense games and that wasnt the best idea. start off with more relaxed games. Catch me playing mini golf or table tenis with the bois.

Great toy for the kids and me too. this system is a lot of fun my kid forgot he wanted a PS5, there is some free games on the app and found some cool games on the app for less than $25 bucks. the reason i didn't give 5 stars is the battery, the battery is horrible you can only play for about 30 mins.

Diving into VR for the very first time was an amazing experience and feeling, the vr headset works perfectly still is. If you want to know more about the quest 2 go to YouTube & watch Virtual Panda. I also dived into Vrchat, add me on oculus and Vrchat at LLENN_19 

Add me on Instagram too at im.___v

My friends have the original Oculus, and I had a blast playing it, beatsaber, watching netflix is pretty fun, it's your own personal theater experience. the external speakers are really nice and immersive. Its a great mid tier vr system that won't break the bank and you will have an entertaining time

LOVE LOVE LOVE. This has been great family fun. It comes with some demo games. New games are easy to purchase. Like that it requires a password to access it if needed. Has held up to hours of play. Great for all age levels. Only complaint is that to adjust sizing from person to person can be a pain.

This is the future we have all been waiting for!  This Quest 2 is better than I expected!  I am using it with my computer and the Immersed App to see 5 Displays (4 Virtual) and see my iPhone (at the same time) all in Virtual Reality! Wow!  Plus gaming in 3D!  Social in 3D!  Wow!  This is the future!

I've resisted VR because it was too expensive and I didn't have the money to buy another computer to support it. This headset looks great and the games are amazing. I bought Resident Evil 4 and it runs smooth and is very immersive. I love this device and hope I can get more of my friends to get one.

so far, so good. i'm glad for the increased storage space and it has a lot of support online. looking forward to check out the much improved Virtual experience, and the ability to connect with my pc and play games via the Bluetooth connection.  we just need more sales on games at the oculus website

I absolutely love that I can do VR for quite a cheaper price! The quest 2 makes that possible and I love that it’s wireless. Of course you can still connect it to a PC or laptop to download extra stuff but having it wireless is great.
I wish there were more game options as well as a longer battery!

Works as advertised. If you can get car sick be careful. These can make you dizzy and it’s tough to play over long periods of time. Very fun to use. As a note their privacy policy is sus. I bought these for parties. Got them during Black Friday and got a $50 gift card with them. Nice deal Best Buy.

Absolutely blown away. The Multiverse is shapping up and you do not want to miss out! Being part of it with the Oculus Quest 2 is the way to go. 

It gets a 4 out of five due to the basic head strap and the face padding is pretty weak.

Four stars for the utility, smooth interface and price point!

I have not experienced any motion sickness using the Oculus so I am able to enjoy playing this alot more with my husband. We also own the PSVR, which I was never able to enjoy that often due to motion sickness from it. So not experiencing any motion sickness from the Oculus was a huge plus to me!!

Lives up to most of the hype.  Pros: easy to use, battery is decent, good selection of (free) games.  Cons: tethering seems a little twitchy (cable not included) and the headband isn't great.  My 12 year old is pretty happy with it though and NO WAY I was going to spend the $1000 for the next one.

As a mom I purchased this Oculus 2 for my family.  I found a workout game that I love and I have used this thing 81 days in a row.  (this is from a couch potato to a VR addict)  There are a lot of really fun games, but what I love is the workout game.  I'd recommend this to EVERYONE, it's so fun!

My son loves it.  He and his friends look hysterical when they are playing.  The one caution i would have is make sure you have an open area while you have the headset on and you are playing.  They have hit a few beds in the process of learning boundaries. Buy it and enjoy a better way of gaming.

This is super cool. Lots of fun content and fantastic images. I have become a fan of VR!
Plenty of adjustment options to fit your head and face as well as accessories. I would recommend at a minimum an Oculus case to protect and organize. Also I have ordered prescription lenses to fit my headset,

This is the coolest tech out right now. It’s super affordable and the possibilities are literally limitless. Pair with a powerful PC and the VR world is your oyster. I was so excited to buy this. The best $300 I’ve ever spent on anything. And the staff was super helpful and friendly at Salem, NH.

Love it!! I would hope the gaming selection will expand and have a bigger selection like the other regular gaming consoles. And the thing I would recommend is getting the cushion or a different head strap because after a while of using starting experience pressure headache on the back of my head.

My almost 16-year old loves their Oculus VR.  They use it virtually (no pun intended) non-stop.  The quality is great and provides a great deal of laughter for both of my children (my eldest shares the VR with their sister when  they are both getting along).  It is very "real" and great quality.

This is actually a gift for my parents. I got mine earlier this year and love it. So I decided that they needed to have something to help them keep active and have fun. My dad can fly planes while my mom can have fun with angry birds. Also they can tour and see exhibits without leaving the house

This headset has a lot going for it; it’s light-weight  & portable, has a crisp bright screen, and an affordable price for anyone curious about VR.

The only trade-off is that the graphics are not as impressive as a tethered VR headset, but there are plenty games that still manage to look good!

It has a very small sweet spot. When playing a game with movement it would get out of focus. Also, it is heavy on the front of your face. Does seem like a very ergonomic setup. The elite strap helped. But this just resulted on added pressure on your face. I had purchased two and took them back.

Super cool experience and gift that was loved by our son at Christmas. The software can be finicky as heck. Hard to set up the guardian and screen pops off at times but the overall experience is awesome. Would be great if they could figure out the hiccups of the guardian. Ot
Would be a 5 then.

Very nice product. Works great for me and my kids (very easy to install and to adjust). This makes a real difference. I would recommended it for my friends. Have seen some complains about quality. Therefore I bought the extra 2 year warranty for $10. Bought the product 3 weeks ago - no issues!

Wonderful! Kinda hard to first setup, battery doesn't last long and it sucks having to constantly keep it plugged in with such a short cord, if you want the 18 ft cord you can't use an aftermarket one from Amazon I tried it and it would barely charge it if you get the actual one it's like $80

Let me start by saying this is the first VR we have had. I have no way to compare the Oculus to any other VR. I really like the unit.  It has amazing quality and is easy to use. You should be aware that it takes a while to get used to having them on your head and you can easily get motion sick. I suggest playing only games that don't have you flying around and only playing for about 15 minutes at a time for the first few weeks.  Most of the games will cost you extra money but aren't that expensive.  The reason I gave it a 4 star are twofold.  First,  the strap is junk. Just prepare to watch YouTube videos on after market straps and get one.  Most on the market are way more comfortable than what comes with the unit. Second,  you must have a Facebook account.  That is extremely annoying to me.  I know Facebook owns Oculus but what does one have to do with the other? As far as I'm concerned. Facebook is useless.  Despite those two issues we as a family are loving the unit and enjoying the games.

Wow just Wow, I never though the virtual reallity will be this good. I enjoy watching Youtube VR and netflix. Totally worth the price. Got the 128gb and its plenty of space for not a every day play. If you hardcore player must get the 256gb. Amazing device but can improve a bit on the weight.

For the money it’s pretty good. Not sure why it’s so nerfed from the factory. You have to dl a program on your Pc to up the resoltion and textures. It’s pretty blurry if you don’t. Haven’t tried it for pc yet but the native library has been fun. Not sure how I feel about the Facebook log in.

Pros: Immersive VR, Quality Build, Comfortable controllers

Cons: There are barely any QUALITY games!!! A lot of shovel ware on this thing. Un-syncs boundaries at odd times

Bottom Line: Save your money until they have a well known library of quality games, otherwise you are not missing out.

Recently bought this device to venture off into the virtual reality world. It’s an okay device, I just have to get use to the graphics and motion of the game. I’ve had it for a while and only played it twice. I would suggest this device in case children or other adults come over and hangout.

I realized over the past two years that it was unlikely I'd be traveling outside the US in the future. I've lived in many countries and have many more on my to do list. Oculus Quest 2 is a way for me to revisit places I've been to before as well as to check out places I haven't seen before.

I'm really impressed with the overall solidness and polishness. The tracking is incredible! There're all sorts of great games and experiences to play with! Evenmore they're updating the core software all the time adding really significant new capabilities! Worth your money, it's the future!

The oculus is amazing, works just as described and has tons and tons of games available. There’s something for everyone and it’s super fun to bring out when you have some friends over for some good laughs. If you purchase an oculus id recommend the super shot game and the walking dead game.

This vr headset is amazing for the price.  I have a powerful pc and can wirelessly stream Steam vr games to the Quest 2 with basically zero lag and at 120 hz.  Controllers are comfortable in the hand and track great.  Some games, you don't even need the controllers, you just use your hands.

i was optimistic when i bought this for my wife picturing all kinds of trouble like her falling over furniture but the software is smart and sets up a "play area" before you start so you make sure you don't lose track of physical items around you.  so far a lot of fun for the whole family.

We opened the Oculus 2, fully charged it, and went to go set it up. Headset onto turn on for longer than a few seconds. Tries everything recommend including several factory resets. Nothing worked. Have been waiting for a long time to hear back from Oculus support. My son is totally bummed.

My first VR set. While there is a tiny bit of blur, its still amazing none the less. I reccomend Walkaround Golf. Be aware that if your eyes are very far apart, you may have an issue like I do. You can adust the distance, but only so far. There is also a glasses holder if you wear glasses.

Very realistic and immersive. I would recommend buying a new strap or face padding. Can be a little uncomfortable but once you get it adjusted right it’s not too bad. A case wouldn’t be a bad additional purchase as well although the box it comes in does provide some pretty decent storage.

The joystick started malfunctioning on the second day. It got a bad drift which made any game unplayable. It was fun for the 4 total gameplay hours I got out of it? And no, I didn’t smack it against the wall or anything and I tried all the recommended calibration tips I could find online.

Quick and easy set up. Yes, a FB Account is needed but you can set up privacy from messages in case someone else besides you is using the headset. I purchased another headstrap for extra comfort. Overall, it's definitely worth the money and the 128gb is more than enough storage. Have fun!

Amazing product! I was never a techie or even a player but this got me hooked! Lots of nice games that takes you out of this world! Battery does not last long but extended batteries are available! Honestly, 2 hours is good enough playing time for me, or else my eyes would be so strained!

I was skeptical of purchasing this product from the amount of off brand VR sets I've tried in the past, I was way off this experience is something you can only really experience a review doesn't give this product enough credit, if you like gaming you may never go back to 2d gaming again.

1st one we received had a tool mark on the right lens.
Best buy replaced it very smoothly, kudos to them.
The replacement unit has a dead pixel in the right lens, which we are choosing to live with.
Great fun when playing but check the condition carefully when you first receive the unit.

I owned a VR set when they first started coming on the market, I was skeptical the Ocolus Quest 2 would be any different but boy was I wrong. This VR headset is unbelievable. The price point in my opinion is low for the tech you’re receiving but I’m not going to complain about the price!

At this price point, it has no rivals.

The stock headband was extremely uncomfortable and had to purchase additional third party headbands. There is no adaptation for myopia. The clarity is still not high enough and the contrast is not enough. The device is also still relatively heavy.

This much tech working this well at an entry point this low is a rare thing. It’s nice that you can connect it to your pc and use your pc graphics card power to spit out better visuals too. I don’t like the facebook requirement, and the store needs quick demos. Other than that, fun toy!

Fun and great for playing Alynx -Half-Life. The evolution of OQ is amazing. Like to see what's next. The resolution in watching movies and PC games is really good. This has better value over the 256 GB version if you own a Gaming PC this is all you need. Most games are stored on the PC.

Love this system!! you actually become part of the game. visiting the world trade center towers felt like we was actually they’re actually floating above the city. Getting the Oculus quest2 advanced all-in-one virtual reality headset on sale at Best Buy made the experience even sweeter.

This was actually the second quest we bought as a gift for my fiances son in FL. We have been completely happy with both although I would advise getting the extra battery strap, its placing on the back of your head helps balance out the Oculus as it can feel a bit too heavy on your face

Fully wireless 360 degree VR, enough said?! I mean Resident Evil 4 was just a blast on this thing. Also has the best Star Wars games on it. I recommend it, but also recommend buying the Oculus Quest 2 Elite Strap With Battery, if you can. Stock Battery lasts roughly 1.5-2 hours in play.

Incredibly fun and immersive! Waiting for more games to come out. Would love to see more games geared towards women! My only complaint would be that the headset is heavy and hurts your head after extended periods of time. The elite strap does help with that though. Overall lots of fun!

I think this device is fantastic. I haven't found anything to complain about on the hardware side. My main issue is the lack of parental controls. My 9 year old is obsessed with the device, but I have to monitor closely when he's using it to prevent him from interacting with strangers.

128 Gb is best for me because I mainly use oculus link and the few I do have on the headset are ones that I like a lot or I need more movement on 

And the product is good but you might want to buy a head strap for it you don’t have to buy a oculus one just buy a 3rd party if you want.

Its great if u have a ton of money to spend on the expensive games . Eventually ull want new games cuz u get bored after a while Nd u def need the rubber cases to protect it cuz u will tend to hit the controllers on the head sometimes.but either than that its fun while it lasts.

Been wanting one of these for awhile and wife picked me up one for Christmas. This thing is amazing from going on 3D trips to different parts of the world to having fun in games like beat saber. The amount of things you can do with this is amazing and will entertain the entire family!

Works great.   Amazing graphics.  However, very, very difficult for an older guy to learn how to use.  Of course there are no instructions.  Bought it mainly for the exercise activities but now I have to pay an additional fee[monthly/yearly] for this.  Not sure it was a wise purchase.

Great images and excellent value for money. Took a little bit time to set it up properly. The headset is a bit heavy and difficult to stabilize when moving. Need to improve the fasteners.  Otherwise it is a lot of fun to play with. It has the potential to grow the sales exponentially.

The oculus quest 2 is a masterpiece the sensors are fantastic the box and how I come is great you don’t even need instructions it comes with a charger just saying cuz It doesn’t clarify that It has so many great free games every thing about it I love great choice to buy all out great

I bought this game system for my nephew after I played with his friend's set.  My nephew and I both love it!    The pictures are so clear, loved the mountain climbing game, just watching the scenery over the cliff, the river and sounds so real.  I will be buying another for my niece.

I thought this hoping everyone in the family could use it. I've not been disappointed. There is so much VR content out there that are not games, I couldn't be happier. Guided meditation and productivity apps are a plus. I even started playing games for the first time in thirty years!

Quality is great, visual is awesome, effects and sounds are amazing. Kid friendly, got it for our 9 year old and he loves it and found that it was very easy to navigate. Our 6 year old also uses it and its very easy for her to use.

The head adjustments can ne a pain but not horrible

I bought one for my son as a Christmas present and he wanted me to try it. I did so reluctantly, but after playing for about 10 minutes, I left to buy one for myself. Now we play together and have a blast doing so! It’s a little dizzying at times but worth the time spent with my kid.

It is amazing! First VR Headset & I have to say it is pretty cool! The quality of the gameplay is great. The feeling of the headset and the controls themselves feel great too! Have not had a single issue using it. If you want to get into VR Gaming I highly recommend purchasing this!

Very cool gaming device. Must have facebook account and my 12 year old doesn’t have one so I had to use mine to get the device up and running. Similar to the Wii, it definitely is a new concept in playing video games. Would recommend as more games (and better ones) become available.

Great product and My son is huge gamer; usually not moving 
from his home for long periods of time. Now he's upstairs, downstairs using different rooms on the house and constantly moving.  For those worried about lack of exercise for their kids I Highly recommend the Oculus Quest 2.

It’s a neat piece of technology but it’s just not perfected yet.  It’s often blurry (unless the headset is positioned just right) and the resolution while impressive still has room to improve.  Unless you’re a gamer and have a lot of time on your hands this is probably not for you.

Wow…it’s a really immersive product that allows u to dove into any activity in any way you want. Streaming apps like YouTube and Netflix look amazing whilst the games u play can even be played in the comfort of your bed. Great product can’t wait for whatever else is to come with it

Love every bit of this head set. Its comfortable, it has better picture quaity then ps4 and doesnt have the screen door effect plus has extra features like drawing your playing area and a camera so you dont have to take off the headset to see. Love everything about it! No cords!!!!

My grandson wanted this for his 9th Birthday.  When I got to the store and started chatting with the BB Rep, he explained some of the features and games, which made me decided to grab one for myself as well.  I am 59 and not a techy type person so I was a little hesitant about setting this up, but it was very easy.  And later I found out my 9 year grandson set his up too.  He also taught me that can view the players on your TV and watch them play as well.  

So far the only thing I would recommend is following the instructions on how long to wear the Oculus when first starting out.  I wore it for over 1.5 hours and I did get a slight headache, the recommended time is only 15 minutes (oops, I was really caught up...lol).

Now my granddaughter wants one.  Great family time fun and more free game then I expected, although you have to make sure they are not just the demos...

I gave it a 5 star on the value, only because of the 12 month interest free financing, otherwise it is a little pricey, but worth it.

This is going to be the perfect gift for my 12 year old son for Christmas. He has a STEAM account which he can download games from and I can also use it for fitness, which I can excited about. I am also intrigued with the horror games personally so I can't wait for him to share. :)

Depending on the games you download and play, you'll be sweating for sure. Of course there are non-physically active games on there too, but it's a lot more fun to play games where you're sword fighting and actually swinging your arms to do so. For $300 it's a well worthy purchase.

My son got this for Christmas and hasn’t put it down since. He enjoys the game a lot. He’s 13, but I played it as an adult and it gives me a headache and get dizzy after just after a few minutes attempting to play it. The handles are comfortable to hold and the headset isn’t heavy.

I am brand new to the VR world and I love this thing. Best $300 I’ve spent for entertainment in years. I bought the 128GB but if I had a do over I would definitely get the 256GB. I can see downloading lots of games and apps in the future. It really deserves 5+stars but I am having a couple of small issues with this headset. Every now and then it goes to black screen in the middle of playing a game, sometimes I have to adjust the headset a tiny bit and it goes blank. May be my fault, might not be? Also, the battery doesn’t last very long but I did fix that issue with a backup battery pack which adds at least 2-3 hrs. more to playing time, totally worth it. I ordered mine from bestbuy.com and it was delivered in 2 days with free shipping, you can’t beat that unless you go pick it up yourself. Thank you Best Buy! All in all it’s the best toy I’ve ever had and I’m in my 50’s. I use it every night and I have a few relatives and friends who also have an oculus quest 2 so game on! Get one, you won’t regret it.

Love it!! The graphics are great! I do not play video games, but really wanted this. I do enjoy the games I play on the oculus. The only complaint I had was how uncomfortable the headpiece is that is included with the unit. We replaced it with an upgraded one and it is much better.

A lot of my buddies had picked one of these up and I was skeptical at first because it’s a stand alone console instead of the PC hookup version. This was honestly a great purchase and I know it’s a hot item these holidays so I snagged one up before they went missing on the shelves.

This is the perfect introduction to VR. ESPECIALLY since the introduction of Oculus AirLink. No more wires to play PCVR games. Just connect your PC and Quest to the same internet and play as if you were hard-wired in. There is absolutely no latency. I couldn't recommend it enough.

I love this...easy to use and there is even a demo on how to use the headset and demos to get you comfortable with the hand controls and navigating within the gaming system.  There are some free games out there that are worth it...just have to look.  The love watching others play.

Well I’m pretty sure I won Christmas. I gave this to my husband because his quest 1 was going the way of old yeller. Anyway, I haven’t had to hear from him at night since Christmas. Which is both great and not lol silence is golden after all! 

 I can’t wait to try it out. Thanks.

It's an excellent VR product for the price. I play a lot of video games, and I love it, but my wife and other family have had tons of fun, too! There are plenty of VR experiences that don't induce motion sickness, and with a little practice I was able to get over the ones that do.

The Oculus is a very high quality VR Headset,  However it is rather clunky to set up.  There were no instructions in the package,  They expect you to use the tutorial program to learn how to use it.  However, just finding the program is a little difficult without ay VR experience.

I love it! Easy to assemble and the software is easy to configure. I would advise any future buyer to purchase the extended strap which provides a more stern ability for the headset and also the charging dock station to prevent excessive purchase of batteries. Overall, I love it!

Got the quest 2 for VR gaming on PC.  Overall experience is good.  Played halflife Alyx using an oculus link cable that was purchased separately.  Has the ability to connect wireless through airlink using a high speed router. Great features for the price compared to other models.

My 13yr old son loves it. I got this for him after a hockey tournament where I was able to get in to play it. It is a solid unit and good entry level if you have a budget like I do. It is NOT as expensive as some of the high end units, but still expensive enough. My son loves it.

This was a wonderful piece of electronic to have. It was fun while I had it, but I did end up returning it. After much thought on this item, buying this for $300 and then having to purchase each individual VR game for a hefty price was no different than any other gaming console.

WOW! The Oculus is amazing! The graphics are surreal! My child loved it so much that I had to get one for myself as well!  One caution to those that may unknowingly suffer from motion sickness - be aware! Otherwise, it’s a great buy with hours and hours of fun and entertainment.

I am not much of a gamer, but I love my new Oculus VR headset. I am having a great time with Beat Saber and Supernatural workouts. I can work up a sweat and have fun while I'm at it. Also, Tripp is a great relaxation app. It's like a legal acid trip without all the side effects.

I bought this as a gift but was able to play a few games.  This VR is a lot of fun. So many funny videos of people taking VR too literal. Good graphics, fluid gameplay, and a nice feature that turns OFF the VR if you physically go outside the boundaries. I highly recommend this.

Incredible technology...both my kids (12 & 16) got these and use them together to play in VR world. I tried them in some "Walking Dead" type game...incredible. i could get addicted to this device. My son plays a great golf game on it too (he's an actual golfer too) and loves it!

I purchased this mostly for Supernatural.  I love it for that.  I will not being taking part in Zuckerberg’s meta verse data farming.  I love working out in VR, but hate that I had to create a FB account to use it.  I opted to create an account with zero personal data or photos.

Pros - great with family and friends and by yourself and the metaverse. It has plenty of games for you to try out for what your into. Also has airlink which I was surprised by on how good it is for beta I’m able to do everything I can on my desktop in my vr headset. The controllers are great for my big hands fits very well.

Cons- the head strap doesn’t fit me very well but overtime it seemed to loosen up a bit to fit me just well I do have a decent sized head. The battery life is definitely a con it doesn’t last long but I think that’s a good thing you don’t want to be inside this vr headset for long but if you do there is the elite strap or other straps that are cheaper with batteries that can give you a better battery life. And for the charging cable I thought it would be longer but it is pretty short, it just reaches the top of my desk to charge which is good wouldn’t want to put this expensive item on the ground to charge. 

Overall I’m happy it will be used for my personal time and family and friends.

Amazing VR experience for around $299. Only real complaint about this device is the battery life. The battery life is only around 2 Hours and then have to charge it again. Other than that amazing VR and plenty of games for all of genres (ie FPS, adventure, puzzle, sports, etc)

Only thing thats a little skeptical is that your need a facebook account to use this but over all it got here in perfect condition definitely was hesitant about buying it at first because i didn't know if it was going to be worth the $300 but it definitely is worth every cent

I was hesitant to buy it but it’s been the best purchase. So much fun. You can do so much with it not just games. I’ve learned and I’ve watched movies. I’ve interacted with friends. I do have bad motion sickness and I got super sick last night. But they do things to help you.

I absolutely love this system and the fact that when you buy a game if you try it out (of course there are guidelines)  and you don't like it, you csn request a refund. There are a wide variety of games that are free or you can purchase. My son says it's the best thing ever.

Product is good as a whole, everything is as advertised with the main unit my only complaint is that It is pretty much universally recommended that if you intend to use it more than 10 min a week you immediately have to purchase the upgraded head strap for 50$ dollars more….

Wow,it was a birthday gift for my sister. And she blown away with this gift. She loves it,and highly recommend that I should get one for myself. This is the second one that I bought as a gift,I purchase one earlier in the year,and I'm truly thinking gifting myself with one.
