My family really enjoys playing on this Oculus. Just wished they had more free games available. Some of the games are for a fair price though. I also like that if you do not end up liking a game you paid for, then you can ask to get a refund within a certain amount of days.

The system Ok but know that this is an online dependent system if their system crashes as it did the day after I bought my unit andit took 2 weeks for them to recover the system.but since has been ok and the pc connectivity even with aftermarket cables is an amazing feature

Having a blast. The VR is so dynamic and it doesn't take long to get the hang of working w the controls. Mostly using Supernatural app. Never thought I'd say that I had fun exercising but I did. I worked up a sweat and I never work up a sweat, amazingly, I had fun doing it!

They work great but they forget to tell you that your are going to have to buy the games in order to play on there    I thought it came sith several games that were shown on the ad for them but I was wrong  So you need to pay like another $20-$30 PER GAME to really use them

I love the occulus. You can watch movies. Feel like you really in there n the games are so cool on how far VR has come and it's only going to get better. Don't believe me. Try it. Here's my code so Yal can get $30 for a game https://www.oculus.com/referrals/link/nicajoker/

It works fully as described. I havent played VR in years so I bought it for the family to try and the VR technology amazed me! It has so many apps and functions to try and I have been enjoying it. It has been working fine and hopefully will continue to work for a long time

Easy to setup and use and it is a lot of fun to play. The sweat guard can be a little challenging to get on because the directions weren’t real clear. Just pop the plastic piece off around the part where your face goes, then put the sweat guard on then pop back into place.

I was hesitant to try out VR gaming. I assumed that it was just a gimmicky, clunky experience. I was wrong. The Quest 2 is a great entry to what VR has evolved into. Then I used the air link feature to try out some PCVR titles (Half Life: Alyx) and was even more impressed.

We bought this for our son’s birthday.  We tried to get it last year for Christmas but they were all sold out!  He seems to like it.  There was a little assembly required before he could use it.  It seemed strange why oculus wouldn’t have just put the piece on beforehand.

My kids had been bugging me and my wife for this for quite some time.  We finally caved for Xmas.  It's been a great purchase.  The kids really love playing, as do I.  From the games to the experiences there are a number of things to keep you occupied for hours at a time.

I purchased this after owning the first Oculus headset and I haven’t been disappointed.  The additional gameplay elements you get access to with this newer headset make this s must have for people who love vr gaming. And the updated strap is much more comfortable to wear.

The answer to the question you all want to know that nobody wants to answer.

VR adult videos look amazing. (big grin)  In 10 years time, might not even need a spouse lol.


Setup is easy, lots of games, ease of use.  I bought prescription lens so I can remove my glasses.

The fact that my children have gotten dozens of hours of entertainment out of this device is enough for me to review it positively. The battery life is better than expected and its stand alone capabilities are welcome. I don't like that it has to be connected to Facebook.

My brother had one that we tried and fell in love with it. Not only did we get one but so did several others in my family.  Great game that can be easily transported so it can travel with you to friends and family. And for a much cheaper price than many other video games.

I bought this for my grandson for Christmas.  He tried to use it and it indicated that it was overheating.  My daughter and grandson took it back to Best Buy with the receipt.  They had no problem returning the oculus and they had 1 more in stock. The new one works great.

the games are way too expensive according to my son and I’m in total agreement. The VR games he was interested in was upwards of $50.00 and out of control. This is obviously not a dig on BB, but do your research before purchasing. We returned it and chose something else.

Pretty incredible pieces of technology!  Bought them for my kids thinking that they might not be crazy about them.  Was i wrong!  They love them, maybe a little bit too much!  The ges are very cool and very next level.  They might be on the expensive side, but worth it.

This is a great entry into VR. I was skeptical at first but this this is fun and performs well. If you want to dip your toes into VR, this is a good unit. Do caution that you need a Facebook account to use this and if you close your account, you will lose all purchases.

Kids love it. But only complain is that dont buy it early before Xmas. I bought it before thanksgiving  and paid full price and went back after black friday and Best Buy had a special if u buy one they give u a $50 gift card with the purchase. Nowadays 50 bucks is bucks

This system is way more realistic than I thought it would be and is super fun. There is mostly paid content but there are some good free games as well. I got a credit due to black Friday but was not able to use it in the oculus store which would be my only issue so far!

This is such a fun thing to do by yourself or with family.  We purchased this to enjoy at our NYE party.  It the made the even so much better.  We had so much fun.  It has quite a bit of games to choose from that anyone from children to adults can enjoy.  I'm SO glad to

I love this thing! Better than the PSVR I bought. Higher refresh rate, and the new update gave this thing up to 120hz refresh rate (beta). It's a stand-alone, so no cables will be in the way. I can also link it to your PC and play your PC VR games. Hightly recommended!

Great VR game system.  I recommend getting third party headset for more comfort.  Oculus requires Facebook logon… I created one just for the game system.  Limited number of games, but the good ones are addictive.  Five star if more games with no subscription required…

My son love it. He said mommy this best Christmas ever. I tried to find him one when they first came out but they was sold out everywhere. I went early this time and best buy had tons of them. I even got a gift card for $50 which i used to purchase him a case for it.

Love my VR, I use mine so far for exercising and shooting things. I have just scratched the surface and I have no complaints other than the weight of this stuff on my head. Definitely need some silicon hand additions as I almost threw the hand controls several times.

Honestly this is one of the most budget friendly ways to get into vr it has its flaws sometimes but makes up for it for its price and in general is well worth it if you want to get into vr and if you have a really good pc its well worth it for the may steam vr games

best thing I've ever bought and it got here early was supposed to come in 3 days but cane in 2 days very happy with this purchase would recommend and new strap and an extra battery for it and it would be perfect. overall i love this and would definitely recommend it

The oculus is incredibly fun. My family uses it to play Supernatural, a fitness game with great music and incredible views from around the world. The oculus almost has me believing I'm there. I'm already planning on buying a couple more as Christmas gifts this year.

The first unit I purchased was faulty, I did return it and they replaced it with a new unit which was quick and easy. Very happy with the Oculus. Not crazy about the head strap. I already purchased a new head strap which is much easier to adjust and more comfortable

One fatal flaw: no parental controls!

The experience is amazing.  We got this for Christmas and spent the day playing Beat Saber.  It takes some getting used to if you've never done VR before, but it's just incredible.

A few nitpicks - I had read online that it came with demos of popular games.  There were none installed and it was hard to even find demos in the store.  So we ended up purchasing Beat Saber because it had a refund policy.  Then I found out, after we decided to return the device and had done a factory reset, that you could only get an automatic refund using the original device.  So I am waiting on Oculus support to refund the purchase of Beat Saber.  Hopefully that works out.

The reason we are returning it, however, is that there are no parental controls whatsoever.  There is a built-in web browser that cannot be disabled.  So if you let kids play with this device, you are giving them unrestricted access to whatever they find on the web.  For our family, that's a non-starter.  Back to Best Buy it goes.

I purchased this gift for my husband in 2020, and the grandkids loved this item. So, when this Christmas came, I decided to purchase this for them. They are enjoying the virtual fun at their home as well. I even enjoy this myself. We are all loving the virtual fun.

My boys love playing on the oculus. I like it because it keeps them moving instead of on their butts playing Xbox. My wife loves it for the safety features. It lets you map out a “boundary” area so you don’t accidentally bump into and break things or hurt yourself.

I returned this but its not anyones fault, just my own personal capabilities dont allow me to use. If you suffer from viritgo and the room is not very cold, you will get sick. 

The experience was fun but not lasting. If you are healthy enough, you will enjoy this.

Purchased for my son for Christmas.  The overall experience was difficult setup and logging into rooms is also difficult.  Once set up it does glitch and doesn’t always reboot.  Had to restart to factory settings at one point as it wouldn’t connect to the internet.

Given the rough time we have had with Covid, the Oculus has helped me stay mentally sane during this uncertain time. Ive used it for Meditations, playing BlackJack, taken trips across the world. It really does take you away from reality and helps you stay positive.

Having s VR headset is a very amazing and life changing experience. I recommend you get this if you have lots of free time for thrills but fo be careful with it because you’ll get a little dizzy and nauseous if using it for the first time but you’ll get used to it.

We love the Oculus Quest 2.  It really opens up a whole new avenue for gaming that we didn't know that we were missing.  We were looking for one last year for my son and couldn't find one.  Once you leave the virtual world, the real world seems a little more plain.

Can be finicky when connecting to pc. Battery dies extremely quick. Insufficient voltage with most motherboards to properly charge via pc while using link cable but allows for a slow drain of battery. Great resolution. Extremely light and easy on the head and eyes.

This thing is amazing I like it, you’ll need a good size room to play in. Make sure to get device protection in case you throw a controller at a wall or window or if sunlight shines into the lens that will damage the screen inside. Making it hard to see with spots.

We love this device, just hate that there aren't enough children's games available for free like there are social meet and greet games at no cost.  It does take some getting used to and you may have to sit down with it for certain games to get used to the graphics.

Not for me honestly my computer is plenty fast and paired with a better vr set I've had.more fun being able to access and play a wide variety of games new and old in VR versus being forced and tied to only games approved and available through the oculus market

This is my first dive into VR and I must say it's been quite the experience.  I've really enjoyed this system and will continue to use it.  I will warn anyone who hasn't used VR (like myself), if you get motion sick, you will definitely need to ease into using it.

The Oculus is so fun. So many different types of experiences from visiting another country to riding a roller coaster. My daughters love Beat Saber. We have also tried the Paranormal game. Being that it is 3d it offers an amazing experience. Glad we purchased it!

This is my 2nd VR device and I love it. Works great with Steam games as well as being able to play independently without a PC. Simple and easy to setup.

Definitely need a replacement head strap as the one that comes with it becomes uncomfortable and slips often.

VR is still in it's infancy stage. Long ways to go, lots of bugs still. When you put the headset you just want it to work. Sometimes just to connect to a laptop is lots of work. One good game though, Alyx! Try it but don't but it. Wait for like 2 more generations

This product saved my marriage.   I bought this for my wife after I broke a video game she loved.  I prayed that she would enjoy it and forgive me.  The family tried it and on Christmas day it was entertaining for all. I now look forward to 33 years together!! :)

it's a really good standalone vr if you don't have a pc. if you do have a pc that can handle vr you can connect this headset to it through a link cable or your wifi. runs games really well and virtually no lag when connected to your pc over a wireless connection.

I brought this as a Christmas gift to my teenage son.  I decided to give it a try for myself and i was pretty amazed at the graphics that it displays. The games are really fun. This is a great way to pass the time when you are bored. Or just need something to do.

Overall a great product fairly easy to set up and use. It's nice that it can be used with or without a computer. This isn't the highest resolution VR but it's a great starter. Only complaint is edges are a bit fuzzy in my vision and the adjustment doesn't fix it.

For my son and he loves it
Games, connectivity, all of what he's always wanted (he's been asking for a VR set for a long time)

Could not get it to work with the PC after purchasing the extra cord - I think that's more on my computer's end than the Oculus' fault.

Awesome, tons of fun playing the boxing game and beat saber. It's not life changing technology but it's very easy to use and fun (kinda like the nintendo wii on steroids). my only real gripe is that you have to use your facebook account (or create one) to use it

Can’t actually review product. It was a gift to a family member. However, from what i’ve heard so far it was a great electronic amusement addition.

While acquisition was a little bumpy, everything was received in the promised delivery times. Thanks to Best Buy.

The first VR headset I have owned was PlaystationVR. The Oculus Quest blows the PlayStationVR away! Amazing quality, ease of use and love the growing selection of games and apps. The only thing I would highly suggest is the extra battery and head-strap upgrade.

Its a fun little unit, and the whole family enjoys it. The setup is fairly easy and the VR experience has really improved since the Rift V1.  The audio isnt great but does the job. Tracking is reasonable considering its all built-in versus having base stations.

Lens have smudge spots that cannot be remove. Only noticeable with dark backgrounds but overall the picture looks fine. I would recommend getting this one, no need for the extra memory as each game is 3-5gbs. I have about 15 games and still have a ton of space.

Great upgrade from the older model Rift headset. I use it mostly for seated VR games such as racing and flying games. The upgraded resolution, the addition of the passthrough camera, and wireless link to a PC have allowed extended play sessions to be a breeze.

Doesn't function. Can't log in with Facebook, and without logging in with Facebook i can't even connect the headset to my phone to start using it. 

Oculus used to be such a great company, but when they were bought by Facebook they lost their customer support.

Fun device for the whole family. If you're bored with your console, grab one of these. From Beat Saber, Resident Evil 4, Star Wars etc. there's something for everyone. I'd recommend to anyone that likes to experience new things and this is a whole other world.

My daughter is in love with this VR set and if I’m being honest so am I. I do not recommend you to play it for hours being that once you take it off it’s hard for your eyes to adjust back to normal lighting.. you will need a Facebook account to set the vr up !

I'm a first time VR user and it's a lot of fun for ages 12 and up, from my 12 year old nephew to my 76 year old mother, it's a blast, very happy with purchase, if you are an eyeglass wearer then def. Get the prescription lenses to snap on, it's a game changer.

I bought this for my boyfriend and our boys for Christmas so we have not gotten to play with it yet. But, reading about it i cant wait to play with it but i dont like that we have to have a facebook account for it to work. I will update review after Christmas.

The game changer was the 120hz capabilities with no wires. Not yet widely available but as long as you get 90+ it feels very smooth. First VR set I wont be returning. So cool to take this in my garage with no PC and not feel like im sacrificing much graphics.

I love my Oculus, I have thought about a VR headset a long time and checked out the different VR systems available (PS, Steam, etc) this is definitely the best for the price and quality. I recommend to anyone who wants to get into VR gaming or even exercising

This is an amazing device. So much fun to put yourself in a virtual situation. The graphics are awesome. It’s just as fun to play the game as it is to watch someone else play as they make some pretty funny moves.  Highly suggest for a great gaming experience.

This thing is really fun and some of the games are so real looking. I just hope I get used to them cause after about an hour I start getting motion sickness. That's ok though I'll just make sure I got a trashcan nearby cause I'm definitely not giving them up.

I love the oculus 2 it has great memory and alot of apps and games to choose from. The display is amazing it really makes you feel like you are in the game. The sound and motion follows along with what is on the screen gelping to transport you into that world

Got the oculus as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend and he absolutely loves it. He’s constantly playing on this, it’s a great investment. It made him really happy. In case you’re thinking about buying a gift for anyone, this should be at the top of your list.

Bought the Oculus for Xmas and my kids have been playing with it every chance they have. It's better then other systems due to the physical aspects, they've been getting as much exercise playing this then outside in the summer time. So we don't mind as much.

This is my first VR headset.  It is easy to use and has been alot of fun.  There is alot of content available so you won't get bored.  Gave ot 4 stars only because you have to connect it to your facebook account.  Overall great headset and I would recommend.

I love my Oculus Quest 2, I have one bought several as gifts to my friends and family and also the warranty is a great and thoughtful incentive from BestBuy for all Totaltech support members giving a whole 2 years of support and warranty. Thank you, Bestbuy.

Well, I notice one thing, they gave me a smaller charger this time. or my 64G model was much bigger and I think a stronger charger.
Bestbuy has done it all right but Facebook is making this device hard to wallow, they track everything with no privacy at all.

Great product. Nicely done for not having to use spacial recognition devices with it. The whole ‘meta verse’ thing still needs a some years of development but a great start. As for the games, love the fps games but would love to more improvement in graphics.

Oculus Quest 2 is my very first VR headset, and I can finally see what the hype is all about! It's very easy to use and I am impressed on how great the tracking with the two controllers. I really does feel that you are in virtual reality space. I love it!!!

My son revived this for Christmas/His birthday & it gave bad headaches, nausea, dizziness, excessive sweating, and he didn’t play it long. I definitely do not recommend! I wish I would’ve did my homework on this product please parents plz do your homework..

Super easy to set up and use. When you first start take it slow so you do not get VR motion sickness (it is a thing.) When your are done using your Quest do not forget to charge it as the unit will die in roughly 2ish hours. Overall I highly recommend this!

I not really interested in these but don't get me wrong this vr is fun to play video games on but I  am use to having video game  controllers in my hands and nothing on my face  except a mic to talk to people  on guess u can say I am a little old school lol

Getting together to play with friends is great. I wish there were ways to demo games prior to paying to play.  Needs to charge often so buy a portable backup charger in case you get a warning while playing. Had to buy new head and face part for better fits.

I bought this to play games on. The battery lasts less than 90 minutes, and it keeps dropping internet connection. I do like how you're not tethered to a system like a PC or PS. Also takes a LONG time to charge, and battery drains when you're not using it.

VR is awesome. I need had it until now. I have a ps4 VR but this one is better. no wires hanging.totaly on its own. clear and easy to set up and easy to play. plenty of free games and plenty of good pay games. the fit is ok, but I bought the back head band

I really love the new oculus. Totally fun and immersive. For 299.99, best gaming deal of 2021 in my opinion. You can easily buy this product,  no long lines and it has a decent amount of games. Just be prepared to buy some AA batteries for the controllers.

VR is very good if your brain can take it. I cant use it more than 15 minutes. I love the boxing game & going places. 
One issue i am observing is sensor not detected very often, although the lense & clean but it pops up very often,
Otherwise worth the $$

Coming from the Rift CV1 I can say that this is a good upgrade. Having the VR to be wireless is a huuuge improvement. Its only 4 stars because not all of my Rift games are cross platform (you might need to buy games again if you are coming from the Rift).

Very interesting device. Works well. I have a problem keeping it sharp and clear. Being nearsighted I thought I'd need no glasses since is right on my face. However. that is not the case and I have to keep adjusting as I use it to keep it sharp and clear.

I would not recommend buying anything from Oculus!
I had there last Gen VR headset and its a BRICK after just 2 years.
their customer service says they no longer support that device.
Their only advice was "factory reset" (which didn't work) and good luck.

This is a really fun system.  It's a great cheap and very high quality for the price.  The only downside is the requiring a facebook account, and those have little in child filters.  On a good note their is something to help with this in the works I hear.

This thing is awesome. The battery life is a little short, but nothing really to compare it to as it’s the only one of its kind. Buy an active USB-C cable to link to PC to use it as a VR kit for PC games; don’t waste money on the overpriced one from Meta.

Wasn't sure about getting system till a friend got one. Tried it and loved it. Not being tethered to a PC helped in immersion. For those games that require a PC you can get inexpensive cables to hook up. Played Elite:Dangerous on it and it was fantastic.

I have had it almost a month, and I am truly happy, So happy in fact, my partner legit RIGHT NOW is headed to Bestbuy to purchase her "early Xmas present" which is obviously, A Quest 2, After you learn sideloading and Other things. It is worth the money!

I had been tossing up the idea of getting a VR Headset for some time. I still plan on also picking up the next generation PS5 Headset. In the meantime, I picked up the new Oculus Quest 2. It is SO much fun. I get my workout with Beat Saber (came with the demo and I then purchased the full version), play Super Hot (came with the demo and I then purchased the full version). Super Hot reminds me of being in the Matrix and being able to dodge bullets. The Roller Coaster App makes me a little dizzy, and is better to have a fan going when you play. The eye pieces are adjustable depending on the distance between the eyes (3-positions). I also picked up spacers in case I wear glasses with them. The only downside is that it lasts for about 2 1/2 hours, and takes about as long to charge. You can of course plug it in and use it as well, but you would be limited to how far you can go. I am still tossing up the idea of getting a different head piece. Either way, it is a LOT of fun and would recommend it to anyone who likes to LIVE in the game.

The oculus is the best thing I’ve ever bought! My husband and I each bought one and we absolutely love it! You really feel like in your in a whole new world and we love that we can go into games together and play! It’s worth every penny so just buy it!!!

Bought OCULOUS for my husband for Christmas. The kids and I had a blast with it. Hubby - not so much. His eyeglasses weren’t comfortable under the headset and there aren’t many family games he could play.  I had to return it since it was a gift for him.

I love this item. Using it for workouts is awesome and I love "traveling" the world during this time that it is hard to do in real life. I feel like I have only scratched the surface on what all I can do with this headset. I am still learning everyday.

My daughters love this thing. I haven’t used it as much but I’ve been doing some research and think I may start watching games and fights on it. Not to mention the millions of things to do in the meta verse. Definitely great when you have company over!

Only drawback is you have to teach yourself and you cannot buy a 2nd pair, link together and play together thru being on same roller coaster, same street,etc...... at the same time.  Should be able to link together 2goggles to see the same experience.

Five stars for now. The system seems to work ok but the docs were a little difficult. The only volume control was a physical one on the device. I couldn’t find the in the vr screen. I do enjoy it and will update my review if I find out any real flaws.

The Oculus II is amazing and super fun. The setup was easy. It comes with a few free games, but be prepared to purchase additional content. The virtual world is so realistic and immersive. You can even use it to add to your fitness routine. Wonderful!

This is a great product now that recent updates have not only fixed things but brought a lot of new features and functionality. This is a great stand alone product and also now (after recent updates) it works very well as a wireless or wired PCVR too,

Words can’t describe how much fun the oculus is. This was my first time playing virtual reality games. It does take sometime to get use to wearing the headset. Also make sure you give yourself plenty of floor space to play. You won’t be disappointed.

The product arrived in a timely manner. Came out of the box ready to play, although I charged it to make sure it was fully charged before using it. Impressed so far and use it daily as a fitness coach. I travel for a living an use it in hotels daily.

Bought this for the Kiddos but wondering if I might steal it from them! We’ve had a PlayStation VR but now having an oculus we may never go back. The ease of setting it up combined with the safety features and no wires makes it the best VR right now.

Great Headset for the price, I have an Oculus Rift S and it is amazing, but this is incredible for being on the go, or for doing VR in the living room without any cables. It is compatible with PC VR using the AirLink option or you can use Link Cable.

This is amazing. Got one for my 8 year old daughter for Christmas. My ex husband and I played for 10 minutes and decided we have to get one for ourselves as well. (I also suggest buying and downloading zombieland if youre into that sort of thing :D )

Bought this along with the Top Golf game. Very realistic on both driving and putting. Lots of free games and VR destinations from around the world. Feel like you actually there. Next step is to get together with my son and compete against each other.

I had the original v1 quest and it was great. The redesigned handles on this are better, but I preferred the fit of the v1 on the headset. Other than that it works, and with the free storage and on the refresh why wouldn’t you jump in! the VR works!

Amazing product, already purchased one the year before for my Daughter. You get sucked into a virtual world with unlimited capabilities!! So this year we got another one for my Son. I plan to get 2 more in the future for myself and my wife as well!!

If you're planing on buying a vr this is a good deal. Not only its a reasonable price it comes with very good specs. I went from psvr to oculus and there is a difference which alot of people would agree with me on the difference it has is better tracking, better quality, better hz, better fps, more fun games, easy to calibrate. But to all good stuff they do have a con but there arent many cons. Going from psvr to oculus on pavr the motion controllers would talk about 12 or 13 hours to dechagre and the headset never decharges because of the wire(which i find the wire annoying if you move alot on vr) but depending on the oculus controller it mostly dependent on the battery but the con that sucks the most is battery life 3 hours of fun which 3 hours is a while but when you play and have fun that like 30 minutes an hour. But something that happends to me not sure about you guys js the dark gray soft thing on connected to the vr forbme when its only for a bit it starts to itch and hurt a tiny bit. But overall this headset is good recommend.

Got this for our son. It is really cool. Doesn't matter if you are a gamer or not, it is cool. Lots of games for all kinds of interests. Only downside is you have to have a Facebook account. I REALLY don't like that, but I knew it before purchasing.

I ordered the Oculus Quest 2 on a whim. As an avid gamer (Xbox), I was really excited to try out the Oculus Quest 2. I have a few minor complaints first: 1, the price and 2, the fact that you have to have a Facebook or meta whatever account. The graphics are also not great, and if I had to purchase a VR headset again I'd save up to get a real one, or I'd wait a few years until better headsets (better quality) are accessible to the average consumer. 

Another annoyance, that sure, was due to my ignorance, was that once you get all set up in your headset, you'll be taken straight to the store where you have to purchase all games for like, 20 plus dollars. I guess it's worth it for avid gamers, but having just spent 300 dollars on the headset, I felt defeated. Xbox has a range of free games and Game Pass, maybe Oculus could do something like that.  

To make everything worse, the remotes I received were cracked. I took it back and got a full refund, but I'm really disappointed because if the remotes had been fine, I'd have kept it. Sad :(

After reading many reviews and speaking with the customer service guy we were really excited to try the Oculus Quest 2 out. For the price its awesome and has lots of different games and experiences to choose from. I'm in love with the fishing game!

So far the product was good I would say a 8/10, I really enjoyed it but at times it is blurry but overall really good also made me feel motion sickness at some times. I would say I enjoyed the experience so far, Beat saber is amazing on it love it!

Great purchase, love the workouts and very entertaining. What I dont like are some of the apps that want you to pay monthly subscriptions and the head straps are white so they get dirty easily and sometimes when I adjust them they dont stay fitted

Purchased for my teenage son. He plays on this several hours a week. We have had for over a month now with no issues. Connects great to wifi. Graphics and audio are stunning. Its good for him to not be sitting in a gaming chair and up on his feet.

Great purchase, love the workouts and very entertaining. What I dont like are some of the apps that want you to pay monthly subscriptions and the head straps are white so they get dirty easily and sometimes when I adjust them they dont stay fitted

A good product and easy to use, the only Problem that I have is setting the boundary on it. It loses connection with the controllers and then you have to reset the boundary again. It gets tiring after the third time. Other than that it’s very fun!

I was on the fence about this for a very long time. Very glad that I decided to go out and get it. The application of an oculus goes beyond gaming-- you can use it for studying, working, watching netflix and much more. VR is definitely the future.

Surprised how well this works without a Pc. Not as visually good as my vive cosmos but it does the trick and no tethering. Just wish Facebook hadn’t tied it to Facebook. That’s pure garbage, if you lose your account you lose all games you pay for.

My son loves it! He stays active with it also! Has really nice scenery. I really recommend getting the warranty with it. After a year the vr was just black couldn’t see anything. Thank god for warranty they gave me a new one right away no hassle!

Ordered Friday morning(3am) and received it Monday around 4-4:30 pm. 

My boyfriend loves it! Everything was packaged nicely as well! 

Great price! Great company! Just patience if you have it delivered! If you don’t want to wait just pick it up!

It was good but I was just looking for something else because I’m in the basement with my brother I can’t have much light in my room and he has one to do I can’t play as much As I would like to and will when I have enough space in the near future

Amazing buy for entry level VR. Recommend getting an Oculus compatible cable. Bought one on Amazon for around $17. Can now play PCVR games from my desktop and the image quality is miles better. But only if you have a Gaming PC that can handle VR.

The horror games look great on tv, but when you have this thing on with the surround sound hearing all the little noises. It's completely mind blowing how surreal it is. The only thing is the vision can be a little tricky to get adjusted right.

The quest 2 is a great entry level vr headset! It’s cheap enough so you don’t beat yourself up if you don’t like it but has the power to bring great quality games straight to your face! This thing is amazing and I can’t wait to buy the next one!

I enjoy the zero cords vs the Valve Index that I’ve mainly been using but the quest definitely is no where near the quality if you have a grand for the index get it. But if you’re looking for cheap VR that’s good I’d 100% recommend this product.

Best electronic gift ever for pre teen and teen nephews and niece! Excitement and use has continued since they have received the Oculus. Ease in setting up via Facebook. Each has their own favorite “virtual reality”! Definitely worth the money!!

bought this for my grandkids I wasn't sure if they would like it or not. Let me tell you the whole family love this from Grandpa to dad to kids. The battery last about two hours and we can easily run it out. Best purchase I have made in a while.

Got 2 of these for my 2 grandsons.  Both just love them.  They’ve stopped playing on their Xbox or PlayStation to play their new Oculus.  They are actually moving and working up a sweat.  Best thing I could have gotten the.  Grampy is the hero.

I got this as a gift for my son, and oh my God, he loves it. He invited me to watch a movie on it and its amazing. Im going to get one for my boyfriend. He's in a wheelchair and I think this will be a great gift to take him away to another rem.

I purchased the Oculus Quest 2 just a couple of days ago but I am having so much fun (even as a 32-year-old math teacher). Both my husband and I are enjoying the headset and have had no problems. Hopefully, I can update you if anything changes.

I think it's not that good yet to spend 300$ on it. Need improve. When my brothers and sisters was playing 5-10 min they was not feeling well after. So be careful with your kids. It's not good when you play more than 10 min. It's my experience.

I use the Oculus mostly for Beat Saber and Supernatural. I love those apps because it's a fun way to get your body moving every day. The only thing that is the head strap is not the most comfortable thing and it's the first thing I swapped out.

Love it.. even better than a VR place. The sound is clear, graphics amazing and great games. For anyone confused on what they need, this set comes with all you need to play with a good selection of games. My bff even bought it for her kids too.

The product is okay for the first couple months and then after that the batrery dies quicker it takes longer to charge the tracking gets worse and feels laggy tldr would not reccomend buying unless you want a couple months of fun and only that.

Purchased this for my son, he loves it he says its the best. The graphics and vontrols are amazing true VR experience. The safety enhanced features are by far the best part is the abilities to map out and execute safe boundaries and play area.

Pros: Really fun system to use, very comfortable to wear, large selection of games for all kinds of taste. Can connect to a VR Ready PC for an even bigger selection of games

Cons: battery only last 3-4hrs, can extend if you use a battery pack

Really fun VR experience. Seems like a quality made product. Is very fun to play around with and lots of games to choose from. The only negative thing might be battery life but if you get yourself a charger pack you can play a good long while.

I bought this on impluse when I couldn't snag a PS5 by Xmas. I regret nothing! The Oculus is a highlight in my home for myself and whenever friends come by to hang out. Now they want to get one so we can all have couch convos together anytime.

By far the best VR headset currently available on the market. The graphics are cutting edge. The headset is comfortable to wear and the battery life is excellent. Overall this is a excellent product and I couldn’t be happier with my purchase.

OMG! I literally have been wanted this since the day it came out. So I decided to get it and I have no regrets! It is a game changer for gaming and workouts, I wish I would of bought it sooner. Don't overthink getting this, it is a must have!

Works great, very fun, and engaging. If you're looking to check out VR, this is a great way to get into it. I also recommend getting the elite headset with the battery pack to allow you even more time to play without needing to be plugged in.

The oculus quest is really fun to use, I just really wish it was better at pcvr. A lot of games are buggy and such but to be expected with experimental gameplay features. Overall its really comfy and isnt too heavy as well as has good quality

It was a birthday gift for my 11 yr old daughter and she loves loves loves it. I cant get into all the specs she knows how to speak gamer lingo lol but, Im happy with the purchase because she's happy and I can say Im getting my monies worth.

I love my Oculus! The gaming experience is awesome. I can hang out with all my friends virtually, at a concert or just watching tv. It's how I spend all my free time right now. Definitely add this to your gaming and entertainment collection!

Worked for like a week or two. Now i don't know whats wrong with it. I do not have much time to call costumer service. So i havent dealt with the problem. Provably will get fixed but as of now. Its not even useful.. So thats my review so far

I've been a VR user for a number of years, but the hassle of hooking everything up really deterred me from using it. The Quest 2 eliminates that and allows for a pickup and play experience. Super fun and look forward to all the games and fun

Though I don’t think that the library of the games are the best and most games are shorter than console game, the experience is amazing! Some of these games are truly immersive and a blast to play! I just wish I had friends who also had one!

The Oculus Quest 2 is a product I highly recommend. It has high quality visuals, and as someone who gets motion sick quite often from these types of products, I have had almost no issue with this in that regard.  Definitely worth the price!

Couldnt play it without getting motion sickness. Maybe mwnt for young kids but im 33 and everytine night i gave it 10-20 min of play time, i ended up with a massive headace and feeling sick the rest of the night because of it. Bought a ps4.

Visuals are some of the best I have used on any standalone vr system. The controls are super responsive to all movements while also knowing the boundaries around you so you aren’t running into walls haha. Game selection is fantastic as well

I actually got this for my kids for xmas. They cant put down there computers long enough play around with it. Fine with me. I play it every time I get a chance. Its fantastic and a great escape from the real world. Love it! Very satisfied.

YES! YES! YES!

Purchased an Oculus Quest 2 for my son after he had been asking and saving money to get. After we purchased his unit, I was impressed with it after I set the unit up for him. 

I turned around and got myself a unit as well!

Purchased as a gift for a teenager and they love it and have been playing on it everyday for the past week, even the husband likes playing it. There are demos and VR chat rooms to keep the kids busy without having to purchase games for it.

It’s good, fun and even lets burn some calories while having fun. The free games kind of suck though but the paid games are usually worth it, some even have full storylines like boneworks, in all I’d recommend this item to anyone, 5 stars.

we bought two of these for our boys so they could do things together.  it has taken some time for one of them to connect while the other has been perfect.  i am sure there is some user error, but it has been more challenging than expected.

The quality of the sound and pic are the best for such a small unit. Our son spends countless hours laughing and dancing around from the clarity live like videos.  Keeps him active,  instead of just sitting around on a video game console.

Oculus is a great system.  I have been a convert since the first one and have owned Oculus rift, rift 2, quest and now quest 2.  They have gotten better and better.  The VR community also consists of some really good people. Great device.

I mean it's an Oculus so your review of the headset will vary. I personally LOVE it but find it a bit heavy but ehh... evolution will have to kick in at some point. Nice to have it ready for pick up within hours. See you nerds in the Meta

From set up to playing the first game was easy.  Got more games as we got used to.  Some of the downsides were difficulty playing with eye glasses on and playing the games purchased from Google store.  Also, I wish HD quality were better.

Wow, Pretty awesome...
I got to see this at a friend's place...
I was pretty blown away...
Well enough that Santa put this under the tree...
I haven't even scratched the surface so far, so I am looking forward to learning more about it...

Really fun- for the whole family.  Surprised by how good the graphics are. Yes, cartoony, but really in-depth theming.  Our teenager has added this to his gaming collection after playing at a friends house and we are all glad that he did!

The best part is this is lighter than my 64 GB AND they gave me this one as my elite strap broke and the headset fell. Thank goodness for buying the insurance. So, I loved my first  one, this is better with enough memory to for RE and COD

My son loves this! He had the first Quest and sold it to get this. He says it has better looking graphics. We did need to purchase the strap that they charge $50 to buy. I gave it 4 stars because they should be including it at this price.

This was a great experience for me and I really loved it and was satisfied…tough you have to buy the games with a credit card and cant use any gift card but except for that all the free as well as paid game are just an amazing experience,

Love the new VR set! Just made a few upgrades that Oculus makes for them like the head strap and you can enjoy it with everyone at the party comfort and ease. Games are pretty cool and love how I can cast it to a tv for everyone to watch.

Excellent VR experience.  Easy to use, works well, a lot of fun.  The head strap that comes with it is kind of hard to get a good fit and it squashes too tightly to your face so I recommend buying the elite comfort head strap replacement.

We purchased two of these for our family to play together. We really enjoy Beat Saver and the Walking Dead games. It’s a great work out too! The graphics are phenomenal and the experience is like no other consoles I’ve ever played before.

This VR headset has worked well.  I got a 3rd party headstrap and face cover to make it even better.  It's really fun to play but the games can be expensive and then cost more money to unlock everything in the game once you buy each game.

Excellent experience for me. Happy that I purchased this product. This VR headset is providing hours of escape for me. You want to get away from reality? Purchase this VR headset. The door to a whole new world is open and waiting for you.

Got early Christmas gift for nephew, he's not very out going, I find out since I got him this he's been talking and hanging out with friends who also had one. Great Gift plus $60 dollars cheaper than the competition, you can't beat that!

The images are not as crisp as I hoped they would be. I think I would prefer to be watching HD on my TV. But we are going to be giving it a chance. But I suspect it will end up, it a box, on a shelf. Another disappointing Christmas gift…

Great for the family. The obly really negative thing i ca. Say is the spacer for glasses (kind of) doesnt work well. They push my glasses into my face. I can still play but usually have to take the oculus off after 2 songs on beat saber.

Oculus isnt my favorite had to bring first quest 2 in then now the second one i exchanged it for its very buggy i have good lighting in my house perfect pc for it and it just keeps kicking me out of every game i try to play linked or not

I was really impressed at the realism of this device.  I have balance issues and I was hesitant to try it out, but I found that wearing it did not cause me to lose my balance at all.  The games are fun and varied.  I highly recommend it.

Man where do I start. I have watched this console grow into an awesome tool that I use to meditate and also to watch movies and game. You will not get a better experience for the price . My entire family loves it and we use it everyday.

I’ve wanted this for 2 years now... just to play one game... I’ve realized it has so much more to offer and the graphics are amazing... If you are in the fence... get it!! my only complaint is the battery life is only about an hour or 2

I should give it a 1 cause my bf uses it the most light when I’m trying to sleep sitting there shooting people then the kids fighting over it I now have to buy another one but I rode the roller coaster it was pretty cool so it’s 5 stars

My son had been wanting this for a while and he loves it! It's a very cool VR set. a little heavy if you use it for too long but very nice. the controllers are also easy to use. You will need to buy games for it but ir's pretty awesome.

Very nice and kids love it. Wish it could move the player by walking in place instead of actually having to walk in an enclosed area. It is nice that it lets you set a boundary so you are alerted if you are going to walk into something.

Both my kids saved up their money for one of these and they love it!  Once they got it all set up with their computers they can't stay off them.  It is nice to see them up and moving around instead of sitting playing games all the time.

All in one unit here it works quite well my only two complaints is the strap it comes with is not very good. Second complaint is the battery only last about 3-4 hours so not bad but a little inconvenient. All in all cant beat the price.

bought this to use as I wanted to get started in VR.  Hopeful to do some auto racing games, but after realizing that this VR setup is not compatible with my iMac and prefers a specific video card(s),  I was forced to return it unopened.

Decent entry level VR headset. My only real complaint is that most of the games feel on par with app store games. They're good distractions for a few hours, but app store games cost between $1-10, and Oculus games typically cost $15-30.

Decent entry level VR headset. My only real complaint is that most of the games feel on par with app store games. They're good distractions for a few hours, but app store games cost between $1-10, and Oculus games typically cost $15-30.

Bought as a gift for my sixteen year old son.  He loves it!   Easy set up. Downloading games is convenient.   He enjoys the immersive gaming experience.   It’s funny to watch and listen to him play a game when he gets killed or scared.

I got my oculus on November 21 and I Am pretty satisfied but some of the games got me nauseous and I got beat saber it was fun but couldn’t get the custom songs and the headset was comfortable after all it was a pretty good experience.

Better than the Rift S in almost every way, resolution, refresh rate, etc. However, it sucks that you have to buy a cable to connect it to PC, understandable that as it's really meant to be a standalone device. Overall, it works great.

Son wanted these and his friends had them so I purchased so he can play with them. He actually gets a lot of exercise playing some of the games like boxing! It is another screen he spends time on but at least he is moving his body!! ):

Great implementation of VR. I think this is the best wireless VR on the market. Also, you have the option of adding a connection to a gaming PC for more advanced VR titles. I’d recommend this to just about anyone curious about trying V

Excellent headset. Reasonable game prices. 
It doesnt work best with my current prescription glasses. I will get contacts for a better experience. No fault of the Oculus. 

Must get a aftermarket strap. Original strap is not very good.

all my family enjoy using it and we were amaze on what its able to do. My dad loves the display quality, he can watch movies on hd and video in 360. It's also has many games you can enjoy. You might get addicted on it so be wise using,

OMG, I didn't expect this VR to be this great.  The graphics are amazing.  This purchase was my husband's Christmas gift, but after he allowed me and our daughter to try it, we will be purchasing 2 more so that we can play as a family.

Very easy to order and pick up at the store. There was a little confusion on pick up but it was resolved quickly. Products came earlier than expected. Website and chat features were easy and convenient to use. Will order online again!

I bought this for my kids. It was our of stock in stores so they ordered it for me.  I received it the next day at home. So that was great. My kids enjoy it very much. Everything looks great and has great interaction. I recommend it.

Im in love with this headset. Oculus just added a beta function to allow you to play PC VR games via WIRELESS play. This and the 120Hz refresh rate increase really have made this experience much more immersive when playing Skyrim VR.

I use it for PCVR and it is great. Clear, fast, and can stream video wirelessly. Also, you can double tap the side of the HMD and you can see the outside world. And all this for $300. FYI: Doesnt come with a USB A to USB C 3.0 cable.

Some of the games are pretty intense and give you the feeling that you’re falling, riding a coaster and can even make you nauseous. I have found that one hit game, app or activity that makes me hop on everyday but there’s still time!

The Oculus Quest 2 is a game-changer, offering high-quality standalone capabilities and the option to turn into a PC VR headset when necessary, and to top it off, it's cheaper than practically every other headset available right now.

Good beginner VR set. I bought this for my 10yr old son even though it's not meant for children. If you do the same, be sure to accompany your kid. This thing is very immersive, so his play time is limited to a couple times per week.

The Oculus Quest 2 didn't work well for me for 3 reasons:

1. Headaches - Vision Issues after using. 
2. Not many free apps, everything costs (a lot $30-50 a game)
3. Privacy / facebook account requirements.

Returned the device. =\

Just amazing. Simple and easy to use. No need for a pc unless you want other games. It’s easy to connect and using SideQuest was simple but, there’s a small learning curves for those not familiar with computers or gaming in general.

With this purchase you are going to be prompted to make a facebook account.. If you don't like facebook like me that can be a problem.. Because you can not play without one..Other then that.. This is a great product. Worth the money

I purchased this for my son who is 47 and his sons. They thoroughly enjoy it. At 74 I tried it and got extremely dizzy trying to use it. My son also got some vertigo after playing on it but loved it. The grandsons really enjoyed it.

Product is great to use. Virtual reality feeling really able to portray the real life feeling when using the VR headset. You can literally forget that it’s actually just a virtual reality and thinking that you are in the real world.

The unit its self is great. The games are not as advanced as I expected them to be. The headset its self is rather comfortable battery life is okay. Would recommend getting the occulus link cable so you can play while its charging.

Best way to get into VR. Highly recommend to anyone that is at all curious about virtual reality. I recommend buying the 128gb you dont need the extra storage unless you plan on going all out and having 20+ VR titles on the device.

The oculus is so cool we bought it for our 9 yr old son for Christmas and the entire family has been playing it since, even the grandparents. The only downfall would be the battery life it doesn't last long at all maybe 2 hours max

I bought this for my son for Christmas. I'm really happy with the shipping time and how well this was packaged. I'm sure my son will love it. He already has the Oculus Go from years ago, so this should only be better than the last.

This this is amazing. I bought this because my kids gad been talking about it for a while. So i took the chance and got one. Just setting it up i was very impressed. My boys love it. I even got ky wife to try it and she was amazed.

I bought this for my grandchildren.  For 9&7 they are pretty tech savvy.  They absolutely loved this gift.  I wish the battery life was better but they possibly did not give it full charges in order to keep playing.  It was a hit!

Love it. Been playing Beat Saber daily. Wish the battery on the headset lasted longer. I definitely get a few days of play per charge but it could be better. Still very worth it!! Excited to explore the other game types available.

Doesn’t focus very well even after making adjustments to lences….Games are really expensive , need mor trial or demos ..kinda wheerie of putting out so much for a game you haven’t tried yet …some of the free games are really cool!

Great product and console for the price. High resolution screen and comes with a lot of accessories to make comfortable (I have glasses and can barely feel them under the headset). Wish it came with more games and a carrying case.

Just awesome! Only complaints I have is the fogging of the lenses when playing an active game, and the head strap could be better. Otherwise really cool VR experience. Can only be experienced to really understand how good this is.

Amazing all-around VR headset for someone who wants to get into VR without paying the high price of a top of the line headset like the Index. Pretty good video, nice fit with the elite strap, and great PCVR gameplay with the Link.

This thing is fun, not my first VR system but the wireless format of this one is quite convenient. The one thing that makes it annoying is that it tends to hurt the cheekbones - tried adjusting it different ways - but still hurts.

Just couldn't pass on the sound bar amd subwoofer. Our old soundbar was all used up, so when we went looking for a replacement, we just happen to find a newer model, and at a discount too!!! It's a great price for awesome sound!!!

Best bang-for-the-buck VR headset on the market! Purchased this for my kid for Christmas, he's been playing non-stop ever since. If going to purchase, look into a third party headstrap as the factory one is a little uncomfortable.

This is the best thing I have spent my money on to be honest this is so fun I would recommend it to a friend. you should get it and play some good games like gorilla tag beat saber and a lot of other games I highly recommend this.

Purchased for my grandkids for Christmas but I already have one.  It’s great! I used to have a gaming computer with a HTC Vive.  Depending on the game … this is just as good and it’s lightweight and no cords required.  I love it!

I tried for months to get a PS5 and with each fail I became less interested.  My wife had the idea of getting one of these and now's there's a very good chance I'll be purchasing a second one because the kids will need their own.

When I bought this I was not sure if I would like it but it turned out to be very easy to setup and was not at all what I thought it might be. The quality is amazing for the price and it is the best VR headset I have used so far.

The Quest 2 is a major improvement coming from CV1 in almost every aspect while being half the price.

It's odd having to add in a Facebook account to maintain and use the headset, but it looks like it'd be removed in the future.

It was very blurry no matter what I tried to do to correct it. It looks great and I know people who had better experiences than I did, but for me it's a no go. I really wanted to like it, but unfortunately it's getting returned.

its amazing piece.. from my 7yo to my 70yo parents enjoing it.its makes everyone feel jittery inside from the great views to the actual workouts available.. i just wish they did better with the battery life.. hence the 4 stars..

I am very happy with my purchase I am 74 years old and I really don’t do games I did get it to enjoy seeing other countries by touring it has meant a lot to me I would recommend it to anyone who would like to do the same as I do

All I can say is wow.  Everything you read or hear can not properly describe how amazing the Oculus is.   Setup is quick and simple.   The visuals and just stunning.  Everything is intuitive and feels natural.  Highly recommend!

I was lucky to get the last oculus in the store and I couldn’t wait to use it. Setting up the oculus was very easy. I did mines on the oculus app. You need Facebook to activate it but that wasn’t no exception for me. Once it was set up and updated , I did tutorial and under a hour knew how to work it. Im glad I can cast it to tv and air link it to pc. My experience with the games were great. No issues with the games I played on the app. Controls simple and easy to remember. There are two things that I ran into that had hiccups. 

1) buying games. Buying games didn’t work for me when trying to purchase in app. It had to be on the website which that was customer support told me. 

2) steam vr. Now my pc is vr ready but I when run steam vr it’s a little laggy and don’t always show my games. Played one and the display was cut off .it a little shaky to me but it’s nothing but a short fix. 

Oculus is great overall when you really explore it. My only regret  is not getting 256gb. I recommend get a long cord for it though when you still wanna play while charging.

Bought this for my son and he loves it.  Actually the whole family does.  It has definitely given us all hours of entertainment either by playing or watching and laughing at the person playing.  Such a fun virtual gaming system.

WOW!! Didn’t think I was gonna enjoy VR but this takes the cake not gonna lie some games give me motion sickness but most are playable and very enjoyable. My kids won’t let me play bc I don’t know how to get off once I’m on. Lol

It was really good and I've used many vr's, this is one of the best vr headsets. There may be more in the future. I would recommend this. I bought 2 for my friend and asked him, he replied: I got dizzy, but got used to it soon.

Just awesome, flawless and can't believe this was only $300 we ended buying 3 of these.

Using for VR Boxing (Thrill of the Fight) and others are so much fun and pretty much a workout. Meditation and more, super great purchase!

Very easy to use and more realistic than others. Being able to virtually meet up with people and play sports against them in great.  The built in safe zone is easy to set up and works very well. All my family enjoys playing it.

Very easy to use and more realistic than others. Being able to virtually meet up with people and play sports against them in great.  The built in safe zone is easy to set up and works very well. All my family enjoys playing it.

My 13 yo son loves his new birth gift. He upgraded from the oculus go. He plays with it all the time. Definitely a good buy. Only problem is we needed to purchase an additional wire to hook it up to the computer. That cost $80.

Amazing headset with really advanced games on it. Wouldn’t recommend if you have motion sickness. Games are cheap around 10-20 bucks and are really immersive. Very easy to use and setup. It is a lot of fun for anyone of any age

Definitely better than expected. Total immersion in what ever environment you play in. Make sure you have space or set your guardian before playing. If prone to motion sickness always check the info of the game before purchase.

This product is on another level of entertainment.  Kids got this for Christmas and now they prefer this over their game systems.  I am shortly going to have to get another one because of its constant use between the two kids.

I purchased this for my 11yr old as a Christmas gift specifically for the game Beat Saber, and we absolutely love it, it is now something the whole family plays. Well definitely be purchasing another Oculus in the near future.

Good overall, I had fun with it. I wish the lens adjust could be more flexible.
Occasionally there is loud fan noise even though I just turned it on and the device is not hot; able to fix it with a few shakes most of the time.

For the price it’s a great entry point into VR. It is a bit heavy compared to others due to the battery which means the new head strap needs to go. Easy to setup on wireless. I have yet to be able to get it to work with my PC.

These are great. So Realistic . They have come a long way since the first VR days. Headset is a little heavy but you get used to it. Battery lasts about 3 hours of full time usage But overall GREAT PRODUCT. Highly Recommended.

For the few weeks I've had it its been amazing. You might want to have black tape nearby or something to cover the sensor thats in the middle of the oculus because theres a problem with it. But other than that its pretty good.

Love it, this is a must have! This is the new adult escape. Let the kids have x box, we have VR. Get a referral link before you create your oculus account, you can get a $30 credit for games at the oculus store. See you in VR.

Very easy to use and setup was a breeze.  Family of four and we all have one so playing games together is a lot of fun.  VR is pretty immersive and, although graphics are not PS5 quality. you do forget you're not on a console.

So fun. The entertainment is endless on here. You just have to use it a little at time before you get used to it. Took me about a month to get use to it. Suggest taking breaks still after you get used to it.

I was skeptical at first because I have pretty much every console that is out. But the Oculus is so much more different and pretty fun and my kid loves it. I would definitely recommend you buy one and test it out for yourself

Everyone knows the cons and pros of these by now, so I'll keep this brief.  
I don't remember what exactly the issue was, but I remember that it was big enough for me to end up returning it after three days of ownership and numerous hours spent crawling forums, and reddit and reading complaints of people having the exact same issue as myself.

To quote what I told the CSR when I returned it and they asked "what the reason for return was?"
My response:  "It has an issue where occasionally upon bootup it decides to fail to recognize that it's in a safety zone, and you have to create a new one, then it has issues pairing with the controllers as well, and detecting that it's on your head despite having clean sensors, and cameras and being meticulously maintained.  This issue has existed since launch, and it has yet to be resolved.  That's unacceptable, imho as a programmer."


Sure, it's a better value than the constantly breaking index, and has better resolution than the vive, as well as more portability, but that's all for naught if you can't actually USE it...

Can’t believe it doesn't work after ten days. It suddenly became all black with the logo. You can’t even turn it off. Feel lucky it is still returnable and it died after only 5/6 times uses. It brought us lots of fun though.

I love my Oculus … not only is it fun to play alone, but my favorite part is playing with my grown children and grandchildren.  It connects us … young an old can play together and it’s so real you feel like you are together.

Present for my son. He was overjoyed on Christmas. It was easy to get up and running and games were also easy to download. Got few free but paid for full version of some. Still figuring out some things but its a nice system.

Great product just not great for children. Headset is to big and doesn't adjust to smaller heads. Buttons on handles are a little separated for smaller hands as well. This was not made with children or petite people in mind.

Plays good wished they have more games and they need a option available where you can either run off WiFi or. A Ethernet cord in case your out of range of WiFi and  the battery seems to die really fast. Appreciate your time!

One week using it and the rubber frame that goes around the eyes got loose and there’s no way to put it back. Will bring it back to Best Buy to see if they will replace it or try to fix it. Software is great. Hardware sucks.

Tracking keeps dropping coming from vive and rift 1 this is annoying. The on and play is a plus but the lack of apps is also a big draw back haven’t tried air play yet but not having access to steam library is a big drawback

I like the idea-but this device is cumbersome to use and tends to crash or reset frequently. As others noted you will get a headache after more than a few minutes of use. We wanted to like this but really not worth the price

This is unbelievable I played a game with a roller coaster and I was on my couch I really felt like I was moving and I really felt like I  was on one. This Oculus is amazing I would recommend this if you are looking for a VR

really good vr headset for all in one, it handles everything well. Personally wished the battery was larger but having a portable charger takes care of that. It struggles while making the play area when I max out its radius.

Works perfectly… unless you are prone to motion sickness. Then in that case you’re better off playing video games the standard way. Also, it is a major hassle setting it up to play Steam games however, so that’s a star down.

Amazing VR It feels very light on the head and the battery last long enough.
Also the game experience it’s really good even to watch movies or Netflix and make you feel like a movie theater are you five stars it’s very good.

Though the VR is great as far as the VR function goes but to keep on my son's head without eventually sliding down on his face is a struggle. We have tried everything and if an adult is using it, there are no issues to fit.

A lot more fun then I thought it would be.  The only problem I had was lack of accessories like lense clothe and carrying case, and how the strap that it comes with is really uncomfortable after wearing longer then 10 mins.

This RV system is amazing! It makes me keep going. I usually live a sedentary life but playing this at least 30 min makes me lose a few calories. Also, the games in this console are pretty budge friendly. I would recommend.

The only thing I don’t like is how I spent $300 on this and the games are so expensive. Like, if you would want to play a game that would be maybe like $10, it is $30. The glasses spacer also doesn’t really work that well.

My son loves this.  I played it as well and it’s a lot of fun, I’m almost tempted to buy my own. It’s definitely worth the purchase.  He plays boxing games which leave him sweating later so it’s also a great exercise tool.

Got this for my son for his Birthday and he loves it.  In fact the whole family loves to play Beat Saber.  I like how you download all the games, so there is no cartridges to store or lose.  I highly recommend this VR set.

My son wanted the oculus system and so far he has loved it. We did have a problem with one of the controllers not connecting but the problem was replaced quickly and without problems. Definitely recommend buying the stand.

this vr headset got me moving again its amazing. i got this quest hoping it would getting moving and it worked worth the $300 alone. but not just that talking to people around the world and seeing there movments is great.

If you have never played VR it will knock your socks off. If you have a gaming pc you can play even more high resolution versions of the game when you pair it with a router connected to your PC. Cannot recommend it enough

This Is my first VR system and I’m not disappointed. I did my research of the product first like everyone and it’s surpassed my expectations. It’s price point is pretty it’s makes friends and family just have a good time.

I bought this for his birthday.
My nine year old grand son loves this device. I am not sure of its staying power, but for the past couple days he has played with it continuously. He is excited to play against his friends.

Solid construction. Poor eye spacing mechanism for lenses. Medium clarity. Medium amount of app selection. About what you’d expect for the price. Stand alone and pc vr with out cable is a nice touch which is what sold me.

One of the most amazing experiences! Gaming in a whole new way! Mind blowing! Can go on and on, the game experience is great and so unlike other systems. Watching Netflix was even awesome and different. Highly recommend!!

I love that this car is white and that the headset is not as big as oculus 1, also it is so much more real then the oculus 1 i don’t know how but man it’s like your really there doing this stuff and it is school friendly.

My son loves it.  Still working.  No issues so far.  Tried it out myself.  Great effects and sense of being elsewhere.  Don't expect the graphics to be on par with the PS5 but the virtual environments are very convincing.

Purchased this for my 9 year old grandson , Had to create him a FaceBook account to begin set up which was easy to do as he will only be using it for this.  Wish there were gift card options just for Oculus instead of CC

I got this for my husband, it’s actually really fun. And a great way to exercise indoors when you live in a really state! Only thing is everything costs money and using it for long periods of time can give you a headache

Something fun and new to do during Covid! Stay home fun for everyone in the family. Go places around the world that you'll never get to see. Very cool that you can interact with others around the world in real time, too.

I bought this for my son & he loves it.  He’s 15.  It’s funny to watch him play with it.  I see ads for exercise games & different varieties of games, I will one day try them.  It’s expensive but worth it for endless fun

Love them! I ordered these through the website and received them in a timely manor! I am having an issue down loading the gift card that came wigh my order but i am sure when i call Best Buy it will get straightened out.

Overall fun game, battery life could be better but I dont mind as it limits the kids game time. I know that in time the games will get better and better so im excited to see what is to come. Beat Saber app is a must try!

Something has to be absolutely outstanding for me to take the time to write a review, and the Oculus is worthy of a 5 star rating. My family loves it, and it is probably the most amazing gaming system I've ever played.

This headset exceeded my expectations. I thought "cool a VR headset" but it offers so much as far as gaming, tours and experiences. Wish I had gotten it sooner. A recommendation for anyone on the fence. Definitely a buy

It’s a decent VR headset tho wish I could have gotten a rift s instead. Only issue is the battery life, it’s starts to die right as I turn it on for a min. Turn it on after charging it 100% two minutes later it’s at 90%

The oculus 2 is fun to use in short sessions. I get tired of wearing the headset after about 45 minutes. Some of the games I’ve played are great. Beat Saber, Eleven table tennis and Walkabout mini golf are my favorites.

These are awesome for stand alone goggles. Very easy to setup, and adjust. Battery life is a little short, but that is to be expected. Controllers feel great in your hands, and it’s easy to reach the buttons and sticks.

Totally mind blowing. Unlike any other VR experience before. Wish I had bought one for my son earlier. From poker to roller coasters, the entire family got to use it over New Year’s Eve  and the reactions are priceless.

Very cool and surreal VR system. I like the adjustment straps this system has making it fit perfectly allowing the display to be seen clearer. Has a lot of free games you can try and accessing everything is super simple

I was one that was not on board with the VR craze at first. I made a decision to purchase this headset to trst the waters in the VR realm. This has been one of my best purchases this year, for $300 well worth the money.

Bought 2 to play with the wife and I and now have purchased 8 more to share with the rest of our family. Great way to explore the world and to have fun golfing with friends and meeting new people from around the world.

Fantastic game play for family. My wife and sons luv this the moment they laid their hands on it. Totally immersive and the games and control, awesome. Trying to start a new workout routine with this, highly addictive.

Excellent and very underrated gaming console.  I would recommend for casual gamer and hard core gamer.  Games are very reasonably priced.  Only downside is that it forces you to get a Facebook account so be forewarned.

Been having alot of fun with this. There’s also piece of mind that with oculus, if u get a game you’re not that fond of. They’ll refund you if play less than a few hours and request it in the few days of first getting.

Love the Oculus! I got it to play Supernatural. Everything was easy to set up, with limited instructions. It's all pretty intuitive. 
The headset is pretty comfortable, but if you do physical stuff, get ready to sweat!

Awesome VR headset. Worth the money. Games are very fun. Took a while to get used to but the tutorials definitely help a lot and are fun to go through. Have played this for hours already within the first couple of days

This is all my 9 year asked for from Santa, it arrived quickly and she loves it. I had no idea that she could play with other friends who had one too. The whole family has joined in. This is the best gift for all ages!

Great to be wires free!  The only downside is the graphics capability is much less than the wired Rift headset.  Imagine making a Lambo out of cardboard.  Gameplay is still fun, even if everything looks like cardboard.

Awsome! The kids and I couldn’t believe how kool this VR was! So much fun and easy to use! Will be getting another one so we can do together and not have to wait for turns. Lol! Very durable and comfortable! Thank you!

We purchased for our 16 year old son for Christmas. He loves it and we do as well. We tried the roller coaster and got motion sickness just like we do on the real thing. Very impressive Virtual Reality implementation.

Best gift I received so far and it doesn't break the bank. 
I was even able to get a PS5 around the same time I got this and since then, I've been using this thing more than anything else.
Great gift for the holidays.

Got this for the wife and she loves it. Grab a Viveport subscription and have a decent VR capable PC if you want to get the best experience. Still good for a standalone headset though if you want to get into VR cheap.

My kid loves it. it was on his wish list for his birthday but we were on easy about it due to how much it cost. But we took the leap I’m glad we did. There’s all kinds of fun to be had on it. Even the adults enjoy it.

Love my oculus! Best Buy helped me order and I was able to pick up on the day Best Buy told me to. In fact I received a pick up message earlier than expected. Seamless shopping at Best Buy.  And the Oculus is fire!!!!

My daughter loves her systems she wanted a p5 but couldn’t get it but was a big surprise wen she seen the oculus she cried (a Happpyy Cry) because she wanted a VR for Xmas so I got the next best thang and she loves it

Quality of pixels can get blurred at times but thats me being picky due to playing on 4k tvs and computer screens but overall its great! Great to play and cast to chromecast so family and friends can see what im doing

Having a great time exploring the games and experiences available.  Only negative is the head gear that comes with it isn't adequate to counterbalance the weight of the mask so I had to order another one from Amazon.

Fun for the first few weeks then usage goes downhill. Beat saber and job simulator are very fun. Watch your kids when they go into a online chat. There are. I filters and they can hear and speak to just about anyone.

In love but battery level drains fast when your having fun which isn’t bad but wish it had longer battery life  would recommend buying a new strap and a battery pack that’s last 10 hours other then that great product

Amazing. Best 300$ ive ever spent. I would recommend it to anyone thinking about it. Brand new experience that got me excited to play games again its so immersive. You actually feel like your in the game. 8 thumbs up

This thing is a piece of crap.  I am on my second device and both times the amber light flashes stating "not working correctly" but nobody to help...  Should be the easiest item to install in the world and make work.
